( Tibetan : ` ` north peak '' ) is a mountain situated between the Main Rongbuk and East Rongbuk Glaciers in Tibet immediately north of Mount Everest . Changtse is connected to Mount Everest via the North Col . The given elevation of 7,543 metres is from modern Chinese mapping . eos
is connected to Mount Everest via the North Col . The given elevation of 7,543 metres is from modern Chinese mapping . Some authorities give 7,583 metres . eos
, often called Mount Cheaha , is the highest point in the US state of Alabama . Cheaha_Mountain is located a few miles northeast of Talladega in scenic Cheaha State Park , which contains a lodge , restaurant , and other amenities . The highest point is marked with a USGS marker ( photo below ) in front of Bunker Tower , a stone Civilian Conservation Corps building with an observation deck on top . eos
is located a few miles northeast of Talladega in scenic Cheaha State Park , which contains a lodge , restaurant , and other amenities . The highest point is marked with a USGS marker ( photo below ) in front of Bunker Tower , a stone Civilian Conservation Corps building with an observation deck on top . Near the peak is Bald Rock , which was recently improved with a wheelchair - accessible wooden walkway that provides an impressive overlook of the surrounding region . eos
is part of the Talladega Mountains , a final southern segment of the Blue Ridge , unlike other elevations of the Appalachians in north Alabama , which are part of the Cumberland Plateau . Cheaha_Mountain is a host to several commercial and public service transmitters . These transmitters , along with sundry structures dating back to commercial schemes by the State of Alabama in the Seventies , stand in stark contrast to the surrounding natural environment . eos
is a host to several commercial and public service transmitters . These transmitters , along with sundry structures dating back to commercial schemes by the State of Alabama in the Seventies , stand in stark contrast to the surrounding natural environment . The Calhoun County Amateur Radio Association has a repeater near the peak and Alabama Public Television has its transmitter for WCIQ TV ( and digital DTV 52 ) . eos
. Cheaha_Mountain was opened to the public as a state park on june 7 , 1939 . eos
was opened to the public as a state park on june 7 , 1939 . eos
is located in the US state of Montana on the eastern border of Glacier National Park and the Blackfeet Indian Reservation . Chief_Mountain is one of the most prominent peaks along the Rocky Mountain Front , a 200 mile ( 321 km ) long overthrust fault , known as the Lewis Overthrust , which extends from central Montana into southern Alberta , Canada . Chief_Mountain is easily seen from Montana and Alberta due to the rapid 5,000 foot ( 1,524 m ) altitude gain over the Great Plains which are immediately east of Chief_Mountain . eos
is one of the most prominent peaks along the Rocky Mountain Front , a 200 mile ( 321 km ) long overthrust fault , known as the Lewis Overthrust , which extends from central Montana into southern Alberta , Canada . Chief_Mountain is easily seen from Montana and Alberta due to the rapid 5,000 foot ( 1,524 m ) altitude gain over the Great Plains which are immediately east of Chief_Mountain . Chief_Mountain has been a sacred mountain to Native American tribes for hundreds of years . eos
is easily seen from Montana and Alberta due to the rapid 5,000 foot ( 1,524 m ) altitude gain over the Great Plains which are immediately east of Chief_Mountain . Chief_Mountain has been a sacred mountain to Native American tribes for hundreds of years . Chief_Mountain was seen by white explorers in the late 1700s and Chief_Mountain was known as ` ` Kings Peak '' on maps produced in the United Kingdom in 1795 . eos
. Chief_Mountain has been a sacred mountain to Native American tribes for hundreds of years . Chief_Mountain was seen by white explorers in the late 1700s and Chief_Mountain was known as ` ` Kings Peak '' on maps produced in the United Kingdom in 1795 . eos
has been a sacred mountain to Native American tribes for hundreds of years . Chief_Mountain was seen by white explorers in the late 1700s and Chief_Mountain was known as ` ` Kings Peak '' on maps produced in the United Kingdom in 1795 . Meriwether Lewis , coleader of the Lewis and Clark Expedition , saw Chief_Mountain in 1805 and called Chief_Mountain ` ` Tower Mountain '' . eos
was seen by white explorers in the late 1700s and Chief_Mountain was known as ` ` Kings Peak '' on maps produced in the United Kingdom in 1795 . Meriwether Lewis , coleader of the Lewis and Clark Expedition , saw Chief_Mountain in 1805 and called Chief_Mountain ` ` Tower Mountain '' . The name was changed in the late 1800s in reflection of Blackfeet naming of Chief_Mountain which was ` ` Great Chief '' . eos
was known as ` ` Kings Peak '' on maps produced in the United Kingdom in 1795 . Meriwether Lewis , coleader of the Lewis and Clark Expedition , saw Chief_Mountain in 1805 and called Chief_Mountain ` ` Tower Mountain '' . The name was changed in the late 1800s in reflection of Blackfeet naming of Chief_Mountain which was ` ` Great Chief '' . eos
in 1805 and called Chief_Mountain ` ` Tower Mountain '' . The name was changed in the late 1800s in reflection of Blackfeet naming of Chief_Mountain which was ` ` Great Chief '' . When Glacier National Park was created in 1910 , the summit and most prominent eastern slopes of Chief_Mountain were located within the park , leaving only the lower slopes within Blackfeet jurisdiction . eos
` ` Tower Mountain '' . The name was changed in the late 1800s in reflection of Blackfeet naming of Chief_Mountain which was ` ` Great Chief '' . When Glacier National Park was created in 1910 , the summit and most prominent eastern slopes of Chief_Mountain were located within the park , leaving only the lower slopes within Blackfeet jurisdiction . eos
which was ` ` Great Chief '' . When Glacier National Park was created in 1910 , the summit and most prominent eastern slopes of Chief_Mountain were located within the park , leaving only the lower slopes within Blackfeet jurisdiction . The eastern face of Chief_Mountain rises over 1,500 vertical feet ( 457 m ) and the easiest route on this section is rated class 4 by mountaineers . eos
were located within the park , leaving only the lower slopes within Blackfeet jurisdiction . The eastern face of Chief_Mountain rises over 1,500 vertical feet ( 457 m ) and the easiest route on this section is rated class 4 by mountaineers . The rock is also primarily sedimentary and provides poor anchor points , which in turn is a contributing factor to the difficulty rating . eos
rises over 1,500 vertical feet ( 457 m ) and the easiest route on this section is rated class 4 by mountaineers . The rock is also primarily sedimentary and provides poor anchor points , which in turn is a contributing factor to the difficulty rating . Henry Stimson and two other explorers , including a Blackfeet Indian , climbed the difficult eastern face on september 8 , 1892 , and this is the first known ascent of Chief_Mountain by white explorers . eos
by white explorers . Upon the summit , Stimson 's party observed ceremonial remains including bison skulls that had been left behind by Native Americans . The eastern face of Chief_Mountain was n't successfully climbed again until 1951 . eos
was n't successfully climbed again until 1951 . Though the summit can be gained by approaching from the west , the easiest access is from the east , and the Blackfeet tribe issues camping and access permits to cross reservation lands . National Park Service visitor centers at St. Mary , Montana and at Many Glacier have additional information available . eos

is a mountain in the Khumbu region of eastern Nepal . Southern neighbors include Num Ri and Baruntse while Imja Tse ( a popular trekking peak ) lies immediately to the west . The first ascent was made by Olaf Rieck , Dieter Rülker , Markus Walter and Günter on november 12 , 1999 by the north face . eos
, sometimes known as ` ` the bride of Kangchenjunga '' , is a mountain in the Himalayas , straddling the border between Yadong County of Tibet and the Paro district of Bhutan . Chomolhari is sacred to Tibetan Buddhists who make an annual pilgrimage from Phari Dzong to the holy lake Chomo Lharang at c 5100 m just north of Chomolhari . The north face rises over 2700 metres ( 9,000 ft ) above the barren plains . eos
is sacred to Tibetan Buddhists who make an annual pilgrimage from Phari Dzong to the holy lake Chomo Lharang at c 5100 m just north of Chomolhari . The north face rises over 2700 metres ( 9,000 ft ) above the barren plains . Despite Chomolhari notability and spectacular visibility from the major trade route from India into Tibet 's Phari Valley , Chomolhari has seen very little climbing activity , probably because of access restrictions on the Bhutanese side and the difficulty of the routes from the Tibetan site . eos
. The north face rises over 2700 metres ( 9,000 ft ) above the barren plains . Despite Chomolhari notability and spectacular visibility from the major trade route from India into Tibet 's Phari Valley , Chomolhari has seen very little climbing activity , probably because of access restrictions on the Bhutanese side and the difficulty of the routes from the Tibetan site . eos
notability and spectacular visibility from the major trade route from India into Tibet 's Phari Valley , Chomolhari has seen very little climbing activity , probably because of access restrictions on the Bhutanese side and the difficulty of the routes from the Tibetan site . The first ascent was made in May 1937 by a five - man British expedition , with F Spencer Chapman and Sherpa Pasang Dawa Lama reaching the summit from Bhutan over the south - east spur . The second ascent was in 1970 over the same route by a joint Bhutanese - Indian military expedition led by Colonel Narendra Kumar . eos

is a peak in the Himalaya range of the Northern Areas of Pakistan . Chongra_Peak is one of the many subsidiary summits of the Nanga Parbat massif . Chongra_Peak lies just south of the Indus River , in the Northern Areas of Pakistan . eos

is one of the highest mountains in the Boundary Ranges , a group of subranges of the northern Pacific Coast Range of British Columbia and Alaska . Chutine_Peak lies just east of the Stikine Icecap , and west of the Stikine River . Chutine_Peak is notable for Chutine_Peak huge west face : the drop to Chutine Lake is 2,600 m ( 8,530 feet ) in 3.5 km ( 2.2 miles ) . eos
lies just east of the Stikine Icecap , and west of the Stikine River . Chutine_Peak is notable for Chutine_Peak huge west face : the drop to Chutine Lake is 2,600 m ( 8,530 feet ) in 3.5 km ( 2.2 miles ) . Due to Chutine_Peak remoteness , however , Chutine_Peak is rarely visited . eos

is the highest peak within the Big Horn Mountains in the US state of Wyoming . Cloud_Peak rises to an elevation of 13,167 feet ( 4,013 m ) and Cloud_Peak provides onlookers with dramatic views and vistas . Cloud_Peak can be climbed most easily from the western side . eos
rises to an elevation of 13,167 feet ( 4,013 m ) and Cloud_Peak provides onlookers with dramatic views and vistas . Cloud_Peak can be climbed most easily from the western side . Cloud_Peak is located in the 189,000 acre ( 765 km ² ) Cloud Peak Wilderness within Bighorn National Forest . eos
provides onlookers with dramatic views and vistas . Cloud_Peak can be climbed most easily from the western side . Cloud_Peak is located in the 189,000 acre ( 765 km ² ) Cloud Peak Wilderness within Bighorn National Forest . eos
can be climbed most easily from the western side . Cloud_Peak is located in the 189,000 acre ( 765 km ² ) Cloud Peak Wilderness within Bighorn National Forest . The northeast slope of Cloud_Peak is a deep cirque which harbors Cloud Peak Glacier , the last active glacier in the Bighorn Mountains . eos
is located in the 189,000 acre ( 765 km ² ) Cloud Peak Wilderness within Bighorn National Forest . The northeast slope of Cloud_Peak is a deep cirque which harbors Cloud Peak Glacier , the last active glacier in the Bighorn Mountains . Cloud_Peak is on the border between Johnson County and Big Horn County in Wyoming and Cloud_Peak eos
is a deep cirque which harbors Cloud Peak Glacier , the last active glacier in the Bighorn Mountains . Cloud_Peak is on the border between Johnson County and Big Horn County in Wyoming and Cloud_Peak is the high point of both counties . eos
is on the border between Johnson County and Big Horn County in Wyoming and Cloud_Peak is the high point of both counties . As the high point of an isolated range , Cloud_Peak has a particularly high topographic prominence of 7,067 ft ( 2,154 m ) . eos
is the high point of both counties . As the high point of an isolated range , Cloud_Peak has a particularly high topographic prominence of 7,067 ft ( 2,154 m ) . eos
has a particularly high topographic prominence of 7,067 ft ( 2,154 m ) . In fact , Cloud_Peak has the second greatest topographic prominence in Wyoming , only barely beaten by Gannett Peak , and the sixteenth highest topographic prominence in the contiguous United States . eos

is located in the Teton Range , Grand Teton National Park , Wyoming , immediately southeast of Grand Teton . Cloudveil_Dome is in the central portions of the range , immediately east of South Teton and Cloudveil_Dome is sometimes considered to be part of what is collectively known as the Cathedral Group . Cloudveil_Dome rises to the south of Garnet Canyon . eos

Cloudveil_Dome has a variety of mountaineering routes and since Cloudveil_Dome is near to more popular climbing zones , Cloudveil_Dome is often overlooked . eos

is the most active volcano in Mexico , and Colima_volcano has erupted more than 40 times since 1576 . Colima_volcano is about west of Mexico City and south of Guadalajara , Jalisco . eos

is a mountain in the western Pyrenees of Huesca , situated on the east side of the Aragon Valley near the towns of Villanúa ( to the south ) and Canfranc ( to the west ) . Collarada is 2,886 meters AMSL high . A great view of Collarada can be obtained from Larres , a village that gained life again after its castle dated XIV century got restaured by the ` ` Amigos del Serrablo '' . eos

is a mountain in Banff National Park , 20 km north of the town of Banff . Copper_Mountain_Alberta was named in 1884 by George M Dawson after he had climbed to a mining site setup by Joe Healy and JS Dennis in 1881 . Healy and Dennis claimed they had found a copper deposit at the site . eos
was named in 1884 by George M Dawson after he had climbed to a mining site setup by Joe Healy and JS Dennis in 1881 . Healy and Dennis claimed they had found a copper deposit at the site . It was also at this point that Dawson spotted and named Mount Assiniboine . eos

was made in 1573 by the Bolognese captain Francesco De marchi together with Francesco Di Domenico . The usual route of ascent is via the western ridge , although a number of other routes exist including one that ascends the southern face . eos
is the largest and highest volcano in Peru , attaining an impressive elevation of 6,377 metres ( 20,922 ft ) ( some maps show Coropuna as high as 6,425 metres ( 21,079 ft ) ) . Coropuna is located about 150 km northwest of Arequipa , the second largest city in Peru . eos
as high as 6,425 metres ( 21,079 ft ) ) . Coropuna is located about 150 km northwest of Arequipa , the second largest city in Peru . Coropuna has a summit plateau which extends over 12 x 20 km ( 8 x 13 mi ) , with six separate summit cones rising above it . eos
is located about 150 km northwest of Arequipa , the second largest city in Peru . Coropuna has a summit plateau which extends over 12 x 20 km ( 8 x 13 mi ) , with six separate summit cones rising above it . The true summit is at the northwest end of the plateau , although the southwest summit may be equal or greater in height depending on the depth of seasonal snow . eos
has a summit plateau which extends over 12 x 20 km ( 8 x 13 mi ) , with six separate summit cones rising above it . The true summit is at the northwest end of the plateau , although the southwest summit may be equal or greater in height depending on the depth of seasonal snow . A permanent ice cap of about 130 square kilometres ( 50 sq mi ) in area covers the summit region , extending down to roughly 5,300 metres ( 17,400 ft ) on the north side and 4,800 metres ( 15,700 ft ) on the south . eos
is a stratovolcano in the Andes , located about 75 kilometres ( 50 mi ) south of Quito , Ecuador . Cotopaxi is part of the chain of volcanoes around the Pacific plate known as the Pacific Ring of Fire . Cotopaxi is one of the highest active volcanoes in the world . eos
is part of the chain of volcanoes around the Pacific plate known as the Pacific Ring of Fire . Cotopaxi is one of the highest active volcanoes in the world . However , claims that Cotopaxi is the highest active volcano in the world are incorrect . eos
is one of the highest active volcanoes in the world . However , claims that Cotopaxi is the highest active volcano in the world are incorrect . Llullaillaco volcano is considerably higher and is definitely in an active phase , having erupted as recently as 1877 . eos
is the highest active volcano in the world are incorrect . Llullaillaco volcano is considerably higher and is definitely in an active phase , having erupted as recently as 1877 . Ojos del Salado is higher still , and there are indications near its summit of recent activity , although its remoteness precludes a definitive statement as to whether it is currently active . eos
since 1738 . Numerous valleys formed by powerful lahars ( mudflows ) surround the volcano . This poses a high risk to the local population , their settlements and fields . eos

most violent eruptions in historical times occurred in the years 1744 , 1768 , and 1877 . is a distinctive mountain in the Cradle Mountain - Lake St Clair National Park , Tasmania , Australia . Rising to 1,545 metres above sea level Cradle_Mountain is one of the principal tourist sites in Tasmania , owing to Cradle_Mountain natural beauty . Cradle_Mountain is composed of dolerite columns , similar to many of the other mountains in the area . eos
is one of the principal tourist sites in Tasmania , owing to Cradle_Mountain natural beauty . Cradle_Mountain is composed of dolerite columns , similar to many of the other mountains in the area . The area around Cradle_Mountain has a large number of day walks , as well as being one terminus of the Overland Track . eos

is one of the fourteeners of Colorado , in the heart of the Sangre de Cristo Range . Crestone_Needle is part of a group of four fourteeners known as ` ` the Crestones '' , headed by Crestone Peak ( 0.6 miles/1 km northwest of Crestone_Needle ) and also including Kit Carson Mountain and Humboldt Peak . While not as high as Crestone Peak , and connected to it by a high , jagged ridge , Crestone_Needle is regarded as a worthy climb in Crestone_Needle own right . eos
is part of a group of four fourteeners known as ` ` the Crestones '' , headed by Crestone Peak ( 0.6 miles/1 km northwest of Crestone_Needle ) and also including Kit Carson Mountain and Humboldt Peak . While not as high as Crestone Peak , and connected to it by a high , jagged ridge , Crestone_Needle is regarded as a worthy climb in Crestone_Needle own right . The easiest route is the South Face ( or South Couloir ) , usually accessed via Broken Hand Pass from South Colony Lakes . eos
) and also including Kit Carson Mountain and Humboldt Peak . is regarded as a worthy climb in Crestone_Needle own right . The easiest route is the South Face ( or South Couloir ) , usually accessed via Broken Hand Pass from South Colony Lakes . This is an exposed scramble with a few tricky moves , and is one of the more difficult standard routes among the Colorado fourteeners . eos

is the Ellingwood Arete , also known as the Ellingwood Ledges Route . This is a steep ridge on the northeast side of Crestone_Needle , leading directly up from the Upper South Colony Lake basin to the summit . It is a mildly technical rock climb ( 5.7 on the Yosemite Decimal Scale ) . eos
, leading directly up from the Upper South Colony Lake basin to the summit . It is a mildly technical rock climb ( 5.7 on the Yosemite Decimal Scale ) . It is particularly popular because of its inclusion in the well - known book Fifty Classic Climbs of North America by Steve Roper and Allen Steck . eos
is the seventh highest peak in the US state of Colorado . Crestone_Peak is the second highest peak in the Sangre de Cristo Range after Blanca Peak . Crestone_Peak rises in the Sangre de Cristo Wilderness above the east side of the San Luis Valley along the boundary between Saguache and Custer counties , approximately 5 miles ( 8 km ) eos
is the second highest peak in the Sangre de Cristo Range after Blanca Peak . Crestone_Peak rises in the Sangre de Cristo Wilderness above the east side of the San Luis Valley along the boundary between Saguache and Custer counties , approximately 5 miles ( 8 km ) east of the town of Crestone . eos
rises in the Sangre de Cristo Wilderness above the east side of the San Luis Valley along the boundary between Saguache and Custer counties , approximately 5 miles ( 8 km ) east of the town of Crestone . Crestone_Peak shares Crestone_Peak name with the nearby Crestone Needle , another fourteener of the Sangre de Cristo Range . eos

is the highest point in the Pennine hills of Northern England . Cross_Fell is also the highest point in England outside of the Lake District . The summit is a stony plateau being part of a 20 km long ridge running North West to South East , which also incorporates Little Dun Fell ( 842 m ) and Great Dun Fell ( 849 m ) . eos
is also the highest point in England outside of the Lake District . The summit is a stony plateau being part of a 20 km long ridge running North West to South East , which also incorporates Little Dun Fell ( 842 m ) and Great Dun Fell ( 849 m ) . The three adjoining fells form an escarpment that rises steeply above the Eden Valley on its south western side and drops off more gently on its north eastern side towards the South Tyne and Tees Valleys . eos
. On a clear day there are excellent views from the summit across the Eden Valley to the mountains of the Lake District . On the northern side of Cross_Fell there are also fine views across the Solway Firth to the Southern Uplands of Scotland . eos
there are also fine views across the Solway Firth to the Southern Uplands of Scotland . Cross_Fell is prone to dense hill fog and fierce winds . A shrieking noise induced by the Helm Wind ( see below ) is a characteristic of the locality . eos
is prone to dense hill fog and fierce winds . A shrieking noise induced by the Helm Wind ( see below ) is a characteristic of the locality . Cross_Fell can be an inhospitable place for much of the year . eos
can be an inhospitable place for much of the year . In ancient times Cross_Fell was known as ` ` Fiends Fell '' and believed to be the haunt of evil spirits . It has been speculated that this last feature may be why Cross_Fell became known as Cross Fell ( ` cross ' meaning ` angry ' ) . eos
was known as ` ` Fiends Fell '' and believed to be the haunt of evil spirits . It has been speculated that this last feature may be why Cross_Fell became known as Cross Fell ( ` cross ' meaning ` angry ' ) . Another theory is that at some time a cross was placed at the summit in order to ward off the spirits . eos
became known as Cross Fell ( ` cross ' meaning ` angry ' ) . Another theory is that at some time a cross was placed at the summit in order to ward off the spirits . But the origin of the name is not known for sure . eos
, sometimes called Ellison Peak , is a mountain located in Strathcona Provincial Park on Vancouver Island in British Columbia . eos
is the highest peak of the Culebra Range , a subrange of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains in the United States . Culebra_Peak is the southernmost fourteener in Colorado . Culebra_Peak is also the only fourteener on private land . eos
is the southernmost fourteener in Colorado . Culebra_Peak is also the only fourteener on private land . Access is limited , and a fee ( currently $ 100 per person ) is charged to climb Culebra_Peak . eos
is also the only fourteener on private land . Access is limited , and a fee ( currently $ 100 per person ) is charged to climb Culebra_Peak . Ownership of and access to the land , both for recreational and other activities , have been controversial issues for many years , involving multiple lawsuits and even occasional violence . eos
. Ownership of and access to the land , both for recreational and other activities , have been controversial issues for many years , involving multiple lawsuits and even occasional violence . While Culebra_Peak is one of the lower fourteeners , Culebra_Peak is actually the fourth most topographically prominent peak in the state , due to Culebra_Peak separation from the other fourteeners by the relatively low La Veta Pass . eos

is mountain in the Dinarides of Bosnia and Herzegovina , located in northern Herzegovina , most of Cvrsnica is located in the Herzegovina - Neretva Canton municipalities of East Mostar and Jablanica while the smaller part of Cvrsnica , around 10 % is located in the municipality to Posušje . The highest peak is 2228 metres . Cvrsnica is surrounded by the river Neretva from the east ( 20 km ) , its tributaries Doljanka ( 18 km ) from the north and Drežanka ( 19.8 km ) from the south , the Dugo Polje field ( 12 km ) and Vran mountain from west . eos
is located in the Herzegovina - Neretva Canton municipalities of East Mostar and Jablanica while the smaller part of Cvrsnica , around 10 % is located in the municipality to Posušje . is surrounded by the river Neretva from the east ( 20 km ) , its tributaries Doljanka ( 18 km ) from the north and Drežanka ( 19.8 km ) from the south , the Dugo Polje field ( 12 km ) and Vran mountain from west . Cvrsnica consists of several plateaus - Plas and Muharnica on north , Mala Čvrsnica on south . There are more than ten summits above 2000 m ( Plocno 2228 m , Veliki Jelinak 2179 m , Veliki Vilinac 2118 m , etc . ) , vertical cliffs ( Pesti brdo , Mezica stijene , Strmenica ... ) . eos

( 3,630 m ) is the highest mountain in the Urner Alps in Switzerland . Dammastock summit ridge forms the border between the cantons of Uri and the Valais . Dammastock was first climbed by Albert Hoffmann - Burkhardt with guides Johann Fischer and Andreas von Weissenfluh on 28 july 1864 . eos

is the highest point in the Tushar Mountains of south - central Utah . The Tushars are the third - highest range in the state , after the Uinta Mountains and the La Sal Range , though Delano_Peak is surpassed in height by at least thirty - one other Utah peaks . Delano_Peak is 12,169 feet ( 3,709 meters ) high , and Delano_Peak is snow - capped for much of the year . eos
is surpassed in height by at least thirty - one other Utah peaks . Delano_Peak is 12,169 feet ( 3,709 meters ) high , and Delano_Peak is snow - capped for much of the year . Located in the Fishlake National Forest , Delano_Peak is the highest point of both Beaver and Piute counties . eos

is one of the mountains in the Valley of the Ten Peaks , located on the Continental Divide on the border of Banff and Kootenay national parks in Canada . Deltaform_Mountain was originally named Saknowa by Samuel Allen but Walter Wilcox named Deltaform_Mountain to Deltaform_Mountain official title in 1897 as Deltaform_Mountain resembles the Greek letter delta . Deltaform_Mountain was first climbed in 1903 by A Eggers and HC Parker who were guided by Christian and Hans Kaufmann . eos

is a mountain in the Swiss Alps , west of Zermatt and north of the Matterhorn . Dent_Blanche is at the head of the Val d'Hérens . Dent_Blanche was first climbed on july 18 1862 by T. S. Kennedy , W. Wigram , J. Croz and J. Konig via the south ridge ( Wandfluegrat ) . eos
is at the head of the Val d'Hérens . Dent_Blanche was first climbed on july 18 1862 by T. S. Kennedy , W. Wigram , J. Croz and J. Konig via the south ridge ( Wandfluegrat ) . The first winter ascent by the north ridge was completed by P. Crettaz and J. Gaudin on march 2 , 1963 . eos
was first climbed on july 18 1862 by T. S. Kennedy , W. Wigram , J. Croz and J. Konig via the south ridge ( Wandfluegrat ) . The first winter ascent by the north ridge was completed by P. Crettaz and J. Gaudin on march 2 , 1963 . Dent_Blanche should not be confused with Dents Blanches ( 2,728 m ) located on the France - Switzerland border . eos
should not be confused with Dents Blanches ( 2,728 m ) located on the France - Switzerland border . eos
( 4,171 m ) is a mountain in the Pennine Alps of Italy and Switzerland . The first ascent of Dent_dHerens was by Florence Crawford Grove , William Edward Hall , Reginald Somerled Macdonald , Montagu Woodmass , Melchior Anderegg , Jean - Pierre Cachat and Peter Perren on 12 august 1863 . Dent_dHerens had been attempted a few days before by Edward Whymper , Jean Antoine Carrel and Luc Meynet but Whymper insisted that they retreat from their planned route up the west ridge because of loose rock . eos
was by Florence Crawford Grove , William Edward Hall , Reginald Somerled Macdonald , Montagu Woodmass , Melchior Anderegg , Jean - Pierre Cachat and Peter Perren on 12 august 1863 . Dent_dHerens had been attempted a few days before by Edward Whymper , Jean Antoine Carrel and Luc Meynet but Whymper insisted that they retreat from their planned route up the west ridge because of loose rock . Whymper was annoyed that he had not chosen the line taken up the Grandes Murailles glacier and the south - west flank by Melchior Anderegg on the first ascent and later wrote : This was the only mountain in the Alps that I have essayed to ascend , that has not , sooner or later , fallen to me . eos
had been attempted a few days before by Edward Whymper , Jean Antoine Carrel and Luc Meynet but Whymper insisted that they retreat from their planned route up the west ridge because of loose rock . Whymper was annoyed that he had not chosen the line taken up the Grandes Murailles glacier and the south - west flank by Melchior Anderegg on the first ascent and later wrote : This was the only mountain in the Alps that I have essayed to ascend , that has not , sooner or later , fallen to me . Our failure was mortifying ... eos
for four days before rescue , with Berbeka later dying in hospital and Herncarek and Naef requiring amputations . The Aosta hut ( 2,781 m ) is used for the normal route . eos
( It . : Dente del Gigante ) eos
has two distinct summits , eighty - eight feet apart and separated by a small col ( an ` extremely awkward notch ' according to W W. Graham ) : * Pointe Graham ( 4,013 m ) , first ascent by W W. Graham with guides Auguste Cupelin and Alphonse Payot on 20 august 1882 . * Pointe Sella ( 4,009 m ) , first ascent by Jean Joseph Maquignaz with son Baptiste Maquignaz and nephew , Daniel Maquignaz on 28 july 1882 . eos
had remained unclimbed during the so - called Golden age of alpinism , and Dent_du_Geant was a much - coveted peak in the 1870s , repelling many parties who attempted Dent_du_Geant mostly from the Rochefort ridge . In 1880 the strong team of Albert F Mummery and Alexander Burgener tried to force a passage via the south - west face but were repelled by a band of slabs , causing Mummery to exclaim ` Absolutely inaccessible by fair means ! ' The following huts serve Dent_du_Geant : eos

is a stratovolcano located in the Maule Region of central Chile . Descabezado_Grande is capped by a 1.4 kilometres ( 0.9 mi ) wide ice - filled caldera and named for Descabezado_Grande flat - topped form , as descabezado means ` ` headless '' in Spanish . A smaller crater eos
is capped by a 1.4 kilometres ( 0.9 mi ) wide ice - filled caldera and named for Descabezado_Grande flat - topped form , as descabezado means ` ` headless '' in Spanish . A smaller crater about 0.5 kilometres ( 0.3 mi ) wide is found in the northeast part of the caldera , and it has active fumaroles . eos
flat - topped form , as descabezado means ` ` headless '' in Spanish . A smaller crater about 0.5 kilometres ( 0.3 mi ) wide is found in the northeast part of the caldera , and it has active fumaroles . eos
is composed of andesite and rhyodacite lava flows along with pyroclastic flow deposits . Descabezado_Grande has a basal diameter of about 10 x 12 km ( 6 x 8 mi ) and a total volume of about 30 cu km ( 7 cu mi ) . Along with Cerro Azul , only 7 km to the south , Descabezado_Grande lies at the center of a 20 x 30 km ( 12 x 20 mi ) volcanic field . eos

( धौलागिरी ) is the seventh highest mountain in the world . Dhaulagiri forms the eastern anchor of the Dhaulagiri Himal , a subrange of the Himalaya in the Dhawalagiri Zone of north central Nepal . Dhaulagiri lies northwest of Pokhara , an important regional town and tourist center . eos
forms the eastern anchor of the Dhaulagiri Himal , a subrange of the Himalaya in the Dhawalagiri Zone of north central Nepal . Dhaulagiri lies northwest of Pokhara , an important regional town and tourist center . Across the deep gorge of the Kali Gandaki to the east lies the Annapurna Himal , home to Annapurna I , one of the other eight - thousanders . eos

is a mountain in the Swiss Alps , best known for the nearby ski resort of Les Diablerets . Diablerets is situated in the French - speaking part of Switzerland , in the easternmost area of the Canton of Vaud . There is a glacier on Diablerets , officially titled Glacier de Tsanfleuron but known as Glacier 3000 due to its elevation of 3000 metres . eos

is one of the more prominent mountains located on the border of Croatia and Bosnia and Herzegovina . Dinara Latin name is Adrian oros while the current name is suspected to be derived from the name of an ancient Illyrian tribe that lived on the eastern slopes of Dinara . Dinara is best known for the fact that Dinara name is the base for the name of a large mountain chain called the Dinaric Alps or Dinarides . eos
Latin name is Adrian oros while the current name is suspected to be derived from the name of an ancient Illyrian tribe that lived on the eastern slopes of Dinara . Dinara is best known for the fact that Dinara name is the base for the name of a large mountain chain called the Dinaric Alps or Dinarides . The Dinarides are known for being composed of karst - limestone rocks - as is Dinara . eos

is hardly Mediterranean . In fact , Dinara marks the border of the area with a much colder , mountain climate . There are no inhabited areas on Dinara itself and human presence consists mostly of small shacks that belong to the herdsmen from the nearby valleys such as that of the Cetina river . eos

( "" Thai : ดอยอินทนนท์ "" ) is the highest mountain in Thailand . Doi_Inthanon was also known in the past as Doi Luang ( meaning big mountain ) or Doi Ang Ka , meaning the crow 's pond top . eos
was also known in the past as Doi Luang ( meaning big mountain ) or Doi Ang Ka , meaning the crow 's pond top . Near Doi_Inthanon base was a pond where many crows gathered . eos
base was a pond where many crows gathered . The name Doi Inthanon was given in honour of the king Inthawichayanon , one of the last kings of Chiang Mai , who was concerned about the forests in the north and tried to preserve them . He ordered that after his death his remains shall be placed at Doi_Inthanon , Doi_Inthanon was then renamed . eos

( 11,358 ft / 3,462 m ) is situated in the Absaroka Range in the US state of Wyoming , and Eagle_Peak_Wyoming is the tallest mountain in Yellowstone National Park . Eagle_Peak_Wyoming is also one of the highest points in the Washakie Wilderness area of Shoshone National Forest . eos

is a peak in Texas , USA . El_Capitan_Texas lies within the Guadalupe Mountains National Park . El_Capitan_Texas is the eighth - highest peak in Texas , and El_Capitan_Texas is considered the ` ` signature peak '' of West Texas . eos
lies within the Guadalupe Mountains National Park . El_Capitan_Texas is the eighth - highest peak in Texas , and El_Capitan_Texas is considered the ` ` signature peak '' of West Texas . El_Capitan_Texas is the southern terminus of the Guadalupe escarpment , an ancient limestone reef that forms the present - day Guadalupe Mountains . eos
is the eighth - highest peak in Texas , and El_Capitan_Texas is considered the ` ` signature peak '' of West Texas . El_Capitan_Texas is the southern terminus of the Guadalupe escarpment , an ancient limestone reef that forms the present - day Guadalupe Mountains . El_Capitan_Texas is guarded by cliffs on three sides , and those faces are rarely climbed due to the unstable condition of the rock and the sheer nature of the peak . eos
is considered the ` ` signature peak '' of West Texas . El_Capitan_Texas is the southern terminus of the Guadalupe escarpment , an ancient limestone reef that forms the present - day Guadalupe Mountains . El_Capitan_Texas is guarded by cliffs on three sides , and those faces are rarely climbed due to the unstable condition of the rock and the sheer nature of the peak . eos
is the southern terminus of the Guadalupe escarpment , an ancient limestone reef that forms the present - day Guadalupe Mountains . El_Capitan_Texas is guarded by cliffs on three sides , and those faces are rarely climbed due to the unstable condition of the rock and the sheer nature of the peak . Hikers can scramble up to the summit by first climbing to near the summit of Guadalupe Peak and scrambling down to the south to the Guadalupe Peak - El Capitan saddle , then up the backside of El_Capitan_Texas . eos
is guarded by cliffs on three sides , and those faces are rarely climbed due to the unstable condition of the rock and the sheer nature of the peak . Hikers can scramble up to the summit by first climbing to near the summit of Guadalupe Peak and scrambling down to the south to the Guadalupe Peak - El Capitan saddle , then up the backside of El_Capitan_Texas . A permit is required as there is no trail from Guadalupe Peak to El_Capitan_Texas . eos
. A permit is required as there is no trail from Guadalupe Peak to El_Capitan_Texas . El_Capitan_Texas , used as a signal peak for hundreds of years by travellers in the area , is a stunning peak rising quite abruptly out of the Chihuahuan Desert floor in West Texas . eos
. El_Capitan_Texas , used as a signal peak for hundreds of years by travellers in the area , is a stunning peak rising quite abruptly out of the Chihuahuan Desert floor in West Texas . El_Capitan_Texas sheer face greets visitors approaching the Headquarters Visitor Center at Guadalupe Mountains National Park from both the south and the northeast . eos

is a fourteen thousand foot mountain peak in the US state of Colorado . El_Diente_Peak is located in the Lizard Head Wilderness in the San Miguel Range of the San Juan Mountains , in Dolores County approximately 10 miles ( 16 km ) north of Rico . eos
is located in the Lizard Head Wilderness in the San Miguel Range of the San Juan Mountains , in Dolores County approximately 10 miles ( 16 km ) north of Rico . The topographic prominence of El_Diente_Peak is only 239 ft ( 73 m ) , so by a strict 300 foot cutoff rule , El_Diente_Peak would not be counted as a separate peak from El_Diente_Peak higher neighbor Mount Wilson . eos
is only 239 ft ( 73 m ) , so by a strict 300 foot cutoff rule , El_Diente_Peak would not be counted as a separate peak from El_Diente_Peak higher neighbor Mount Wilson . However the 3/4 mile ( 1.2 km ) connecting ridge is a significant climbing challenge ( Class 4/5 ) , making El_Diente_Peak more independent than El_Diente_Peak prominence would indicate . Hence El_Diente_Peak is often regarded as a fully - fledged fourteener . eos

is often regarded as a fully - fledged fourteener . El_Diente_Peak is one of the more dramatic peaks in Colorado in terms of local relief and steepness . As a result , El_Diente_Peak is one of the most challenging climbs among Colorado 's fourteeners . eos
is one of the more dramatic peaks in Colorado in terms of local relief and steepness . As a result , El_Diente_Peak is one of the most challenging climbs among Colorado 's fourteeners . All routes involve at least class 3 scrambling on loose talus , and poor route - finding can expose the climber to more difficult and dangerous terrain . eos

is a cinder cone volcano in Michoacán , central Mexico , on the SW slope of the central plateau , 33 mi/53 km SE of Uruapan ( also know to be located in an area known as the Michoacan - Guanajuato volcanic field ) . El_Jorullo has four smaller cinder cones which have grown from El_Jorullo . The vents of El_Jorullo are aligned in a northeast to southwest direction . eos
has four smaller cinder cones which have grown from El_Jorullo . The vents of El_Jorullo are aligned in a northeast to southwest direction . Lava from these vents cover nine square km around El_Jorullo . eos

are aligned in a northeast to southwest direction . Lava from these vents cover nine square km around El_Jorullo . Later eruptions produced lavas that had higher silica contents making them thicker than the earlier basalts and basaltic andesites lavas . eos
. Later eruptions produced lavas that had higher silica contents making them thicker than the earlier basalts and basaltic andesites lavas . El_Jorullo crater is about 1,300 by 1,640 ft ( 400 by 500 m ) wide and 490 ft ( 150 m ) deep . eos
crater is about 1,300 by 1,640 ft ( 400 by 500 m ) wide and 490 ft ( 150 m ) deep . El_Jorullo is one of two known volcanos to have developed in Mexico in recent history . The second , born about 183 years later , was named Parícutin after a nearby village that it eventually destroyed . eos

( 5,822 m ) is a stratovolcano located in southern Peru near the city of Arequipa . This city , second largest in the country , lies at the foot of El_Misti in a fertile valley located 2,400 m above sea level . El_Misti has become the city 's enduring symbol . eos
in a fertile valley located 2,400 m above sea level . El_Misti has become the city 's enduring symbol . Most of the city 's colonial buildings were constructed from El_Misti white volcanic stone ( sillar ) . eos
has become the city 's enduring symbol . Most of the city 's colonial buildings were constructed from El_Misti white volcanic stone ( sillar ) . El_Misti last eruption was in 1784 . eos
white volcanic stone ( sillar ) . El_Misti last eruption was in 1784 . With El_Misti snow - capped , perfect cone , El_Misti stands at 5,822 m and El_Misti lies between the mountain Chachani ( 6,075 m ) and the volcano Pichu - Pichu ( 5,669 m ) . eos
last eruption was in 1784 . With El_Misti snow - capped , perfect cone , El_Misti stands at 5,822 m and El_Misti lies between the mountain Chachani ( 6,075 m ) and the volcano Pichu - Pichu ( 5,669 m ) . These impressive mountains , located northeast of Arequipa , are visible almost year - round , but especially during winter ( May - september ) . eos
snow - capped , perfect cone , El_Misti stands at 5,822 m and El_Misti lies between the mountain Chachani ( 6,075 m ) and the volcano Pichu - Pichu ( 5,669 m ) . These impressive mountains , located northeast of Arequipa , are visible almost year - round , but especially during winter ( May - september ) . El_Misti has three concentric craters . eos
stands at 5,822 m and El_Misti lies between the mountain Chachani ( 6,075 m ) and the volcano Pichu - Pichu ( 5,669 m ) . lies between the mountain Chachani ( 6,075 m ) and the volcano Pichu - Pichu ( 5,669 m ) . These impressive mountains , located northeast of Arequipa , are visible almost year - round , but especially during winter ( May - september ) . El_Misti has three concentric craters . eos
has three concentric craters . In the inner crater fumarole activity can be seen . Near the inner crater six Inca mummies and rare Inca artifacts were found in 1998 during a month - long excavation directed by the archaeologists Johan Reinhard and Jose Antonio Chavez . eos
. The Pastores route , which is more used , as its starting point is nearer to the city of Arequipa , starts in 3,300 m. Usually a camp is made in 4,500 m at Nido de Aguilas . eos
( 936 m ) is the second highest peak in Trinidad 's northern range and El_Tucuche is noted for El_Tucuche interesting plateau shape . is the tallest mountain in the Gallatin Range of southern Montana , close to the Wyoming border and Electric_Peak rises to an altitude of 10,969 feet ( 3,343 m ) . Electric_Peak has some of the greatest physical relief in Yellowstone National Park , rising 3,389 feet ( 1,033 m ) above Electric_Peak base . Electric_Peak was named during the first ascent in 1872 by the United States Geological Survey . eos
rises to an altitude of 10,969 feet ( 3,343 m ) . Electric_Peak has some of the greatest physical relief in Yellowstone National Park , rising 3,389 feet ( 1,033 m ) above Electric_Peak base . Electric_Peak was named during the first ascent in 1872 by the United States Geological Survey . eos
has some of the greatest physical relief in Yellowstone National Park , rising 3,389 feet ( 1,033 m ) above Electric_Peak base . Electric_Peak was named during the first ascent in 1872 by the United States Geological Survey . Members of the Hayden Survey led by Henry Gannett experienced electrical discharges from their hands and hair after a lightning event on the summit . eos

is located in the Elk River Range of the Vancouver Island Ranges of British Columbia . At 2195 m , Elkhorn_Mountain is the second highest peak on the Vancouver Island , second only to the nearby Golden Hinde which lies 15 km to the south . Elkhorn_Mountain is located in the 2,500 km ² Strathcona Provincial Park , 24 km NE of Gold River . eos

, or Ellingwood Peak , is a fourteener in the US state of Colorado . Ellingwood_Point is located at the southern end of the Sangre de Cristo Range , approximately 1/2 mile ( 1 km ) northwest of Blanca Peak . Ellingwood_Point lies on the border between Alamosa County and Huerfano County . eos
is located at the southern end of the Sangre de Cristo Range , approximately 1/2 mile ( 1 km ) northwest of Blanca Peak . Ellingwood_Point lies on the border between Alamosa County and Huerfano County . Ellingwood_Point is named for Albert Russell Ellingwood , an early pioneer of climbing in the Western United States and in Colorado in particular . eos
lies on the border between Alamosa County and Huerfano County . Ellingwood_Point is named for Albert Russell Ellingwood , an early pioneer of climbing in the Western United States and in Colorado in particular . Ellingwood_Point only barely qualifies as an independent peak under the 300 foot topographic prominence cutoff which is standard in Colorado . eos
is named for Albert Russell Ellingwood , an early pioneer of climbing in the Western United States and in Colorado in particular . Ellingwood_Point only barely qualifies as an independent peak under the 300 foot topographic prominence cutoff which is standard in Colorado . Ellingwood_Point is also quite close to Ellingwood_Point parent peak , Blanca Peak . eos
only barely qualifies as an independent peak under the 300 foot topographic prominence cutoff which is standard in Colorado . Ellingwood_Point is also quite close to Ellingwood_Point parent peak , Blanca Peak . Hence Ellingwood_Point inclusion in fourteener lists has been somewhat controversial . eos
is also quite close to Ellingwood_Point parent peak , Blanca Peak . Hence Ellingwood_Point inclusion in fourteener lists has been somewhat controversial . However most authorities do consider Ellingwood_Point a true fourteener . eos
parent peak , Blanca Peak . Hence Ellingwood_Point inclusion in fourteener lists has been somewhat controversial . However most authorities do consider Ellingwood_Point a true fourteener . eos

is one of the highest mountains in the northern portions of the US state of Virginia . At 4,463 feet ( 1,360 m ) , Elliott_Knob is located on the northern point of the ridge known as Great North Mountain . A small , naturally growing stand of spruce trees are on the summit , indicating that the altitude is just high enough to support tree species normally found hundreds of miles to the north . eos
is located on the northern point of the ridge known as Great North Mountain . A small , naturally growing stand of spruce trees are on the summit , indicating that the altitude is just high enough to support tree species normally found hundreds of miles to the north . Otherwise oak and hickory trees are the most common types found on Elliott_Knob . eos
. Elliott_Knob is entirely within George Washington and Jefferson National Forests . The area around Elliott_Knob is inhabited by a wide array of fauna including Black Bears , White - tailed Deer and the elusive Bobcat . eos
is entirely within George Washington and Jefferson National Forests . The area around Elliott_Knob is inhabited by a wide array of fauna including Black Bears , White - tailed Deer and the elusive Bobcat . There is a Forest Service lookout tower , which is closed to the public , on top of Elliott_Knob . eos
is inhabited by a wide array of fauna including Black Bears , White - tailed Deer and the elusive Bobcat . There is a Forest Service lookout tower , which is closed to the public , on top of Elliott_Knob . A primitive jeep trail ascends Elliott_Knob from the east but it is also closed to public vehicles . eos
. A primitive jeep trail ascends Elliott_Knob from the east but it is also closed to public vehicles . The jeep trail is used by the USFS to gain access to a fire lookout on the summit , and rises over 2,000 feet ( 610 m ) in less than 4 miles ( 6.4 km ) . eos
from the east but it is also closed to public vehicles . The jeep trail is used by the USFS to gain access to a fire lookout on the summit , and rises over 2,000 feet ( 610 m ) in less than 4 miles ( 6.4 km ) . The only access for the public is on foot and along with the jeep trail , several other trails can be used to ascend to the top , each averaging 5 miles ( 8 km ) in length and climbing up to 2,300 feet ( 700 m ) from the trailheads . eos
is a high shield volcano Emi_Koussi lies at the south end of the Tibesti Mountains in the central Sahara of northern Chad . Emi_Koussi is the highest mountain in Chad , and the highest in the Sahara . Emi_Koussi is one of several in the Tibesti massif , and Emi_Koussi reaches 3445 m in altitude , rising 2.3 km above the surrounding sandstone plains . eos
lies at the south end of the Tibesti Mountains in the central Sahara of northern Chad . Emi_Koussi is the highest mountain in Chad , and the highest in the Sahara . Emi_Koussi is one of several in the Tibesti massif , and Emi_Koussi reaches 3445 m in altitude , rising 2.3 km above the surrounding sandstone plains . eos
is the highest mountain in Chad , and the highest in the Sahara . Emi_Koussi is one of several in the Tibesti massif , and Emi_Koussi reaches 3445 m in altitude , rising 2.3 km above the surrounding sandstone plains . Emi_Koussi is 60 by 80 km wide . eos
is one of several in the Tibesti massif , and Emi_Koussi reaches 3445 m in altitude , rising 2.3 km above the surrounding sandstone plains . Emi_Koussi is 60 by 80 km wide . Two nested calderas cap Emi_Koussi , eos
reaches 3445 m in altitude , rising 2.3 km above the surrounding sandstone plains . Emi_Koussi is 60 by 80 km wide . Two nested calderas cap Emi_Koussi , eos
is 60 by 80 km wide . Two nested calderas cap Emi_Koussi , the outer one being about 12 by 15 km in size . eos
, the outer one being about 12 by 15 km in size . Within it on the southeast side is a smaller caldera , about 2 - 3 km wide and 350 m deep . eos
. Emi_Koussi has been used as a close analog to the famous Martian volcano Elysium Mons . One of the most important morphological differences between volcanoes on Mars and Earth is the widespread furrowing of the surface due to flowing water on terrestrial volcanoes . eos
has been used as a close analog to the famous Martian volcano Elysium Mons . One of the most important morphological differences between volcanoes on Mars and Earth is the widespread furrowing of the surface due to flowing water on terrestrial volcanoes . The furrows are shallow valleys . eos
or Fan Si Pan eos
is located in the Lào Cai province in Northwest Vietnam , 9 km southwest of Sa Pa Township in the Hoang Lien Son Mountain Range . Fansipan is dubbed ` ` the Roof of Indochina '' ; Fansipan is to be approved as one of the very few ecotourist spots of Vietnam , with about 2,024 floral varieties and 327 faunal species . The topography of Fansipan is varied . eos
is dubbed ` ` the Roof of Indochina '' ; Fansipan is to be approved as one of the very few ecotourist spots of Vietnam , with about 2,024 floral varieties and 327 faunal species . The topography of Fansipan is varied . Muong Hoa Valley , at the lowest altitude ( 950 to 1 000 m ) , is created by a narrow strip of land at the base on the east side of Fansipan . eos
is to be approved as one of the very few ecotourist spots of Vietnam , with about 2,024 floral varieties and 327 faunal species . The topography of Fansipan is varied . is a mountain range in north - eastern Papua New Guinea , at 5.8 S 146.1 E The unnamed highest point of Finisterre_Range 5 ° 57 ' 15S , 146 ° 22 ' 30E , which is ranked 45th in the world by prominence , is usually quoted at 4,175 m , but SRTM data suggests that it is nearer to 4,120 m. Finisterre_Range runs into the Saruwaged Range to the east and together they form a natural barrier between the Ramu and Markham valleys to the south and Vitiaz Strait to the north . Many rivers originate in Finisterre_Range , including the Ramu . The Finisterre Range campaign ( 1943 - 44 ) of World War II , including a series of actions known as Battle of Shaggy Ridge , saw fierce fighting between Australian and Japanese forces . eos
5 ° 57 ' 15S , 146 ° 22 ' 30E , which is ranked 45th in the world by prominence , is usually quoted at 4,175 m , but SRTM data suggests that it is nearer to 4,120 m. is a 3,510-foot ( 1,070 m ) mountain in the US state of Alaska , located in Chugach State Park just east of Anchorage . Flattop_Mountain_Anchorage_Alaska is the most climbed mountain in the state . Flattop_Mountain_Anchorage_Alaska is usually reached by driving to the Glen Alps trailhead and following a well - maintained 1.5-mile ( 2.4-km ) trail , with an elevation gain of 1280 feet ( 390 m ) from the parking lot to the summit . eos
is the most climbed mountain in the state . Flattop_Mountain_Anchorage_Alaska is usually reached by driving to the Glen Alps trailhead and following a well - maintained 1.5-mile ( 2.4-km ) trail , with an elevation gain of 1280 feet ( 390 m ) from the parking lot to the summit . Since Flattop_Mountain_Anchorage_Alaska is the most accessible mountain to Anchorage , Flattop_Mountain_Anchorage_Alaska is a very popular location for hiking , climbing , berry picking , parasailing , and backcountry skiing . eos
is usually reached by driving to the Glen Alps trailhead and following a well - maintained 1.5-mile ( 2.4-km ) trail , with an elevation gain of 1280 feet ( 390 m ) from the parking lot to the summit . Since Flattop_Mountain_Anchorage_Alaska is the most accessible mountain to Anchorage , Flattop_Mountain_Anchorage_Alaska is a very popular location for hiking , climbing , berry picking , parasailing , and backcountry skiing . Campouts are held on the summit at the summer and winter solstices . eos
is the most accessible mountain to Anchorage , Flattop_Mountain_Anchorage_Alaska is a very popular location for hiking , climbing , berry picking , parasailing , and backcountry skiing . Campouts are held on the summit at the summer and winter solstices . Flattop_Mountain_Anchorage_Alaska is known for Flattop_Mountain_Anchorage_Alaska panoramic views of Anchorage and the surrounding area , including Denali , Mount Foraker , and Mount Spurr . eos

( 3,993 m ) is a mountain in the Pennine Alps in Switzerland . Fletschhorn was first climbed by J D. James with guide Ambros Supersaxo in july 1889 . The imposing north face was first ascended by E R. Blanchet with guides Oskar Supersaxo and Kaspar Mooser on 25 july 1927 . eos
was first climbed by J D. James with guide Ambros Supersaxo in july 1889 . The imposing north face was first ascended by E R. Blanchet with guides Oskar Supersaxo and Kaspar Mooser on 25 july 1927 . eos
is located in the Teton Range , Grand Teton National Park , in the US state of Wyoming . Forellen_Peak is in the northern section of the range , and Forellen_Peak rises abruptly more than 2,500 feet ( 762 m ) above Owl Creek . Unlike the more impressive sections of the Teton Range to the south , Forellen_Peak is subdued and the hike to the summit from the north is nontechnical , yet requires many miles of off - trail hiking . eos
is in the northern section of the range , and Forellen_Peak rises abruptly more than 2,500 feet ( 762 m ) above Owl Creek . Unlike the more impressive sections of the Teton Range to the south , Forellen_Peak is subdued and the hike to the summit from the north is nontechnical , yet requires many miles of off - trail hiking . Access is best via the Berry Creek trail which can be reached by hiking south from the John D Rockefeller , Jr. . Memorial Parkway or by boat across the northern end of Jackson Lake . eos

is the highest mountain in Norway , at 2,469 m above sea level . Galdhopiggen is located within the municipality of Lom , ( in Oppland ) in the Jotunheimen mountain area . eos
is located within the municipality of Lom , ( in Oppland ) in the Jotunheimen mountain area . eos
is the highest mountain in Bhutan and the highest unclimbed mountain in the world with an elevation of 7570 metres and a prominence of over 2990 metres . After Bhutan was opened for mountaineering in 1983 there were four expeditions that made failed summit attempts in 1985 and 1986 . However , in 1998 , a team successfully climbed a subsidiary peak of Gangkhar_Puensum from Tibet . eos
from Tibet . Gangkhar_Puensum , alternative transliteration Gangkar Punsum or Gankar Punzum ( meaning 3 mountain siblings '' ) , had Gangkhar_Puensum altitude first measured in 1922 but maps of the region are not at all accurate and Gangkhar_Puensum is shown in different locations and with markedly different heights . eos
, alternative transliteration Gangkar Punsum or Gankar Punzum ( meaning 3 mountain siblings '' ) , had Gangkhar_Puensum altitude first measured in 1922 but maps of the region are not at all accurate and Gangkhar_Puensum is shown in different locations and with markedly different heights . Indeed , because of inadequate mapping , the first team to attempt the summit was unable to find Gangkhar_Puensum at all . eos
altitude first measured in 1922 but maps of the region are not at all accurate and Gangkhar_Puensum is shown in different locations and with markedly different heights . Indeed , because of inadequate mapping , the first team to attempt the summit was unable to find Gangkhar_Puensum at all . The book of the 1986 British expedition gives Gangkhar_Puensum height as 24,770 feet and states that Gangkhar_Puensum is completely inside Bhutan , whereas the nearby Kula Kangri is completely inside Tibet . eos
is shown in different locations and with markedly different heights . Indeed , because of inadequate mapping , the first team to attempt the summit was unable to find Gangkhar_Puensum at all . The book of the 1986 British expedition gives Gangkhar_Puensum height as 24,770 feet and states that Gangkhar_Puensum is completely inside Bhutan , whereas the nearby Kula Kangri is completely inside Tibet . eos
at all . The book of the 1986 British expedition gives Gangkhar_Puensum height as 24,770 feet and states that Gangkhar_Puensum is completely inside Bhutan , whereas the nearby Kula Kangri is completely inside Tibet . Kula Kangri , 7554 metres , is a separate mountain 30 km to the northeast which was first climbed in 1986 . eos
height as 24,770 feet and states that Gangkhar_Puensum is completely inside Bhutan , whereas the nearby Kula Kangri is completely inside Tibet . Kula Kangri , 7554 metres , is a separate mountain 30 km to the northeast which was first climbed in 1986 . It is variously mapped and described as being in Tibet or Bhutan . eos
is completely inside Bhutan , whereas the nearby Kula Kangri is completely inside Tibet . Kula Kangri , 7554 metres , is a separate mountain 30 km to the northeast which was first climbed in 1986 . It is variously mapped and described as being in Tibet or Bhutan . eos
unique status for some time : Any higher unclimbed peaks in the world are likely to be subsidiary tops , not separate mountains . In 1998 a Japanese expedition secured permission from the Chinese Mountaineering Association to climb Gangkhar_Puensum , but permission was withdrawn because of a political issue with Bhutan . Instead , in 1999 , the team set off from Tibet and successfully climbed the 7535 metre subsidiary peak , Liankang Kangri ( also known as Gangkhar Puensum North ) . eos
may keep Gangkhar_Puensum unique status for some time : Any higher unclimbed peaks in the world are likely to be subsidiary tops , not separate mountains . In 1998 a Japanese expedition secured permission from the Chinese Mountaineering Association to climb Gangkhar_Puensum , but permission was withdrawn because of a political issue with Bhutan . Instead , in 1999 , the team set off from Tibet and successfully climbed the 7535 metre subsidiary peak , Liankang Kangri ( also known as Gangkhar Puensum North ) . eos
, but permission was withdrawn because of a political issue with Bhutan . Instead , in 1999 , the team set off from Tibet and successfully climbed the 7535 metre subsidiary peak , Liankang Kangri ( also known as Gangkhar Puensum North ) . Unlike most maps , the expedition 's report shows this summit as being in Tibet and the Tibet - Bhutan border is shown crossing the summit of Gangkhar_Puensum , described as ` ` the highest peak in Bhutan , '' at 7570 metres . eos
, described as ` ` the highest peak in Bhutan , '' at 7570 metres . This elevation is supported by Japanese sources , in turn based on Chinese sources . Gangkhar_Puensum has not been surveyed by Bhutan . eos
has not been surveyed by Bhutan . eos
is the highest peak in the US state of Wyoming and Gannett_Peak straddles the boundary between Fremont and Sublette Counties along the Continental Divide . Geographically , Gannett_Peak is the apex of the entire Central Rockies ; the largely continuous group of the chain occupying the states of Wyoming , Idaho and Montana . Named in 1906 for American geographer Henry Gannett , Gannett_Peak is also the highpoint of the Wind River Range . The mountain slopes are located in both Bridger - Teton National Forest and Shoshone National Forest . eos
straddles the boundary between Fremont and Sublette Counties along the Continental Divide . Geographically , Gannett_Peak is the apex of the entire Central Rockies ; the largely continuous group of the chain occupying the states of Wyoming , Idaho and Montana . Named in 1906 for American geographer Henry Gannett , Gannett_Peak is also the highpoint of the Wind River Range . The mountain slopes are located in both Bridger - Teton National Forest and Shoshone National Forest . eos
is the apex of the entire Central Rockies ; the largely continuous group of the chain occupying the states of Wyoming , Idaho and Montana . Named in 1906 for American geographer Henry Gannett , Gannett_Peak is also the highpoint of the Wind River Range . The mountain slopes are located in both Bridger - Teton National Forest and Shoshone National Forest . Gannett_Peak is the highest peak within what is better known as the Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem . eos
is also the highpoint of the Wind River Range . The mountain slopes are located in both Bridger - Teton National Forest and Shoshone National Forest . Gannett_Peak is the highest peak within what is better known as the Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem . eos
is the highest peak within what is better known as the Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem . The 896 acre ( 3.63 km ² ) Gannett Glacier , which is likely the largest single glacier in the Rocky Mountains of the US , flows down from the northern slopes of Gannett_Peak . Minor Glacier is situated in the western cirque of Gannett_Peak while Dinwoody and Gooseneck Glaciers can be found on the southeast side of Gannett_Peak . eos
. Minor Glacier is situated in the western cirque of Gannett_Peak while Dinwoody and Gooseneck Glaciers can be found on the southeast side of Gannett_Peak . Gannett_Peak is commonly climbed on a four to six day round - trip , and Gannett_Peak is considered amongst mountaineers as second only to Alaska 's Denali in difficulty of state high points . eos
while Dinwoody and Gooseneck Glaciers can be found on the southeast side of Gannett_Peak . Gannett_Peak is commonly climbed on a four to six day round - trip , and Gannett_Peak is considered amongst mountaineers as second only to Alaska 's Denali in difficulty of state high points . However , many climbers rank Gannett_Peak behind both Denali and Montana 's Granite Peak , which , in 1923 , was the last state high point climbed . eos

However , many climbers rank Gannett_Peak behind both Denali and Montana 's Granite Peak , which , in 1923 , was the last state high point climbed . eos

( also known as Hidden Peak or K5 ) is the 11th highest peak on Earth , located on the border of China - Kashmir . Gasherbrum_I is part of the Gasherbrum massif , located in the Karakoram region of the Himalaya . Gasherbrum is often claimed to mean ` ` Shining Wall '' , presumably a reference to the highly visible face of the neighboring peak Gasherbrum IV ; but in fact it comes from ` ` rgasha '' ( beautiful ) + ` ` brum '' ( mountain ) in Balti , hence it actually means ` ` beautiful mountain . '' eos
is part of the Gasherbrum massif , located in the Karakoram region of the Himalaya . Gasherbrum is often claimed to mean ` ` Shining Wall '' , presumably a reference to the highly visible face of the neighboring peak Gasherbrum IV ; but in fact it comes from ` ` rgasha '' ( beautiful ) + ` ` brum '' ( mountain ) in Balti , hence it actually means ` ` beautiful mountain . '' Gasherbrum_I was designated K5 ( meaning the 5th peak of the Karakoram ) by TG Montgomery in 1856 when he first spotted the peaks of the Karakoram from more than 200 km away during the Great Trigonometric Survey of India . eos
was designated K5 ( meaning the 5th peak of the Karakoram ) by TG Montgomery in 1856 when he first spotted the peaks of the Karakoram from more than 200 km away during the Great Trigonometric Survey of India . In 1892 , William Martin Conway provided the alternate name , Hidden Peak , in reference to Gasherbrum_I extreme remoteness . Gasherbrum_I was first climbed on july 5 1958 by Pete Schoening and Andy Kauffman of an eight - man American expedition led by Nicholas B Clinch . eos
extreme remoteness . Gasherbrum_I was first climbed on july 5 1958 by Pete Schoening and Andy Kauffman of an eight - man American expedition led by Nicholas B Clinch . Richard K Irvin , Tom Nevison , Tom McCormack , Bob Swift and Gil Roberts were also members of the team . eos
was first climbed on july 5 1958 by Pete Schoening and Andy Kauffman of an eight - man American expedition led by Nicholas B Clinch . Richard K Irvin , Tom Nevison , Tom McCormack , Bob Swift and Gil Roberts were also members of the team . eos
is a summit in the Gasherbrum massif of the Baltoro Muztagh , a subrange of the Karakoram on the border between Pakistan and China , in the region of Baltistan . Gasherbrum_III is situated between Gasherbrum II and IV . Gasherbrum_III fails to meet a 500 metre topographic prominence cutoff to be an independent mountain ; hence Gasherbrum_III can be considered a subpeak of Gasherbrum II . eos
is situated between Gasherbrum II and IV . Gasherbrum_III fails to meet a 500 metre topographic prominence cutoff to be an independent mountain ; hence Gasherbrum_III can be considered a subpeak of Gasherbrum II . Gasherbrum_III was one of the highest unclimbed summits in the world up to Gasherbrum_III first ascent in 1975 , by Wanda Rutkiewicz , Alison Chadwick - Onyszkiewicz , Janusz Onyszkiewicz and Krystof Zdzitowiecki , members of a Polish expedition . eos
fails to meet a 500 metre topographic prominence cutoff to be an independent mountain ; hence Gasherbrum_III can be considered a subpeak of Gasherbrum II . Gasherbrum_III was one of the highest unclimbed summits in the world up to Gasherbrum_III first ascent in 1975 , by Wanda Rutkiewicz , Alison Chadwick - Onyszkiewicz , Janusz Onyszkiewicz and Krystof Zdzitowiecki , members of a Polish expedition . eos
can be considered a subpeak of Gasherbrum II . Gasherbrum_III was one of the highest unclimbed summits in the world up to Gasherbrum_III first ascent in 1975 , by Wanda Rutkiewicz , Alison Chadwick - Onyszkiewicz , Janusz Onyszkiewicz and Krystof Zdzitowiecki , members of a Polish expedition . eos

is the 17th highest mountain on Earth and the 6th highest in Pakistan . Gasherbrum_IV is one of the peaks in the Gasherbrum massif . The Gasherbrums are a remote group of peaks located at the northeastern end of the Baltoro Glacier in the Karakoram range of the Himalaya . eos
is one of the peaks in the Gasherbrum massif . The Gasherbrums are a remote group of peaks located at the northeastern end of the Baltoro Glacier in the Karakoram range of the Himalaya . The massif contains three of the world 's 8,000 metre peaks ( if one includes Broad Peak ) . eos
; but in fact it comes from ` ` rgasha '' ( beautiful ) + ` ` brum '' ( mountain ) in Balti , hence it actually means ` ` beautiful mountain . '' eos
is a mountain in the Gasherbrum massif , located in the Karakoram range of the Himalaya . Gasherbrum is a remote group of peaks located at the northeastern end of the Baltoro Glacier in the Karakoram range of the Himalaya . The massif contains three of the world 's 8,000 metre peaks ( if one includes Broad Peak ) . eos
is more likely to be around 7,150 m high . The Russian military 1:100,000 topographical map shows a height of 7,120 m . The currently most accurate map of the region probably is that in the series of ` ` Maps of Snow Mountains in China '' , which gives a height of 7,147 m. eos
is the highest peak in the High Tatras , in Slovakia , and in the whole 1,500 km ( 900 mi . ) long Carpathian mountain chain , as well as in northern and eastern Central Europe . Usually listed at 2,655 m AMSL ( 8,711 ft . ) , Gerlachovsky_stit exact elevation is actually 0.6 m ( 2 ft . ) lower . eos
exact elevation is actually 0.6 m ( 2 ft . ) lower . The pyramidal shape of the massif is marked by a huge cirque . Despite Gerlachovsky_stit relatively low elevation , the about 2,000 m vertical rise from the valley floor makes Gerlachovsky_stit soar . eos
relatively low elevation , the about 2,000 m vertical rise from the valley floor makes Gerlachovsky_stit soar . Mistaken for an average mountain in the rugged High Tatras range in the more distant past , Gerlachovsky_stit has since played a symbolic role in the eyes of the rulers and populations of several Central European nations , to the point that between the 19th and mid-20thcentury , Gerlachovsky_stit had four different names with six name reversals . Gerlachovsky_stit managed to be the highest mountain of the Kingdom of Hungary , and of the countries of Czechoslovakia and Slovakia within the span of only about two decades of the 20th century . eos
soar . Mistaken for an average mountain in the rugged High Tatras range in the more distant past , Gerlachovsky_stit has since played a symbolic role in the eyes of the rulers and populations of several Central European nations , to the point that between the 19th and mid-20thcentury , Gerlachovsky_stit had four different names with six name reversals . Gerlachovsky_stit managed to be the highest mountain of the Kingdom of Hungary , and of the countries of Czechoslovakia and Slovakia within the span of only about two decades of the 20th century . eos
has since played a symbolic role in the eyes of the rulers and populations of several Central European nations , to the point that between the 19th and mid-20thcentury , Gerlachovsky_stit had four different names with six name reversals . Gerlachovsky_stit managed to be the highest mountain of the Kingdom of Hungary , and of the countries of Czechoslovakia and Slovakia within the span of only about two decades of the 20th century . Gerlachovsky_stit shares Gerlachovsky_stit geology and ecology with the rest of the High Tatras , but Gerlachovsky_stit provides a worthwhile environment for biologists as the highest ground anywhere in Europe north of the parallel linking approximately Munich , Salzburg , and Vienna . eos
had four different names with six name reversals . Gerlachovsky_stit shares Gerlachovsky_stit geology and ecology with the rest of the High Tatras , but Gerlachovsky_stit provides a worthwhile environment for biologists as the highest ground anywhere in Europe north of the parallel linking approximately Munich , Salzburg , and Vienna . eos
managed to be the highest mountain of the Kingdom of Hungary , and of the countries of Czechoslovakia and Slovakia within the span of only about two decades of the 20th century . Gerlachovsky_stit shares Gerlachovsky_stit geology and ecology with the rest of the High Tatras , but Gerlachovsky_stit provides a worthwhile environment for biologists as the highest ground anywhere in Europe north of the parallel linking approximately Munich , Salzburg , and Vienna . Gerlachovsky_stit used to be particularly treasured as the loftiest point to climb to by Czechs , eastern Germans , Hungarians , Poles , and Slovaks during the period of restricted travel in the 20th century . eos
provides a worthwhile environment for biologists as the highest ground anywhere in Europe north of the parallel linking approximately Munich , Salzburg , and Vienna . Gerlachovsky_stit used to be particularly treasured as the loftiest point to climb to by Czechs , eastern Germans , Hungarians , Poles , and Slovaks during the period of restricted travel in the 20th century . Gerlachovsky_stit continues to attract Gerlachovsky_stit share of visitors although the local authorities have been continually adding new restrictions on access . eos

used to be particularly treasured as the loftiest point to climb to by Czechs , eastern Germans , Hungarians , Poles , and Slovaks during the period of restricted travel in the 20th century . Gerlachovsky_stit continues to attract Gerlachovsky_stit share of visitors although the local authorities have been continually adding new restrictions on access . The view from the top is readily enhanced by the hikers ' hard - to - beet feeling that in about a 200-degree arc , no one is standing taller than they are , except thousands of miles away , far beyond the curvature of the earth . eos

( or Mount Ghent , Ghaint I ) is a high peak at the north end of the Saltoro Mountains , a subrange of the Karakoram range . Ghent_Kangri is located in Ladakh district of India , near the Line of Control . Ghent_Kangri was first climbed on 4 june 1961 , by Wolfgang Axt , a member of an Austrian expedition lead by Erich Waschak , via the West Ridge . eos
is located in Ladakh district of India , near the Line of Control . Ghent_Kangri was first climbed on 4 june 1961 , by Wolfgang Axt , a member of an Austrian expedition lead by Erich Waschak , via the West Ridge . He climbed solo above the high camp . eos
was first climbed on 4 june 1961 , by Wolfgang Axt , a member of an Austrian expedition lead by Erich Waschak , via the West Ridge . He climbed solo above the high camp . According to the Index , there have been three subsequent ascents of Ghent_Kangri , in 1977 , 1980 , and 1984 . eos
, in 1977 , 1980 , and 1984 . eos
( known in the Sauk Indian dialect of Lushootseed as ` ` Tda - ko - buh - ba '' or ` ` Takobia '' ) is the most remote of the five major volcanoes in the Cascade Volcanic Belt in Washington . Glacier_Peak is not prominently visible from any major population center , and so Glacier_Peak attractions , as well as Glacier_Peak hazards , tend to be overlooked . eos
is not prominently visible from any major population center , and so Glacier_Peak attractions , as well as Glacier_Peak hazards , tend to be overlooked . Yet since the end of the last ice age , Glacier_Peak has produced some of the largest and most explosive eruptions in the state . During this time period , Glacier_Peak has erupted multiple times during at least six separate episodes , most recently about 200 - 300 years ago . eos
attractions , as well as Glacier_Peak hazards , tend to be overlooked . During this time period , Glacier_Peak has erupted multiple times during at least six separate episodes , most recently about 200 - 300 years ago . eos
hazards , tend to be overlooked . Yet since the end of the last ice age , Glacier_Peak has produced some of the largest and most explosive eruptions in the state .
