has produced some of the largest and most explosive eruptions in the state . During this time period , Glacier_Peak has erupted multiple times during at least six separate episodes , most recently about 200 - 300 years ago . The stunning snow - capped volcanoes of Washington have long been recognized by Native Americans in their language and legends , and they immediately caught the eyes of US and European explorers in the late 18th and early 19th centuries . eos
has erupted multiple times during at least six separate episodes , most recently about 200 - 300 years ago . The stunning snow - capped volcanoes of Washington have long been recognized by Native Americans in their language and legends , and they immediately caught the eyes of US and European explorers in the late 18th and early 19th centuries . By the 1790s , Mounts Baker , Rainier , and St. Helens were noted and named in the first written descriptions of the Columbia River and Puget Sound regions . eos
was n't known by settlers to be a volcano until the 1850s , when Native Americans mentioned to naturalist George Gibbs that ` ` another smaller peak to the north of Mount Rainier once smoked . '' Not until 1898 did Glacier_Peak appear on a published map under Glacier_Peak current name . Glacier_Peak is situated in Snohomish County , only 70 miles ( 112 km ) northeast of Seattle - closer to that city than any volcano except Mount Rainier . eos
appear on a published map under Glacier_Peak current name . Glacier_Peak is situated in Snohomish County , only 70 miles ( 112 km ) northeast of Seattle - closer to that city than any volcano except Mount Rainier . But unlike Mount Rainier , Glacier_Peak rises only a few thousand feet above neighboring peaks , and from coastal communities Glacier_Peak appears merely as a high point along a snowy saw - toothed skyline . eos
current name . Glacier_Peak is situated in Snohomish County , only 70 miles ( 112 km ) northeast of Seattle - closer to that city than any volcano except Mount Rainier . But unlike Mount Rainier , Glacier_Peak rises only a few thousand feet above neighboring peaks , and from coastal communities Glacier_Peak appears merely as a high point along a snowy saw - toothed skyline . eos
is situated in Snohomish County , only 70 miles ( 112 km ) northeast of Seattle - closer to that city than any volcano except Mount Rainier . But unlike Mount Rainier , Glacier_Peak rises only a few thousand feet above neighboring peaks , and from coastal communities Glacier_Peak appears merely as a high point along a snowy saw - toothed skyline . Yet Glacier_Peak has been one of the most active of Washington 's volcanoes . eos
rises only a few thousand feet above neighboring peaks , and from coastal communities Glacier_Peak appears merely as a high point along a snowy saw - toothed skyline . Yet Glacier_Peak has been one of the most active of Washington 's volcanoes . Since the continental ice sheets receded from the region , Glacier_Peak has erupted repeatedly during at least six episodes . eos
appears merely as a high point along a snowy saw - toothed skyline . Yet Glacier_Peak has been one of the most active of Washington 's volcanoes . Since the continental ice sheets receded from the region , Glacier_Peak has erupted repeatedly during at least six episodes . eos
has been one of the most active of Washington 's volcanoes . Since the continental ice sheets receded from the region , Glacier_Peak has erupted repeatedly during at least six episodes . Two of these eruptions were among the largest in Washington during the past 15,000 years . eos
has erupted repeatedly during at least six episodes . Two of these eruptions were among the largest in Washington during the past 15,000 years . eos
is located in Glacier National Park ( US ) and Going_to_the_Sun_Mountain rises dramatically above St. Mary valley just north of the Going - to - the - Sun Road . Numerous Blackfeet Indian legends are credited with the origins of Going_to_the_Sun_Mountain name . Used by the Blackfeet as a location for vision quests , Going_to_the_Sun_Mountain is one of the most accessible major mountain peaks in Glacier National Park . eos

is one of the most accessible major mountain peaks in Glacier National Park . According to several sources , the actual Blackfeet name for Going_to_the_Sun_Mountain is The - Face - of - Sour - Spirit - Who - Went - Back - to - The - Sun - After - His - Work eos
is The - Face - of - Sour - Spirit - Who - Went - Back - to - The - Sun - After - His - Work - Was - Done Mountain , in explanation of the snowfields on the mountainside which , as viewed from the west , make the outline of a face . eos
is a mountain located in the Vancouver Island Ranges on Vancouver Island , British Columbia . At 2,198 m ( 7,211 ft ) , Golden_Hinde_mountain is the highest peak on the island . Golden_Hinde_mountain is located near the centre of the 2,450 km ² ( 605,000 acre ) Strathcona Provincial Park , at the head of Wolf River and to the west of Buttle Lake , about east of the community of Gold River . eos
is the highest peak on the island . Golden_Hinde_mountain is located near the centre of the 2,450 km ² ( 605,000 acre ) Strathcona Provincial Park , at the head of Wolf River and to the west of Buttle Lake , about east of the community of Gold River . Golden_Hinde_mountain is popular with experienced backcountry climbers , having been first ascended in 1913 . eos
is located near the centre of the 2,450 km ² ( 605,000 acre ) Strathcona Provincial Park , at the head of Wolf River and to the west of Buttle Lake , about east of the community of Gold River . Golden_Hinde_mountain is popular with experienced backcountry climbers , having been first ascended in 1913 . Golden_Hinde_mountain is made of basalt which is part of the Karmutsen Formation . eos
is popular with experienced backcountry climbers , having been first ascended in 1913 . Golden_Hinde_mountain is made of basalt which is part of the Karmutsen Formation . Golden_Hinde_mountain was named for Sir Francis Drake 's ship , the Golden Hinde , by an early fur - trading captain , who was reminded of Drake 's ship as sunset hit Golden_Hinde_mountain , Golden_Hinde_mountain is visible from the west coast of the Island . eos
is made of basalt which is part of the Karmutsen Formation . Golden_Hinde_mountain was named for Sir Francis Drake 's ship , the Golden Hinde , by an early fur - trading captain , who was reminded of Drake 's ship as sunset hit Golden_Hinde_mountain , Golden_Hinde_mountain is visible from the west coast of the Island . The present name was n't officially conferred until 1938 , but this was done after a reference to Golden_Hinde_mountain in one of logs of the early fur - trading captains , who was reminded of Drake 's ship as the golden light of sunset hit Golden_Hinde_mountain , Golden_Hinde_mountain is visible from the west coast of the Island . eos

The alternative name ` ` The Rooster 's Comb '' was used by early alpinists because of Golden_Hinde_mountain appearance . eos

( 3,962 m ) is a mountain in the Pennine Alps in Switzerland . The first ascent of Grand_Cornier was made via the east ridge by Edward Whymper , Christian Almer , Michel Croz and F Biner on 16 june 1865 . The Mountet hut ( 2,886 m ) and Moiry hut ( 2,825 m ) are used for the normal routes . eos
was made via the east ridge by Edward Whymper , Christian Almer , Michel Croz and F Biner on 16 june 1865 . The Mountet hut ( 2,886 m ) and Moiry hut ( 2,825 m ) are used for the normal routes . eos
is the highest mountain within Grand Teton National Park , and the second highest in the US state of Wyoming . The origin of the name is controversial . The most common explanation is that ` ` Grand Teton '' means ` ` large teat '' in French , named by either French - Canadian or Iroquois members of an expedition led by Donald McKenzie of the Northwest Company . eos
was named after the Teton Sioux tribe of Native Americans . There is a controversy over who made the first ascent of Grand_Teton . Nathaniel Langford and James Stevenson claimed to reach the summit on july 29 , 1872 . eos
. Nathaniel Langford and James Stevenson claimed to reach the summit on july 29 , 1872 . However , their description and sketches match the summit of The Enclosure : side peak of Grand_Teton . eos
. The Enclosure is named after a man - made palisade of rocks on its summit , probably constructed by Native Americans . When William O Owen climbed the true summit in 1898 , he found no trace of prior human passage . eos
( 4,208 m ) is a mountain in the Mont Blanc range . The first ascent of the highest peak of Grandes_Jorasses ( Pointe Walker ) was by Horace Walker with guides Melchior Anderegg , Johann Jaun and Julien Grange on 30 june 1868 . The second - highest peak on Grandes_Jorasses ( Pointe Whymper , 4,184 m ) was first climbed by Edward Whymper , Christian Almer , Michel Croz and Franz Biner on june 24 1865 , using what has become the normal route of ascent and the one followed by Walker 's party in 1868 . eos
( Pointe Walker ) was by Horace Walker with guides Melchior Anderegg , Johann Jaun and Julien Grange on 30 june 1868 . The second - highest peak on Grandes_Jorasses ( Pointe Whymper , 4,184 m ) was first climbed by Edward Whymper , Christian Almer , Michel Croz and Franz Biner on june 24 1865 , using what has become the normal route of ascent and the one followed by Walker 's party in 1868 . The other summits on Grandes_Jorasses are Pointe Croz ( 4,110 m ) , Pointe Margherita ( 4,065 m ) , Pointe Elena ( 4,045 m ) and Pointe Young ( 3,996 m ) . eos
( Pointe Whymper , 4,184 m ) was first climbed by Edward Whymper , Christian Almer , Michel Croz and Franz Biner on june 24 1865 , using what has become the normal route of ascent and the one followed by Walker 's party in 1868 . The other summits on Grandes_Jorasses are Pointe Croz ( 4,110 m ) , Pointe Margherita ( 4,065 m ) , Pointe Elena ( 4,045 m ) and Pointe Young ( 3,996 m ) . eos
are Pointe Croz ( 4,110 m ) , Pointe Margherita ( 4,065 m ) , Pointe Elena ( 4,045 m ) and Pointe Young ( 3,996 m ) . eos
is the highest point in the state of Montana , USA . Granite_Peak_Montana lies within the Absaroka - Beartooth Wilderness , in Park County very near the borders of Stillwater County and Carbon County . Granite_Peak_Montana is 10 mi north of the Wyoming border , southwest of Columbus , Montana . eos
lies within the Absaroka - Beartooth Wilderness , in Park County very near the borders of Stillwater County and Carbon County . Granite_Peak_Montana is 10 mi north of the Wyoming border , southwest of Columbus , Montana . Granite_Peak_Montana is one of the most difficult US state highpoint ascents , due to technical climbing , poor weather , and route finding . eos
is 10 mi north of the Wyoming border , southwest of Columbus , Montana . Granite_Peak_Montana is one of the most difficult US state highpoint ascents , due to technical climbing , poor weather , and route finding . Granite_Peak_Montana first ascent was made by Elers Koch on august 29 , 1923 after several failed attempts by others . eos
is one of the most difficult US state highpoint ascents , due to technical climbing , poor weather , and route finding . Granite_Peak_Montana first ascent was made by Elers Koch on august 29 , 1923 after several failed attempts by others . Granite_Peak_Montana was the last of the state highpoints to be climbed . eos
first ascent was made by Elers Koch on august 29 , 1923 after several failed attempts by others . Granite_Peak_Montana was the last of the state highpoints to be climbed . Today , climbers typically spend two or three days ascending Granite_Peak_Montana , stopping over on the Froze - to - Death Plateau . eos
was the last of the state highpoints to be climbed . Today , climbers typically spend two or three days ascending Granite_Peak_Montana , stopping over on the Froze - to - Death Plateau . However , other climbers choose to ascend Granite_Peak_Montana in a single day . eos
, stopping over on the Froze - to - Death Plateau . However , other climbers choose to ascend Granite_Peak_Montana in a single day . Please be cautious at the snow bridge . eos
in a single day . Please be cautious at the snow bridge . a few unroped climbers have perished here . eos
is located in Yellowstone National Park , in the US state of Wyoming . eos
is the highest mountain in the Front Range of the Southern Rocky Mountains in the US State of Colorado . Grays_Peak is one of 54 fourteeners ( mountains of over 14,000 feet ( 4,268 m ) in elevation ) in Colorado . Grays_Peak nearest major city is Denver . eos
is one of 54 fourteeners ( mountains of over 14,000 feet ( 4,268 m ) in elevation ) in Colorado . Grays_Peak nearest major city is Denver . The first man to ascend Grays_Peak , botanist Charles C Parry , named Grays_Peak for his botanist colleague Asa Gray . eos
nearest major city is Denver . The first man to ascend Grays_Peak , botanist Charles C Parry , named Grays_Peak for his botanist colleague Asa Gray . Gray actually did not see Grays_Peak until 1872 , 11 years later . eos
, botanist Charles C Parry , named Grays_Peak for his botanist colleague Asa Gray . Gray actually did not see Grays_Peak until 1872 , 11 years later . Grays_Peak is nearly always mentioned in conjunction with nearby Torreys Peak . eos

until 1872 , 11 years later . Grays_Peak is nearly always mentioned in conjunction with nearby Torreys Peak . Grays_Peak is located on the Continental Divide , as well as the boundary between Clear Creek County and Summit County . eos
is nearly always mentioned in conjunction with nearby Torreys Peak . Grays_Peak is located on the Continental Divide , as well as the boundary between Clear Creek County and Summit County . Grays_Peak summit is the highest point exactly on the Continental Divide . eos
is located on the Continental Divide , as well as the boundary between Clear Creek County and Summit County . Grays_Peak summit is the highest point exactly on the Continental Divide . ( There are higher summits , such as Mount Elbert , which are near the Divide . ) eos
summit is the highest point exactly on the Continental Divide . ( There are higher summits , such as Mount Elbert , which are near the Divide . ) Like the other fourteeners nearby , Grays_Peak is considered to be an easy hike by fourteener standards , and Grays_Peak is very popular among weekend climbers . eos
is considered to be an easy hike by fourteener standards , and Grays_Peak is very popular among weekend climbers . Usually a climb to the summit of Grays_Peak is accompanied by continuing on to Torreys Peak , less than a mile away . The main trail departs from Stevens Gulch , to the northeast . eos
is very popular among weekend climbers . Usually a climb to the summit of Grays_Peak is accompanied by continuing on to Torreys Peak , less than a mile away . The main trail departs from Stevens Gulch , to the northeast . eos
is accompanied by continuing on to Torreys Peak , less than a mile away . The main trail departs from Stevens Gulch , to the northeast . To get to the Stevens Gulch Trailhead , take I-70 west from Denver about 50 miles ( 80 km ) to Bakerville . eos
is a hill in the Eastern Fells of the English Lake District . Great_Mell_Fell is a north - eastern outlier of the Helvellyn range , but , like Great_Mell_Fell twin Little Mell Fell , Great_Mell_Fell is isolated from Great_Mell_Fell fellows , standing in the middle of a flat plain . Presenting a symmetrical domed profile from almost all aspects , Great_Mell_Fell conspires to appear almost artificial , akin to jelly turned out of a giant mould . eos

is a mountain located in the Bow River valley , across from Canmore , Alberta , Canada . There are two main scrambling routes : * Northwest Variation - from the ACC clubhouse , ascends the northwest side of Grotto_Mountain on a good hiking trail . eos
on a good hiking trail . At tree line , the trail narrows to the false summit . From there , it is a gradual ascent to the summit with brief stints of scrambling but mostly hiking . eos
is a ski area and tourist attraction located in the District of North Vancouver , British Columbia . Grouse_Mountain is home to the Tyee Ski Club , an organization for training children and youth to become competitive alpine ski racers in slalom skiing , GS , Super - G , and downhill competitions . The club also has a newer program for snowboarding racers . eos
is home to the Tyee Ski Club , an organization for training children and youth to become competitive alpine ski racers in slalom skiing , GS , Super - G , and downhill competitions . The club also has a newer program for snowboarding racers . eos
is a mountain in the Bernese Alps range of the Swiss Alps with a height exceeding 4,000 metres . The starting point for the usual ascent by the Grünegghorn and the Southwestern Ridge is the Konkordiahütte alpine hut at 2850 m , which can be reached from Fiesch ( 1049 m ) . The first ascent was undertaken on august 7 , 1865 by Peter Michel , Edmund von Fellenberg , Peter Egger and Peter Inäbnit . eos
( also called only Gunnbjørn or Hvitserk ) is Greenland 's highest mountain and also the highest mountain north of the Arctic circle . Gunnbjorn_Fjeld is located in the Watkins Range on the east coast . Gunnbjorn_Fjeld is a nunatak , a rocky peak protruding through glacial ice . eos
is located in the Watkins Range on the east coast . Gunnbjorn_Fjeld is a nunatak , a rocky peak protruding through glacial ice . Gunnbjorn_Fjeld height is often given as 3,700 metres , although figures vary slightly . eos

is a mountain in the Stubai Alps of Austria . For a long time , the locals believed Habicht to be the highest mountain in Tyrol , due to Habicht prominence above the surrounding mountains . Despite what they thought , the highest peak in the Stubai Alps is Zuckerhütl which is 230 metres higher than Habicht . eos

is the highest point in Finland , at 1,324 m above sea level . Halti ( also known as Haltitunturi , Haltia or Haltiatunturi - tunturi meaning fell - and Háldi in Sámi ) is located in the municipality of Enontekiö in the province of Lapland at the border between Finland and Norway . The summit of Halti at 1,365 m is actually in Norway and it is known as Ráisduattarháldi . eos
( also known as Haltitunturi , Haltia or Haltiatunturi - tunturi meaning fell - and Háldi in Sámi ) is located in the municipality of Enontekiö in the province of Lapland at the border between Finland and Norway . The summit of Halti at 1,365 m is actually in Norway and it is known as Ráisduattarháldi . The highest point in Finland is a spur of Ráisduattarháldi at 1,324 m known as Hálditšohkka at the border of Norway . eos
at 1,365 m is actually in Norway and it is known as Ráisduattarháldi . The highest point in Finland is a spur of Ráisduattarháldi at 1,324 m known as Hálditšohkka at the border of Norway . The highest mountain , its peak being in Finland , is Ridnitšohkka , at 1,316 m. eos

is the highest mountain in South Dakota , located in Black Hills National Forest . Harney_Peak elevation is 7,242 ft ( 2,207 m ) . Harney_Peak is the highest point east of the Rocky Mountains in mainland North America . eos
elevation is 7,242 ft ( 2,207 m ) . Harney_Peak is the highest point east of the Rocky Mountains in mainland North America . An abandoned fire lookout tower is situated on the summit . eos
is the highest point east of the Rocky Mountains in mainland North America . An abandoned fire lookout tower is situated on the summit . A plaque at the base of the tower which reads ` ` Valentine McGillycuddy , Wasicu Wacan '' marks the final resting place for Dr. Valentine McGillycuddy . eos
was named in the late 1850s by Lieutenant Gouverneur K Warren in honor of General William S Harney , who was commander of the military in the Black Hills area in the late 1850s . The top can be reached by following the trails either from Sylvan Lake or Horse Thief Lake . The hike from Sylvan Lake to the summit and back is about 6 miles ( 10 km ) . eos
is located within the Black Elk Wilderness area . No permit is required for use of the trail , although the National Forest Service asks ( at a self - service kiosk ) that hikers register to obtain a free permit upon entering the Black Elk Wilderness area , en route to the summit . The entire area around Harney_Peak is one of the most popular hiking locations in the Black Hills . eos
is one of the most popular hiking locations in the Black Hills . The trails which course through the Black Elk Wilderness and nearby Custer State Park are walked on at all seasons of the year . There has been great interest in expanding this wilderness area in recent years . eos
is a little - known volcano 135 km northwest of Anchorage Hayes_Volcano was not discovered until 1975 . Hayes_Volcano is responsible for a series of six major tephra layers in the Cook Inlet region of Alaska . Hayes_Volcano was mostly destroyed by at least six catastrophic eruptions between 3,400 and 3,800 years ago , and the average volume of these eruptions was 2.4 cubic km . eos
was not discovered until 1975 . Hayes_Volcano is responsible for a series of six major tephra layers in the Cook Inlet region of Alaska . Hayes_Volcano was mostly destroyed by at least six catastrophic eruptions between 3,400 and 3,800 years ago , and the average volume of these eruptions was 2.4 cubic km . eos
is responsible for a series of six major tephra layers in the Cook Inlet region of Alaska . Hayes_Volcano was mostly destroyed by at least six catastrophic eruptions between 3,400 and 3,800 years ago , and the average volume of these eruptions was 2.4 cubic km . In comparison , the volume of the May 18 , 1980 eruption of Mount St. Helens was about 1 cubic km . eos
was mostly destroyed by at least six catastrophic eruptions between 3,400 and 3,800 years ago , and the average volume of these eruptions was 2.4 cubic km . In comparison , the volume of the May 18 , 1980 eruption of Mount St. Helens was about 1 cubic km . The eruptions of Hayes_Volcano during that time were the most voluminous Holocene eruptions to have occurred in the Cook Inlet region . eos
during that time were the most voluminous Holocene eruptions to have occurred in the Cook Inlet region . There is currently no fumarolic activity present . The last eruption of Hayes_Volcano occurred roughly 1,200 years ago . eos

is a mountain peak located in Glacier National Park , Montana . Heavens_Peak is located near the western terminus of the Going - to - the - Sun Road , and Heavens_Peak towers above Lake McDonald , the largest lake in the park . Heavens_Peak is 8,987 feet ( 2,739 m ) high and Heavens_Peak rises over 5,000 feet ( 1,500 m ) above Heavens_Peak base . eos

is a stratovolcano located in the south of Iceland at 63.98 deg N 19.70 deg W , with a height of 1488 m. Hekla is Iceland 's most active volcano ; over 20 outbreaks have occurred in and around Hekla since 874 . During the Middle Ages , Icelanders called Hekla the ` ` Gateway to Hell . '' eos
is Iceland 's most active volcano ; over 20 outbreaks have occurred in and around Hekla since 874 . During the Middle Ages , Icelanders called Hekla the ` ` Gateway to Hell . '' Hekla is part of a volcanic ridge , 40 km ( 25 mi ) long . eos
since 874 . During the Middle Ages , Icelanders called Hekla the ` ` Gateway to Hell . '' Hekla is part of a volcanic ridge , 40 km ( 25 mi ) long . eos
the ` ` Gateway to Hell . '' Hekla is part of a volcanic ridge , 40 km ( 25 mi ) long . However , the most active part of this ridge , about 5.5 km ( 3.4 mi ) long , is considered to be Hekla . eos
is part of a volcanic ridge , 40 km ( 25 mi ) long . However , the most active part of this ridge , about 5.5 km ( 3.4 mi ) long , is considered to be Hekla . Hekla looks rather like an overturned boat , with Hekla keel being in fact a series of craters , two of which are generally the most active . eos

is a peak in the Himalaya of central Nepal . Hiunchuli is an extension of Annapurna South . Hiunchuli is classified as a trekking peak by the NMA , but Hiunchuli is considered one of the more difficult to climb due to route finding difficulties and dangers from rock fall and seracs . eos
is an extension of Annapurna South . Hiunchuli is classified as a trekking peak by the NMA , but Hiunchuli is considered one of the more difficult to climb due to route finding difficulties and dangers from rock fall and seracs . A climbing permit from the NMA costs $ 350 USD for a team of up to four members . eos

( 4,219 m ) is a mountain in the Pennine Alps in Switzerland . Hohberghorn lies towards the northern end of the Nadelgrat , a high - level ridge running roughly north - south above the resort of Saas - Fee to the east , and the Mattertal to the west . Hohberghorn was first climbed by R B. Heathcote , with guides Franz Biner , Peter Perren and Peter Taugwalderon , in august 1869 via the west gully above the Hohberg Glacier to the Stecknadeljoch . eos
lies towards the northern end of the Nadelgrat , a high - level ridge running roughly north - south above the resort of Saas - Fee to the east , and the Mattertal to the west . Hohberghorn was first climbed by R B. Heathcote , with guides Franz Biner , Peter Perren and Peter Taugwalderon , in august 1869 via the west gully above the Hohberg Glacier to the Stecknadeljoch . Hohberghorn north - east face , not as long or as steep as that on the neighbouring Lenzspitze , is 320 m and at an average angle of 50 degrees , and might be considered as excellent training for the latter . eos
was first climbed by R B. Heathcote , with guides Franz Biner , Peter Perren and Peter Taugwalderon , in august 1869 via the west gully above the Hohberg Glacier to the Stecknadeljoch . Hohberghorn north - east face , not as long or as steep as that on the neighbouring Lenzspitze , is 320 m and at an average angle of 50 degrees , and might be considered as excellent training for the latter . eos

is a strongly karstic Austrian mountain , and the second highest mountain in the Northern Limestone Alps . Hoher_Dachstein is situated at the border of Upper Austria and Styria in central Austria , and Hoher_Dachstein is the highest point in each of those states . Parts of the massif also lie in the state of Salzburg , leading to Hoher_Dachstein being referred to as the Drei - Länder - Berg ( ` ` three state mountain '' ) . eos
is situated at the border of Upper Austria and Styria in central Austria , and Hoher_Dachstein is the highest point in each of those states . Parts of the massif also lie in the state of Salzburg , leading to Hoher_Dachstein being referred to as the Drei - Länder - Berg ( ` ` three state mountain '' ) . The Dachstein massif covers an area of around 20 × 30 km with dozens of peaks above 2,500 m , the highset of which are in the southern and south - western areas . eos
is the highest point in each of those states . Parts of the massif also lie in the state of Salzburg , leading to Hoher_Dachstein being referred to as the Drei - Länder - Berg ( ` ` three state mountain '' ) . The Dachstein massif covers an area of around 20 × 30 km with dozens of peaks above 2,500 m , the highset of which are in the southern and south - western areas . eos
being referred to as the Drei - Länder - Berg ( ` ` three state mountain '' ) . The Dachstein massif covers an area of around 20 × 30 km with dozens of peaks above 2,500 m , the highset of which are in the southern and south - western areas . Seen from the north , the Dachstein massif is dominated by the glaciers with the rocky summits rising beyond them . eos
drops almost vertically to the valley floor . The geology of the Dachstein massif is dominated by the so - called Dachstein - Kalk ( ` ` Dachstein limestone '' ) , dating from Triassic times . In common with other karstic areas , Hoher_Dachstein is permeated by a rich cave system , including some of the largest caves in Austria , such as the Mammuthhöhle and the Hirlatzhöhle . eos
is permeated by a rich cave system , including some of the largest caves in Austria , such as the Mammuthhöhle and the Hirlatzhöhle . Another significant tourist destination is the Eisriesenhöhle . Hoher_Dachstein is famous for Hoher_Dachstein fossils , including megalodonts ; the Linzer Weg leads over many such fossils , which are referred to as Kuhtritte ( ` ` cattle footprints '' ) . eos
is famous for Hoher_Dachstein fossils , including megalodonts ; the Linzer Weg leads over many such fossils , which are referred to as Kuhtritte ( ` ` cattle footprints '' ) . Glaciers are uncommon in the Northern Limestone Alps , and those on Hoher_Dachstein - the Hallstätter Gletscher ( ` ` Hallstatt glacier '' ) , the Großer Gosaugletscher ( ` ` great Gosau glacier '' ) and the Schladminger Gletscher ( ` ` Schladming glacier '' ) - are the largest , as well as being the northernmost and the easternmost in the whole of the Alps . Several smaller ice - fields also exist , such as the Kleine Gosaugletscher ( ` ` lesser Gosau glacier '' ) and the Schneelochgletscher ( ` ` snow - hole glacier '' ) . eos
fossils , including megalodonts ; the Linzer Weg leads over many such fossils , which are referred to as Kuhtritte ( ` ` cattle footprints '' ) . Glaciers are uncommon in the Northern Limestone Alps , and those on Hoher_Dachstein - the Hallstätter Gletscher ( ` ` Hallstatt glacier '' ) , the Großer Gosaugletscher ( ` ` great Gosau glacier '' ) and the Schladminger Gletscher ( ` ` Schladming glacier '' ) - are the largest , as well as being the northernmost and the easternmost in the whole of the Alps . Several smaller ice - fields also exist , such as the Kleine Gosaugletscher ( ` ` lesser Gosau glacier '' ) and the Schneelochgletscher ( ` ` snow - hole glacier '' ) . eos
- the Hallstätter Gletscher ( ` ` Hallstatt glacier '' ) , the Großer Gosaugletscher ( ` ` great Gosau glacier '' ) and the Schladminger Gletscher ( ` ` Schladming glacier '' ) - are the largest , as well as being the northernmost and the easternmost in the whole of the Alps . Several smaller ice - fields also exist , such as the Kleine Gosaugletscher ( ` ` lesser Gosau glacier '' ) and the Schneelochgletscher ( ` ` snow - hole glacier '' ) . The glaciers are retreating rapidly , and may disappear entirely within 80 years . eos
( "" Ukrainian : Говерла "" , Hoverla ; "" Hungarian : Hóvár "" ; "" Romanian : Hovârla "" ; "" Russian : eos
is located in the Eastern Beskides , in the so - called Chornohora region . The slopes are covered with beech and spruce forests , above which there is a belt of sub - alpine meadows called polonyna in Ukrainian . At the eastern slope there is the main spring of the Prut river . eos
became a notable tourist attraction , especially among tourists from nearby cities of Galicia . In 1880 the first tourist route between the peak of Hoverla and Krasny Luh was marked by Leopold Wajgel of the Galician Tatra Society . The following year the first tourist shelter was founded there . eos
and Krasny Luh was marked by Leopold Wajgel of the Galician Tatra Society . The following year the first tourist shelter was founded there . In the 20th century and especially after Ukraine gained independence , losing the cheap access to the many mountain region of the former USSR , Hoverla is increasingly gaining popularity as an extreme sport site . eos
is increasingly gaining popularity as an extreme sport site . Some routes are classified as 1A in winter period ( from late autumn to May ) , according to the USSR grading system . Nowadays because of Hoverla prominence too many unskilled extreme - lovers are taking attempts to climb Hoverla in winter , resulting in regular frostbites or even deaths . eos
prominence too many unskilled extreme - lovers are taking attempts to climb Hoverla in winter , resulting in regular frostbites or even deaths . In october 2007 the radical pro - Russian Eurasia Party - affiliated ` ` Eurasian Youth Union '' vandalized the official Ukrainian state symbols put on Hoverla . According to the group , they ` ` renamed '' Hoverla as ` ` Stalin 's peak '' . eos

is the third - most historically active shield volcano on the Island of Hawaii in the Hawaiian Islands . Hualalai peak is at 8,271 ft ( 2,521 m ) above sea level . Hualalai lies more or less due west of the saddle between the much taller Mauna Kea and Mauna Loa mountains , and Hualalai forms the backdrop to the town of Kailua - Kona . eos
peak is at 8,271 ft ( 2,521 m ) above sea level . Hualalai lies more or less due west of the saddle between the much taller Mauna Kea and Mauna Loa mountains , and Hualalai forms the backdrop to the town of Kailua - Kona . In fact , the town is built on the southwestern slope of Hualalai , where most of the world famous Kona coffee is grown . eos
lies more or less due west of the saddle between the much taller Mauna Kea and Mauna Loa mountains , and Hualalai forms the backdrop to the town of Kailua - Kona . In fact , the town is built on the southwestern slope of Hualalai , where most of the world famous Kona coffee is grown . eos

is a high peak in the Sangre de Cristo Range in southern Colorado . Humboldt_Peak_Colorado is the least challenging climb of the Crestone group of fourteeners , which include Crestone Peak , Crestone Needle , and Kit Carson Peak . ( Challenger Point , a subpeak of Kit Carson Peak , is sometimes included in this list . ) eos
is the least challenging climb of the Crestone group of fourteeners , which include Crestone Peak , Crestone Needle , and Kit Carson Peak . ( Challenger Point , a subpeak of Kit Carson Peak , is sometimes included in this list . ) Despite the rather impressive north face of Humboldt_Peak_Colorado , the standard route on Humboldt_Peak_Colorado is not much more than a hike along a decent trail with some minor rock scrambling ( Class 2 ) near the summit . eos
, the standard route on Humboldt_Peak_Colorado is not much more than a hike along a decent trail with some minor rock scrambling ( Class 2 ) near the summit . Humboldt_Peak_Colorado is considered an easy climb and Humboldt_Peak_Colorado is recommended for those just beginning to climb the fourteeners . The trail climbs Humboldt_Peak_Colorado from the South Colony Lakes basin , accessed from the east side of the range . eos
is not much more than a hike along a decent trail with some minor rock scrambling ( Class 2 ) near the summit . is considered an easy climb and Humboldt_Peak_Colorado is recommended for those just beginning to climb the fourteeners . The trail climbs Humboldt_Peak_Colorado from the South Colony Lakes basin , accessed from the east side of the range . This basin is a popular site that is also the base for most climbs of Crestone Peak and Crestone Needle . eos

is the highest point in the US state of Arizona and Humphreys_Peak is located in Coconino County , about north of Flagstaff , Arizona . Humphreys_Peak is the highest of a group of ancient volcanic peaks known as the San Francisco Peaks . The summit can be most easily reached by hiking the long Humphreys Trail that begins at the Arizona Snowbowl ski resort in the Coconino National Forest . eos
is located in Coconino County , about north of Flagstaff , Arizona . Humphreys_Peak is the highest of a group of ancient volcanic peaks known as the San Francisco Peaks . The summit can be most easily reached by hiking the long Humphreys Trail that begins at the Arizona Snowbowl ski resort in the Coconino National Forest . eos
is the highest of a group of ancient volcanic peaks known as the San Francisco Peaks . The summit can be most easily reached by hiking the long Humphreys Trail that begins at the Arizona Snowbowl ski resort in the Coconino National Forest . The last of the trail traverses the only region of tundra in Arizona , at an elevation of more than 11,500 feet ( 3,505 m ) . eos
was named in about 1870 for General Andrew A Humphreys , a US Army officer who was a Union general during the American Civil War , and who later became Chief of Engineers of the United States Army Corps of Engineers . However , a General Land Office map from 1903 showed the name San Francisco Peak applied to Humphreys_Peak ( apparently borrowed from San Francisco Mountain on which Humphreys_Peak stands ) . Thus the United States Board on Geographic Names approved the variant name in 1911 . eos
( apparently borrowed from San Francisco Mountain on which Humphreys_Peak stands ) . Thus the United States Board on Geographic Names approved the variant name in 1911 . In 1933 , the application of the names was rectified . eos
stands ) . Thus the United States Board on Geographic Names approved the variant name in 1911 . In 1933 , the application of the names was rectified . eos
should not be confused with Mount Humphreys , a higher peak in the Sierra Nevada . eos
is a fourteener in the US state of Colorado . Huron_Peak is located in the central Sawatch Range , west of the Mount Belford group , in the Collegiate Peaks Wilderness . Huron_Peak lies in Chaffee County , approximately 18 miles ( 29 km ) northwest of the town of Buena Vista . eos
is located in the central Sawatch Range , west of the Mount Belford group , in the Collegiate Peaks Wilderness . Huron_Peak lies in Chaffee County , approximately 18 miles ( 29 km ) northwest of the town of Buena Vista . While relatively close to Huron_Peak neighbor peaks , Huron_Peak is separated from them by deep cols , resulting in a moderately high topographic prominence . eos
lies in Chaffee County , approximately 18 miles ( 29 km ) northwest of the town of Buena Vista . While relatively close to Huron_Peak neighbor peaks , Huron_Peak is separated from them by deep cols , resulting in a moderately high topographic prominence . Nearby to the south are the Three Apostles , a striking group of three thirteen thousand foot peaks . eos

is a mountain located on Vancouver Island , British Columbia . Within the boundaries of Strathcona Provincial Park , Iceberg_Peak lies at the south end of Rees Ridge . Mount Celeste lies at the north end of this ridge . eos

( from Aimara , meaning ` ` golden eagle '' ) is the highest peak in the Cordillera Real ( part of the Cordillera Oriental , a subrange of the Andes ) of western Bolivia . Illimani lies just south of La Paz at the eastern edge of the Altiplano . eos
lies just south of La Paz at the eastern edge of the Altiplano . Illimani is the second highest peak in Bolivia , after Nevado Sajama , and the eighteenth highest peak in South America . The snow line lies at about 4,570 metres ( 15,000 ft ) above sea level , and glaciers are found on the northern face at 4,983 m ( 16,350 ft ) . eos
is the second highest peak in Bolivia , after Nevado Sajama , and the eighteenth highest peak in South America . The snow line lies at about 4,570 metres ( 15,000 ft ) above sea level , and glaciers are found on the northern face at 4,983 m ( 16,350 ft ) . Illimani has four main peaks ; the highest is the south summit , Nevado Illimani , which is a popular ascent for mountain climbers . eos
has four main peaks ; the highest is the south summit , Nevado Illimani , which is a popular ascent for mountain climbers . Geologically , Illimani is composed primarily of granodiorite , intruded during the Cenozoic era into the sedimentary rock which forms the bulk of the Cordillera Real . Illimani is quite visible from the city of La Paz and Illimani is its major landmark . eos
is composed primarily of granodiorite , intruded during the Cenozoic era into the sedimentary rock which forms the bulk of the Cordillera Real . Illimani is quite visible from the city of La Paz and Illimani is its major landmark . Illimani has been the subject of many local songs , eos
is quite visible from the city of La Paz and Illimani is its major landmark . Illimani has been the subject of many local songs , most importantly ` ` Illimani '' , with the following refrain : ` ` Illimani , Illimani , sentinela de La Paz ! eos
is its major landmark . Illimani has been the subject of many local songs , most importantly ` ` Illimani '' , with the following refrain : ` ` Illimani , Illimani , sentinela de La Paz ! eos
has been the subject of many local songs , most importantly ` ` Illimani '' , with the following refrain : ` ` Illimani , Illimani , sentinela de La Paz ! Illimani , Illimani , patrimonio de Bolivia ! '' eos
was first attempted in 1877 by C Wiener , J de Grumkow , and J C. Ocampo . They failed to reach the main summit , but did reach a southeastern subsummit . In 1898 , British climber William Martin Conway and two Swiss guides , A Maquignaz and L Pellissier , made the first recorded ascent of Illimani , again from the southeast . eos
, again from the southeast . ( They found a piece of Aimara rope at over 6,000 m ( 20,000 ft ) , so an earlier ascent can not be completely discounted . ) The current standard route on Illimani climbs the west ridge of the main summit . eos
climbs the west ridge of the main summit . It was first climbed in 1940 , by the Germans R Boetcher , F Fritz , and W Kuehn , and is graded French PD + / AD - . "" 5 "" . eos
is an inactive stratovolcano in northern Ecuador . Although Imbabura_Volcano has not erupted for at least 14,000 years , Imbabura_Volcano is not thought to be entirely extinct . Imbabura_Volcano is intermittently capped with snow and Imbabura_Volcano has no permanent glaciers . eos
has not erupted for at least 14,000 years , Imbabura_Volcano is not thought to be entirely extinct . Imbabura_Volcano is intermittently capped with snow and Imbabura_Volcano has no permanent glaciers . Covered in volcanic ash , the slopes of Imbabura_Volcano are especially fertile . eos
is not thought to be entirely extinct . Imbabura_Volcano is intermittently capped with snow and Imbabura_Volcano has no permanent glaciers . Covered in volcanic ash , the slopes of Imbabura_Volcano are especially fertile . eos
is intermittently capped with snow and Imbabura_Volcano has no permanent glaciers . Covered in volcanic ash , the slopes of Imbabura_Volcano are especially fertile . In addition to cloud forests , which are found across the northern Andes to an altitude of 3000 m , the land around Imbabura_Volcano is extensively farmed . eos
has no permanent glaciers . Covered in volcanic ash , the slopes of Imbabura_Volcano are especially fertile . In addition to cloud forests , which are found across the northern Andes to an altitude of 3000 m , the land around Imbabura_Volcano is extensively farmed . eos
are especially fertile . In addition to cloud forests , which are found across the northern Andes to an altitude of 3000 m , the land around Imbabura_Volcano is extensively farmed . Maize , sugarcane , and beans are all staple crops of the region . eos
is extensively farmed . Maize , sugarcane , and beans are all staple crops of the region . Cattle are also an important commodity , and much of the land on and around Imbabura_Volcano , especially the high - altitude meadows above the tree line , is used for grazing . eos
, especially the high - altitude meadows above the tree line , is used for grazing . eos
, better known as Island Peak , is a mountain in the Himalaya of eastern Nepal . Imja_Tse was named Island Peak in 1951 by Eric Shipton 's party since Imja_Tse appears as an island in a sea of ice when viewed from Dingboche . Imja_Tse was later renamed in 1983 to Imja Tse but Island Peak remains the popular choice . eos
was named Island Peak in 1951 by Eric Shipton 's party since Imja_Tse appears as an island in a sea of ice when viewed from Dingboche . Imja_Tse was later renamed in 1983 to Imja Tse but Island Peak remains the popular choice . Imja_Tse is actually an extension of the ridge coming down off the south end of Lhotse Shar . eos
appears as an island in a sea of ice when viewed from Dingboche . Imja_Tse was later renamed in 1983 to Imja Tse but Island Peak remains the popular choice . Imja_Tse is actually an extension of the ridge coming down off the south end of Lhotse Shar . eos
was later renamed in 1983 to Imja Tse but Island Peak remains the popular choice . Imja_Tse is actually an extension of the ridge coming down off the south end of Lhotse Shar . Imja_Tse was first climbed in 1953 by a British team as a training exercise in preparation for Mount Everest . eos
is actually an extension of the ridge coming down off the south end of Lhotse Shar . Imja_Tse was first climbed in 1953 by a British team as a training exercise in preparation for Mount Everest . Tenzing Norgay was one of the members of this first ascent team . eos
was first climbed in 1953 by a British team as a training exercise in preparation for Mount Everest . Tenzing Norgay was one of the members of this first ascent team . Imja_Tse is one of the most popular trekking peaks as Imja_Tse requires nominal mountaineering experience , especially when supported by a Nepalese climbing guide . eos

( "" Spanish : Volcán Irazú "" ) is an active volcano in Costa Rica , situated in the Cordillera Central close to the city of Cartago . eos
name is believed to be a corruption of Iztarú , which was the name of an indigenous village on the flanks of Irazu_Volcano . In Costa Rica Irazu_Volcano is known by the name of ` ` Colossus '' due to the catastrophes that Irazu_Volcano has provoked in the past . eos
. In Costa Rica Irazu_Volcano is known by the name of ` ` Colossus '' due to the catastrophes that Irazu_Volcano has provoked in the past . eos
is known by the name of ` ` Colossus '' due to the catastrophes that Irazu_Volcano has provoked in the past . Irazu_Volcano has erupted frequently in historical times - at least 23 times since Irazu_Volcano first well - recorded eruption in 1723 . eos
has provoked in the past . Irazu_Volcano has erupted frequently in historical times - at least 23 times since Irazu_Volcano first well - recorded eruption in 1723 . Irazu_Volcano most famous recent eruption began in 1963 and continued until 1965 . eos
has erupted frequently in historical times - at least 23 times since Irazu_Volcano first well - recorded eruption in 1723 . Irazu_Volcano most famous recent eruption began in 1963 and continued until 1965 . It began on the day US President John F Kennedy began a state visit to Costa Rica and showered the capital San José and much of the central highlands of Costa Rica with ash . eos
first well - recorded eruption in 1723 . Irazu_Volcano most famous recent eruption began in 1963 and continued until 1965 . It began on the day US President John F Kennedy began a state visit to Costa Rica and showered the capital San José and much of the central highlands of Costa Rica with ash . eos
most famous recent eruption began in 1963 and continued until 1965 . It began on the day US President John F Kennedy began a state visit to Costa Rica and showered the capital San José and much of the central highlands of Costa Rica with ash . Since the 1963 - 65 eruption , Irazu_Volcano has been dormant , although frequent earthquake swarms show that magma is still moving about beneath Irazu_Volcano . eos
. In 1994 , a small phreatic eruption occurred , caused by heavy rains destabilising part of Irazu_Volcano flank , resulting in rapid decompression of a shallow hydrothermal system . Irazu_Volcano summit has several craters , one of which contains Diego de la Haya , a green crater lake of variable depth . eos

Irazu_Volcano is easily visited from San José , with a road leading right up to the summit craters and a daily bus service to the top . eos
is the highest active volcano in Costa Rica . Irazu_Volcano is easily visited from San José , with a road leading right up to the summit craters and a daily bus service to the top . Irazu_Volcano is thus a popular tourist spot . eos
is easily visited from San José , with a road leading right up to the summit craters and a daily bus service to the top . Irazu_Volcano is thus a popular tourist spot . The volcano summit also spots a few television transmitters for television stations in San José . eos

From the top it is claimed to be possible to see both the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans on a clear day ; however , such clear days are very rare indeed , and it is typical for Irazu_Volcano summit to be covered in cloud for much of the time . eos

( Tajik : Қуллаи Исмоили Сомонӣ , Qullai Ismoili Somonī , Russian : пик имени Исмаила Самани ) is the highest mountain in Tajikistan and in the former Soviet Union , named after Ismoil Somoni , the ancestor of the Samanid dynasty . eos
was tentatively identified with Garmo Peak ; but as the result of the work of further Soviet expeditions , it became clear by 1932 that they were not the same , and in 1933 Ismoil_Somoni_Peak , from the Akademiya Nauk Range , was named Stalin Peak ( Pik Stalina , пик Ста́лина ) , after Joseph Stalin . In 1962 , the name was changed to Communism Peak ( Tajik : Пики Коммунизм , Russian : Pik Kommunizma , пик Коммуни́зма ) , and in 1998 to Ismoil_Somoni_Peak current name . The first ascent was made in 1933 by the Soviet mountaineer Yevgeniy Abalakov . eos
, from the Akademiya Nauk Range , was named Stalin Peak ( Pik Stalina , пик Ста́лина ) , after Joseph Stalin . The first ascent was made in 1933 by the Soviet mountaineer Yevgeniy Abalakov . eos

is the third highest mountain in the Hindu Kush , in the Chitral district of the Northwest Frontier Province of Pakistan . Istor-o-Nal is the 68th highest independent peak in the world . Istor-o-Nal crowns a massif with eleven peaks of elevation more than 7,000 m ( 22,966 ft ) . eos
is the 68th highest independent peak in the world . Istor-o-Nal crowns a massif with eleven peaks of elevation more than 7,000 m ( 22,966 ft ) . Istor-o-Nal is located a few kilometres northeast of Tirich Mir ( the highest mountain in the Hindu Kush ) , across the Tirich Glacier . eos
crowns a massif with eleven peaks of elevation more than 7,000 m ( 22,966 ft ) . Istor-o-Nal is located a few kilometres northeast of Tirich Mir ( the highest mountain in the Hindu Kush ) , across the Tirich Glacier . Because Istor-o-Nal is behind the higher peak of Tirich Mir from many viewpoints , Istor-o-Nal is not easily visible and therefore not well known . eos
is located a few kilometres northeast of Tirich Mir ( the highest mountain in the Hindu Kush ) , across the Tirich Glacier . Because Istor-o-Nal is behind the higher peak of Tirich Mir from many viewpoints , Istor-o-Nal is not easily visible and therefore not well known . The word ` ` Istoro Nal '' means horseshoe in the Khowar language ( Istor means ` ` horse '' ) . eos
is behind the higher peak of Tirich Mir from many viewpoints , Istor-o-Nal is not easily visible and therefore not well known . The word ` ` Istoro Nal '' means horseshoe in the Khowar language ( Istor means ` ` horse '' ) . The origin of the name is unclear . eos
is not easily visible and therefore not well known . The word ` ` Istoro Nal '' means horseshoe in the Khowar language ( Istor means ` ` horse '' ) . The origin of the name is unclear . eos
was first climbed on june 8 , 1955 by the Americans Major Ken Bankwala , Joseph E Murphy , Jr. , and Thomas A Mutch , on a Princeton Mountaineering Club expedition . They climbed the west ridge , starting from the south side of Istor-o-Nal on the Tirich Glacier . Their small , minimally financed expedition ( by the standards of the time for high - altitude mountaineering ) achieved what was then the second highest summit attained by Americans . eos
on the Tirich Glacier . Their small , minimally financed expedition ( by the standards of the time for high - altitude mountaineering ) achieved what was then the second highest summit attained by Americans . eos

is an extinct volcano near the city of Baza in the Granada province in Spain . Javaleon reaches a height of 1,494 metres above sea level . At the foot of Javaleon are the Banõs de Zujar ( baths of Zujar ) . eos

is a mountain in the Nepalese Himalaya . Kala_Patthar appears as a big brown bump below the impressive south face of Pumori ( 7,161 m / 23,494 ft ) . Many trekkers in the region of Mount Everest will attempt to summit Kala_Patthar , since Kala_Patthar provides the most accessible point to view Mt. Everest from base camp to peak ( due to the structure of Everest , the peak can not be seen from the base camp ) . eos
appears as a big brown bump below the impressive south face of Pumori ( 7,161 m / 23,494 ft ) . Many trekkers in the region of Mount Everest will attempt to summit Kala_Patthar , since Kala_Patthar provides the most accessible point to view Mt. Everest from base camp to peak ( due to the structure of Everest , the peak can not be seen from the base camp ) . The views from almost anywhere on Kala_Patthar of Everest , Lhotse and Nuptse are spectacular . eos
, since Kala_Patthar provides the most accessible point to view Mt. Everest from base camp to peak ( due to the structure of Everest , the peak can not be seen from the base camp ) . The views from almost anywhere on Kala_Patthar of Everest , Lhotse and Nuptse are spectacular . The ascent of Kala_Patthar begins at Gorakshep ( 5,164 m ) , the original base camp for Mt. Everest . eos
provides the most accessible point to view Mt. Everest from base camp to peak ( due to the structure of Everest , the peak can not be seen from the base camp ) . The views from almost anywhere on Kala_Patthar of Everest , Lhotse and Nuptse are spectacular . The ascent of Kala_Patthar begins at Gorakshep ( 5,164 m ) , the original base camp for Mt. Everest . eos
of Everest , Lhotse and Nuptse are spectacular . The ascent of Kala_Patthar begins at Gorakshep ( 5,164 m ) , the original base camp for Mt. Everest . After a brief dip to an ancient lake bed ( which now contains a small lake and a helipad ) , the ascent makes its way up a series of steep switchbacks before levelling off somewhat as it traverses to the eastern side of Kala_Patthar . eos
begins at Gorakshep ( 5,164 m ) , the original base camp for Mt. Everest . After a brief dip to an ancient lake bed ( which now contains a small lake and a helipad ) , the ascent makes its way up a series of steep switchbacks before levelling off somewhat as it traverses to the eastern side of Kala_Patthar . The trail then becomes steep once again until it reaches the wind - swept summit ridge . eos
. The trail then becomes steep once again until it reaches the wind - swept summit ridge . From there , a five to ten minute scramble over boulders takes one to the top , which is marked with prayer flags . eos
is merely a minor summit on a ridge leading to Pumo Ri , different people may have measured different summits . The summit traditionally referred to as Kala Patthar is , however , completely festooned with prayer flags , making it quite readily recognizable . It is that summit that was recorded as 5,643 m. eos
is the second highest mountain in the Garhwal region of India , after Nanda Devi , 7,816 m ( 25,643 ft ) . Kamet lies in the Chamoli District of Uttarakhand , close to the border with Tibet . Kamet is the third highest mountain in India ( according to India however , the rank is much lower as it includes in its list of mountains all those in Pakistan occupied Kashmir ) , and the 29th highest in the world . eos
lies in the Chamoli District of Uttarakhand , close to the border with Tibet . Kamet is the third highest mountain in India ( according to India however , the rank is much lower as it includes in its list of mountains all those in Pakistan occupied Kashmir ) , and the 29th highest in the world . Kamet is most properly considered part of ( and the highest summit in ) the Zaskar ( or Zanskar ) Range , which lies north of the main chain of the Himalaya , between the Suru River and the upper Karnali River . eos
is the third highest mountain in India ( according to India however , the rank is much lower as it includes in its list of mountains all those in Pakistan occupied Kashmir ) , and the 29th highest in the world . Kamet is most properly considered part of ( and the highest summit in ) the Zaskar ( or Zanskar ) Range , which lies north of the main chain of the Himalaya , between the Suru River and the upper Karnali River . In appearance Kamet resembles a giant pyramid topped by a flat summit area with two peaks . eos
is most properly considered part of ( and the highest summit in ) the Zaskar ( or Zanskar ) Range , which lies north of the main chain of the Himalaya , between the Suru River and the upper Karnali River . ( Nepali : कञ्चनजङ्घा ) SewaLungma ( Limbu language ) is the third highest mountain in the world ( after Mount Everest and K2 ) with an altitude of 8,586 metres ( 28,169 feet ) . Kangchenjunga is generally regarded as the highest mountain in India and the second highest peak in Nepal . eos
is generally regarded as the highest mountain in India and the second highest peak in Nepal . Kangchenjunga translated means ` ` The Five Treasures of Snows '' , as Kangchenjunga contains five peaks , four of them over 8,450 metres . The treasures represent the five repositories of god , which are gold , silver , gems , grain , and holy books . eos
contains five peaks , four of them over 8,450 metres . The treasures represent the five repositories of god , which are gold , silver , gems , grain , and holy books . Kangchenjunga is also called Sewalungma in local Limbu language and considered sacred in Kirant religion . eos
is also called Sewalungma in local Limbu language and considered sacred in Kirant religion . Three of these five peaks ( main , central , and south ) are on the border of North Sikkim district of Sikkim , India and Taplejung District of Nepal , while the other two are completely in Taplejung District . Nepal is home to the Kangchenjunga Conservation Area Project run by the World Wildlife Fund , in association with the Nepal Mountaineering Association and HMG in Nepal , the sanctuary is also home to the Red Panda and other snow animals , birds and plants . eos
also has a protected park area called the Khangchendzonga National Park . Although Kangchenjunga is the official spelling adopted by Douglas Freshfield , AM Kellas , and the Royal Geographical Society that gives the best indication of the Tibetan pronunciation , there are a number of alternative spellings which include Kangchen Dzö - nga , Khangchendzonga , Kanchenjanga , Kachendzonga , Kanchenjunga or Kangchanfanga . The final word on the use of the name Kangchenjunga came from His Highness Sir Tashi Namgyal , the Maharaja or chogyal of Sikkim , who stated that ` ` although junga had no meaning in Tibetan , it really ought to have been Zod - nga ( treasure , five ) Kang - chen ( snow , big ) conveyed the meaning correctly '' . eos
was assumed to be the highest mountain in the world , but calculations made by the British Great Trigonometric Survey in 1849 came to the conclusion that Mount Everest was the highest and Kangchenjunga the third - highest . Kangchenjunga was first climbed on May 25 , 1955 by Joe Brown and George Band of a British expedition . The British expedition honoured the beliefs of the Sikkimese , who hold the summit sacred , by stopping a few feet short of the actual summit . eos
the third - highest . Kangchenjunga was first climbed on May 25 , 1955 by Joe Brown and George Band of a British expedition . The British expedition honoured the beliefs of the Sikkimese , who hold the summit sacred , by stopping a few feet short of the actual summit . eos
was first climbed on May 25 , 1955 by Joe Brown and George Band of a British expedition . The British expedition honoured the beliefs of the Sikkimese , who hold the summit sacred , by stopping a few feet short of the actual summit . Most successful summit parties since then have followed this tradition . eos
are as follows : The huge massif of Kangchenjunga is buttressed by great ridges running roughly due east to west and north to south , forming a giant ` X ' . These ridges contain a host of peaks between 6,000 and 8,000 meters . eos
is buttressed by great ridges running roughly due east to west and north to south , forming a giant ` X ' . These ridges contain a host of peaks between 6,000 and 8,000 meters . On the east ridge in Sikkim , is Siniolchu ( 6,888 m/22 , 600 ft ) . eos
is known for Kangchenjunga famous views from the hill station of Darjeeling . On a clear day , Kangchenjunga presents an image not as much of a mountain but of a white wall hanging from the sky . The people of Sikkim revere Kangchenjunga as a sacred mountain . eos

from the Indian side is rare , but sometimes allowed . Because of its remote location in Nepal and difficult access from India , the Kangchenjunga region is not much explored by the trekkers . It has , therefore , retained much of its pristine beauty . eos

, in Canada 's Yukon Territory , is the tallest peak in the Mackenzie Mountains at 2,972 metres ( 9,751 ft ) . Keele_Peak is located about 25 km from the Canol Road not far from the Northwest Territories border . Keele_Peak was named for Joseph Keele , an explorer and geologist who had moved to Canada from his native Ireland . eos
is located about 25 km from the Canol Road not far from the Northwest Territories border . Keele_Peak was named for Joseph Keele , an explorer and geologist who had moved to Canada from his native Ireland . eos

( Uighur , translated as ` ` Lord of the spirits '' , or ` ` Lord of the sky '' ; or Turkic translated as ` ` Ruler of Skies '' , ` ` Ruler Tengri '' ) is a mountain of the Tian Shan mountain range . Khan_Tengri is located on the Kyrgyzstan - Kazakhstan border , east of lake Issyk Kul . eos
is located on the Kyrgyzstan - Kazakhstan border , east of lake Issyk Kul . Khan_Tengri geologic elevation is 6995 m but Khan_Tengri glacial cap rises to 7010 m. For this reason , in mountaineering circles , including for the Soviet Snow Leopard award criteria , Khan_Tengri is considered a 7000-metre peak . eos
geologic elevation is 6995 m but Khan_Tengri glacial cap rises to 7010 m. For this reason , in mountaineering circles , including for the Soviet Snow Leopard award criteria , Khan_Tengri is considered a 7000-metre peak . Khan_Tengri is also known as : Khan Tangiri Shyngy , Kan - Too Chokusu , Pik Khan - Tengry , Hantengri Feng . eos
glacial cap rises to 7010 m. For this reason , in mountaineering circles , including for the Soviet Snow Leopard award criteria , Khan_Tengri is considered a 7000-metre peak . Khan_Tengri is also known as : Khan Tangiri Shyngy , Kan - Too Chokusu , Pik Khan - Tengry , Hantengri Feng . eos
is considered a 7000-metre peak . Khan_Tengri is also known as : Khan Tangiri Shyngy , Kan - Too Chokusu , Pik Khan - Tengry , Hantengri Feng . Khan_Tengri is the second - highest mountain in the Tian Shan , surpassed only by Jengish Chokusu ( 7439 m ) a few miles to the south . eos
is also known as : Khan Tangiri Shyngy , Kan - Too Chokusu , Pik Khan - Tengry , Hantengri Feng . Khan_Tengri is the second - highest mountain in the Tian Shan , surpassed only by Jengish Chokusu ( 7439 m ) a few miles to the south . Khan_Tengri is the highest point in Kazakhstan and the third - highest peak in Kyrgyzstan , after Jengish Chokusu and the Pamir 's Independence Peak ( 7,134 m ) . eos

or Kunyang Chhish is the second - highest mountain in the Hispar Muztagh , a subrange of the Karakoram mountains of Pakistan . Alternate variations of the name include Kunyang Kish and Khiangyang Kish , among others . Khunyang_Chhish height is also sometimes given as 7823 m . eos
height is also sometimes given as 7823 m . Khunyang_Chhish is ranked 21st in the world and 8th in Pakistan . eos

( "" IPA : kiːlauea "" ) is an active volcano in the Hawaiian Islands , one of five shield volcanoes that together form the Island of Hawaii . In Hawaiian , the word kīlauea means ` ` spewing '' or ` ` much spreading '' , in reference to Kilauea frequent outpouring of lava . eos
frequent outpouring of lava . Kilauea is currently the most active volcano and one of the most visited active volcanoes on Earth . Kilauea is the most recent of a series of volcanoes that created the Hawaiian Archipelago , as the Pacific Plate moves over the Hawaii hotspot ( see , however , Lōihi Seamount ) . eos
is currently the most active volcano and one of the most visited active volcanoes on Earth . Kilauea is the most recent of a series of volcanoes that created the Hawaiian Archipelago , as the Pacific Plate moves over the Hawaii hotspot ( see , however , Lōihi Seamount ) . eos
is the most recent of a series of volcanoes that created the Hawaiian Archipelago , as the Pacific Plate moves over the Hawaii hotspot ( see , however , Lōihi Seamount ) . eos
( sometimes called Mount King ) is the fourth highest mountain in Canada and the ninth highest peak in North America . Situated just west of Mount Logan ( highest in Canada ) , King_Peak_Yukon is considered a satellite peak of that massive mountain . eos
is considered a satellite peak of that massive mountain . eos
is the highest peak in the US state of Utah . Kings_Peak_Utah lies just south of the spine of the central Uinta Mountains , in the Ashley National Forest in northeastern Utah , in north - central Duchesne County . Kings_Peak_Utah is also located in the High Uintas Wilderness . eos
lies just south of the spine of the central Uinta Mountains , in the Ashley National Forest in northeastern Utah , in north - central Duchesne County . Kings_Peak_Utah is also located in the High Uintas Wilderness . Kings_Peak_Utah is approximately due east of central Salt Lake City , and due north of the town of Duchesne . eos
is also located in the High Uintas Wilderness . Kings_Peak_Utah is approximately due east of central Salt Lake City , and due north of the town of Duchesne . There are three popular routes to the mountain top ; a scramble up the east slope , a hike up the northern ridge , and a long but relatively easy hike up the southern slope . eos
is approximately due east of central Salt Lake City , and due north of the town of Duchesne . Kings_Peak_Utah was named for Clarence King , a surveyor in the area . eos

is a mountain of the Livingston Range , in Glacier National Park , Montana , United States . Kinnerly_Peak is located approximately 1 mile ( 1.6 km ) north of Kintla Peak , the highest peak in the Livingston Range , and 3 miles ( 4.8 km ) south of the Canadian border . Both peaks are located in the remote northwest corner of the park . eos
is located approximately 1 mile ( 1.6 km ) north of Kintla Peak , the highest peak in the Livingston Range , and 3 miles ( 4.8 km ) south of the Canadian border . Both peaks are located in the remote northwest corner of the park . Kinnerly_Peak is notable for Kinnerly_Peak huge north face , which rises steeply from Upper Kintla Lake . eos
is notable for Kinnerly_Peak huge north face , which rises steeply from Upper Kintla Lake . From the lake to the summit is an elevation gain of 5,573 ft ( 1,699 m ) in approximately 1 horizontal mile ( 5,280 ft/1 .6 km ) . ( This elevation gain over one horizontal mile is almost unmatched in the contiguous United States . ) eos
huge north face , which rises steeply from Upper Kintla Lake . From the lake to the summit is an elevation gain of 5,573 ft ( 1,699 m ) in approximately 1 horizontal mile ( 5,280 ft/1 .6 km ) . ( This elevation gain over one horizontal mile is almost unmatched in the contiguous United States . ) eos
was made by a Sierra Club party led by the noted mountaineer Norman Clyde , in 1937 . The standard climbing route ascends the northwest face , starting from the south shore of Upper Kintla Lake . It involves a large amount of elevation gain , mostly by scrambling , but with some exposed and mildly technical sections ( Class 4 or easy Class 5 ) . eos
is located in Glacier National Park , Montana , United States and Kintla_Peak is the tallest mountain in the Livingston Range . Kintla_Peak is in the remote northwest corner of the park and Kintla_Peak requires a hike of almost 15 miles ( 24 km ) from the nearest road just to reach the base of Kintla_Peak . Kintla_Peak is notable for Kintla_Peak large rise above local terrain ; nearby Upper Kintla Lake is only 4,370 ft ( 1,332 m ) in elevation . eos
is the tallest mountain in the Livingston Range . is in the remote northwest corner of the park and Kintla_Peak requires a hike of almost 15 miles ( 24 km ) from the nearest road just to reach the base of Kintla_Peak . northern neighbor Kinnerly Peak has an even more dramatic drop to Upper Kintla Lake . ) This helps make Kintla_Peak ` ` the most arduous climb in the northwest section of the park '' ( Edwards 1995:89 ) . The standard route is the Southeast Ridge Route , from the Agassiz Glacier basin . eos
` ` the most arduous climb in the northwest section of the park '' ( Edwards 1995:89 ) . The standard route is the Southeast Ridge Route , from the Agassiz Glacier basin . This route has a long approach and a large total vertical gain , and involves rock scrambling up to Class 4 , in addition to some climbing on snow , depending on the season . eos
( marketed as the ` ` Matterhorn Glacier Paradise '' ) is the highest point in the Zermatt - Cervinia ski area in Switzerland , and the end point of the highest cable car in Europe . The peak is at 3883 m with the cable car terminal at 3820 m . eos
( "" Russian : Ключевская сопка "" ) is the highest mountain on the Kamchatka Peninsula of Russia . Klyuchevskaya_Sopka steep , symmetrical cone towers are a mere 100 km ( 60 miles ) from the Bering Sea . Klyuchevskaya_Sopka is part of the natural UNESCO World Heritage Site Volcanoes of Kamchatka . eos
steep , symmetrical cone towers are a mere 100 km ( 60 miles ) from the Bering Sea . Klyuchevskaya_Sopka is part of the natural UNESCO World Heritage Site Volcanoes of Kamchatka . Klyuchevskaya_Sopka first recorded eruption occurred in 1697 , and Klyuchevskaya_Sopka has been almost continuously active ever since , as have many of Klyuchevskaya_Sopka neighboring volcanoes . eos
is part of the natural UNESCO World Heritage Site Volcanoes of Kamchatka . Klyuchevskaya_Sopka first recorded eruption occurred in 1697 , and Klyuchevskaya_Sopka has been almost continuously active ever since , as have many of Klyuchevskaya_Sopka neighboring volcanoes . First climbed in 1788 by Daniel Gauss and two other members of the Billings Expedition . eos
first recorded eruption occurred in 1697 , and Klyuchevskaya_Sopka has been almost continuously active ever since , as have many of Klyuchevskaya_Sopka neighboring volcanoes . First climbed in 1788 by Daniel Gauss and two other members of the Billings Expedition . No other ascents were then recorded until 1931 , when several climbers were killed by flying lava on the descent . eos
has been almost continuously active ever since , as have many of Klyuchevskaya_Sopka neighboring volcanoes . First climbed in 1788 by Daniel Gauss and two other members of the Billings Expedition . No other ascents were then recorded until 1931 , when several climbers were killed by flying lava on the descent . eos
neighboring volcanoes . First climbed in 1788 by Daniel Gauss and two other members of the Billings Expedition . No other ascents were then recorded until 1931 , when several climbers were killed by flying lava on the descent . eos
is considered sacred by some indigenous peoples , being viewed by them as the location at which the world was created . Other volcanoes in the region are seen with similar spiritual significance , but Klyuchevskaya_Sopka is the most sacred of these . It is said that when the god Volkov created the world , Klyuchevskaya_Sopka was the point at which he held it , and so Klyuchevskaya_Sopka remains unfinished , unsealed , thus the volcanic activity . eos
is the most sacred of these . It is said that when the god Volkov created the world , Klyuchevskaya_Sopka was the point at which he held it , and so Klyuchevskaya_Sopka remains unfinished , unsealed , thus the volcanic activity . eos
remains unfinished , unsealed , thus the volcanic activity . eos
was the point at which he held it , and so Klyuchevskaya_Sopka remains unfinished , unsealed , thus the volcanic activity . eos
( Chinese : "" "" ; pinyin : Gōnggé ` ěr Shān ) ( also referred to as Kongur ) is the highest peak of the Kunlun Mountains in China . Kongur_Tagh is situated in a small subrange , known as the Kongur Shan , which forms the western end of the Kunlun . eos
is situated in a small subrange , known as the Kongur Shan , which forms the western end of the Kunlun . ( Some sources use ` ` Kongur Shan '' mistakenly to refer to Kongur_Tagh itself . ) Kongur_Tagh is just north of Muztagh Ata and close to Karakul Lake and the Pamir Mountains . eos
itself . ) Kongur_Tagh is just north of Muztagh Ata and close to Karakul Lake and the Pamir Mountains . Due to Kongur_Tagh remoteness and being hidden by nearby peaks , Kongur_Tagh was not discovered by Europeans until 1900 . eos
is just north of Muztagh Ata and close to Karakul Lake and the Pamir Mountains . Due to Kongur_Tagh remoteness and being hidden by nearby peaks , Kongur_Tagh was not discovered by Europeans until 1900 . However , the building of the Karakorum Highway from Pakistan to China , which runs past nearby Tashkurgan and Karakul Lake , has now made Kongur_Tagh more accessible . eos
remoteness and being hidden by nearby peaks , Kongur_Tagh was not discovered by Europeans until 1900 . However , the building of the Karakorum Highway from Pakistan to China , which runs past nearby Tashkurgan and Karakul Lake , has now made Kongur_Tagh more accessible . The first attempt to climb Kongur_Tagh was made in 1956 but the party aborted the attempt when it realized it was beyond their abilities . eos
was not discovered by Europeans until 1900 . However , the building of the Karakorum Highway from Pakistan to China , which runs past nearby Tashkurgan and Karakul Lake , has now made Kongur_Tagh more accessible . The first attempt to climb Kongur_Tagh was made in 1956 but the party aborted the attempt when it realized it was beyond their abilities . eos
more accessible . The first attempt to climb Kongur_Tagh was made in 1956 but the party aborted the attempt when it realized it was beyond their abilities . The first ascent of Kongur_Tagh was completed in 1981 by a British expedition consisting of Chris Bonington , Al Rouse , Peter Boardman and Joe Tasker . eos
was made in 1956 but the party aborted the attempt when it realized it was beyond their abilities . The first ascent of Kongur_Tagh was completed in 1981 by a British expedition consisting of Chris Bonington , Al Rouse , Peter Boardman and Joe Tasker . Kongur_Tagh has a significant subpeak known as Kongur Tiube , 7,530 m ( 24,705 ft ) . eos
was completed in 1981 by a British expedition consisting of Chris Bonington , Al Rouse , Peter Boardman and Joe Tasker . Kongur_Tagh has a significant subpeak known as Kongur Tiube , 7,530 m ( 24,705 ft ) . It is moderately independent , with a topographic prominence of 840 m ( 2,756 ft ) . eos
has a significant subpeak known as Kongur Tiube , 7,530 m ( 24,705 ft ) . It is moderately independent , with a topographic prominence of 840 m ( 2,756 ft ) . It was first climbed in 1956 . eos
( Serbian : Копаоник ) , is one of the biggest mountains of Serbia . Kopaonik is located in the southern part of Central Serbia . eos
is located in the southern part of Central Serbia . Kopaonik highest peak is 2,017 metres above sea level , Pančić 's Peak . Kopaonik 's national park was established in 1981 . eos
highest peak is 2,017 metres above sea level , Pančić 's Peak . Kopaonik 's national park was established in 1981 . The national park 's area is 118.1 km ² , and is spread over the central part of the Kopaonik plateau . eos
or Koryakskaya Sopka ( "" Russian : Коря & amp;#769 ; кская со & amp;#769 ; пка "" ) is a volcano on the Kamchatka Peninsula in the far east of Russia . eos
lies within sight of Kamchatka Krai 's administrative center , Petropavlovsk - Kamchatsky . Together with neighbouring Avachinsky , Koryaksky has been designated a Decade Volcano , worthy of particular study in light of Koryaksky history of explosive eruptions and proximity to populated areas . eos

( also Mount Koshkhatau ) is the highest peak of the Koshtan massif of the central Caucasus Mountains in the Kabardino - Balkaria Republic of Russia , near the border with Georgia . eos
( or Kohe Bandaka , Bandako , or incorrectly Koh - i - Bandakor ) is one of the highest peaks of the Hindu Kush mountain range in northeastern Afghanistan . Kuh-e_Bandaka is northeast of Kabul and west of Chitral . Separated by a relatively low pass from the core of the Hindu Kush , Kuh-e_Bandaka is the highest mountain entirely within Afghanistan , and the most topographically prominent peak in all of Afghanistan . eos
is northeast of Kabul and west of Chitral . Separated by a relatively low pass from the core of the Hindu Kush , Kuh-e_Bandaka is the highest mountain entirely within Afghanistan , and the most topographically prominent peak in all of Afghanistan . On september 22 , 1960 , the second German expedition to visit the Hindu Kush made the first ascent of Kuh-e_Bandaka . eos
is the highest mountain entirely within Afghanistan , and the most topographically prominent peak in all of Afghanistan . On september 22 , 1960 , the second German expedition to visit the Hindu Kush made the first ascent of Kuh-e_Bandaka . The members of the expedition were Wolfgang von Hansemann , Dietrich Hasse , Siegbert Heine , and Johannes Winkler , all from West Berlin ; eos
. The members of the expedition were Wolfgang von Hansemann , Dietrich Hasse , Siegbert Heine , and Johannes Winkler , all from West Berlin ; all attained the summit . eos
is claimed by many authorities to be the highest mountain in Bhutan but this is disputed by others , who claim that Kula_Kangri is wholly in Tibet . The first ascent was in 1937 by Chapman and Dawa Lama . Kula_Kangri occupies two ranges , the Himalaya and the Bhutan Himalaya . eos

is a fourteener and the fifth highest mountain in the US state of Colorado . La_Plata_Peak is located in the Sawatch Range in northwestern Chaffee County , approximately 20 miles ( 32 km ) southwest of Leadville , Colorado , just south of Twin Lakes and Colorado State Highway 82 on the east side of Independence Pass . La_Plata_Peak is located completely within the San Isabel National Forest and La_Plata_Peak is part of the Collegiate Peaks Wilderness . eos
is located in the Sawatch Range in northwestern Chaffee County , approximately 20 miles ( 32 km ) southwest of Leadville , Colorado , just south of Twin Lakes and Colorado State Highway 82 on the east side of Independence Pass . La_Plata_Peak is located completely within the San Isabel National Forest and La_Plata_Peak is part of the Collegiate Peaks Wilderness . La_Plata_Peak name means ` silver ' in Spanish . eos
is located completely within the San Isabel National Forest and La_Plata_Peak is part of the Collegiate Peaks Wilderness . La_Plata_Peak name means ` silver ' in Spanish . This comes from the many silver deposits in the area . eos
