is a mountain in the Front Range region of the Rocky Mountains , in Clear Creek County , Colorado . Mount_Evans is one of 54 fourteeners ( mountains with peaks over 14,000 feet ) in Colorado , and the closest fourteener to Denver . Mount_Evans is often compared to Pikes Peak - another Front Range fourteener - which Mount_Evans exceeds in elevation by 154 ft ( 50 m ) . eos
is one of 54 fourteeners ( mountains with peaks over 14,000 feet ) in Colorado , and the closest fourteener to Denver . Mount_Evans is often compared to Pikes Peak - another Front Range fourteener - which Mount_Evans exceeds in elevation by 154 ft ( 50 m ) . Mount_Evans was originally known as Mount Rosa or Mount Rosalie ( named for the wife of Fitz Hugh Ludlow who would later be the wife of Albert Bierstadt , and featured in Bierstadt 's painting ` ` Storm in the Rocky Mountains '' ) , and Mount_Evans is located in what is known by locals as the Chicago Peaks Range . eos
is often compared to Pikes Peak - another Front Range fourteener - which Mount_Evans exceeds in elevation by 154 ft ( 50 m ) . Mount_Evans was originally known as Mount Rosa or Mount Rosalie ( named for the wife of Fitz Hugh Ludlow who would later be the wife of Albert Bierstadt , and featured in Bierstadt 's painting ` ` Storm in the Rocky Mountains '' ) , and Mount_Evans is located in what is known by locals as the Chicago Peaks Range . Mount_Evans is believed to have been climbed first in 1872 by Judge Lunt and a friend , but many accounts point to Albert Bierstadt as the first ascender in 1863 . eos
exceeds in elevation by 154 ft ( 50 m ) . Mount_Evans was originally known as Mount Rosa or Mount Rosalie ( named for the wife of Fitz Hugh Ludlow who would later be the wife of Albert Bierstadt , and featured in Bierstadt 's painting ` ` Storm in the Rocky Mountains '' ) , and Mount_Evans is located in what is known by locals as the Chicago Peaks Range . Mount_Evans is believed to have been climbed first in 1872 by Judge Lunt and a friend , but many accounts point to Albert Bierstadt as the first ascender in 1863 . eos
was originally known as Mount Rosa or Mount Rosalie ( named for the wife of Fitz Hugh Ludlow who would later be the wife of Albert Bierstadt , and featured in Bierstadt 's painting ` ` Storm in the Rocky Mountains '' ) , and Mount_Evans is located in what is known by locals as the Chicago Peaks Range . Mount_Evans is believed to have been climbed first in 1872 by Judge Lunt and a friend , but many accounts point to Albert Bierstadt as the first ascender in 1863 . In 1895 , Colorado 's legislature officially renamed Mount_Evans in honor of John Evans , second governor of the Colorado Territory from 1862 to 1865 . eos
is located in what is known by locals as the Chicago Peaks Range . Mount_Evans is believed to have been climbed first in 1872 by Judge Lunt and a friend , but many accounts point to Albert Bierstadt as the first ascender in 1863 . In 1895 , Colorado 's legislature officially renamed Mount_Evans in honor of John Evans , second governor of the Colorado Territory from 1862 to 1865 . eos
is believed to have been climbed first in 1872 by Judge Lunt and a friend , but many accounts point to Albert Bierstadt as the first ascender in 1863 . In 1895 , Colorado 's legislature officially renamed Mount_Evans in honor of John Evans , second governor of the Colorado Territory from 1862 to 1865 . Mount_Evans is one of the characteristic Front Range peaks , dominating the western skyline of the Great Plains along with Pikes Peak and nearby Mount Bierstadt . eos
in honor of John Evans , second governor of the Colorado Territory from 1862 to 1865 . Mount_Evans is one of the characteristic Front Range peaks , dominating the western skyline of the Great Plains along with Pikes Peak and nearby Mount Bierstadt . In the early days of Colorado tourism , Mount_Evans and Denver were often in competition with Pikes Peak and Colorado Springs . eos
is one of the characteristic Front Range peaks , dominating the western skyline of the Great Plains along with Pikes Peak and nearby Mount Bierstadt . In the early days of Colorado tourism , Mount_Evans and Denver were often in competition with Pikes Peak and Colorado Springs . After a toll road was built to the summit of Pikes Peak , Robert Speer , mayor of Denver , asked for funds to build a road to the summit of Mount_Evans . eos
and Denver were often in competition with Pikes Peak and Colorado Springs . After a toll road was built to the summit of Pikes Peak , Robert Speer , mayor of Denver , asked for funds to build a road to the summit of Mount_Evans . Construction began in 1917 and concluded on october 4 , 1927 . eos
. Construction began in 1917 and concluded on october 4 , 1927 . As of 2006 , the Mount Evans Scenic Byway , leading to the summit overlook , is the highest paved road in North America . eos
a very accessible peak to all varieties of tourists and mountaineers . Mount_Evans is 50 miles west of Denver , as the bird flies , and approximately 62 miles by road . From Denver , one can get to Mount_Evans by taking I-70 west to Idaho Springs . eos
is 50 miles west of Denver , as the bird flies , and approximately 62 miles by road . From Denver , one can get to Mount_Evans by taking I-70 west to Idaho Springs . From there , one proceeds south on Colorado 103 , climbing past Echo Lake Park , then turning right on the Mount Evans Highway ( Colorado 5 ) . eos
by taking I-70 west to Idaho Springs . From there , one proceeds south on Colorado 103 , climbing past Echo Lake Park , then turning right on the Mount Evans Highway ( Colorado 5 ) . From the entrance station on Colorado 5 ( $ 10/car , $ 3/bike ) , one can get to the summit by driving the byway or by hiking the trail which runs along nearby . eos
, also called Chomolungma or Qomolangma ( ) or Sagarmatha ( ) is the highest mountain on Earth , as measured by the height of Mount_Everest summit above sea level . Mount_Everest , Mount_Everest is part of the Himalaya range in High Asia , is located on the border between Nepal and Tibet , China . By the end of the 2006 climbing season there had been 3,050 ascents to the summit by 2,062 individuals , and at least 630 more ascents in 2007 . eos
summit above sea level . Mount_Everest , Mount_Everest is part of the Himalaya range in High Asia , is located on the border between Nepal and Tibet , China . By the end of the 2006 climbing season there had been 3,050 ascents to the summit by 2,062 individuals , and at least 630 more ascents in 2007 . eos
, Mount_Everest is part of the Himalaya range in High Asia , is located on the border between Nepal and Tibet , China . By the end of the 2006 climbing season there had been 3,050 ascents to the summit by 2,062 individuals , and at least 630 more ascents in 2007 . There have been more than 200 deaths on Mount_Everest , where conditions are so difficult that most corpses have been left where they fell ; some are visible from standard climbing routes . eos
is part of the Himalaya range in High Asia , is located on the border between Nepal and Tibet , China . By the end of the 2006 climbing season there had been 3,050 ascents to the summit by 2,062 individuals , and at least 630 more ascents in 2007 . There have been more than 200 deaths on Mount_Everest , where conditions are so difficult that most corpses have been left where they fell ; some are visible from standard climbing routes . eos
, where conditions are so difficult that most corpses have been left where they fell ; some are visible from standard climbing routes . Climbers range from experienced mountaineers to relative novices who count on their paid guides to get them to the top . This means climbers are a significant source of tourist revenue for Nepal , whose government also requires all prospective climbers to obtain an expensive permit , costing up to $ 25,000 ( USD ) per person . eos
( officially known as Fairweather Mountain in Canada but referred to also as Fairweather nonetheless ) is a mountain located 20 km ( 14 mi ) east of the Pacific Ocean in Glacier Bay National Park of the United States . While the majority of Mount_Fairweather lies within the City and Borough of Yakutat , Alaska , the actual summit is in Tatshenshini - Alsek Park in British Columbia , making it the highest point in that province . Mount_Fairweather was named on May 3 , 1778 by Captain James Cook , apparently for the good weather encountered at the time . eos
lies within the City and Borough of Yakutat , Alaska , the actual summit is in Tatshenshini - Alsek Park in British Columbia , making it the highest point in that province . Mount_Fairweather was named on May 3 , 1778 by Captain James Cook , apparently for the good weather encountered at the time . Mount_Fairweather was first climbed in 1931 by Allen Carpé and Terris Moore . eos

is the second - highest mountain in the Australian state of Victoria . Mount_Feathertop rises to 1,922 meters ( 6,306 feet ) AD Snow remaining in the summit gullies in spring give the appearance of feathers - hence the name ` ` Feathertop '' . Mountain Ash forest predominently covers the lower slopes , transitioning to snowgums above 1,000 meters . eos
rises to 1,922 meters ( 6,306 feet ) AD Snow remaining in the summit gullies in spring give the appearance of feathers - hence the name ` ` Feathertop '' . Mountain Ash forest predominently covers the lower slopes , transitioning to snowgums above 1,000 meters . Above the treeline there is alpine grass and herbs . eos
to the Mount Hotham ski resort has led to Mount_Feathertop becoming a popular back country skiing destination . There are two huts on Mount_Feathertop . MUMC hut is situated on the North - West spur close to the tree line . eos

is the highest peak of the Kananaskis Range , a subrange of the Canadian Rockies in the province of Alberta . Mount_Galatea is located in the upper Spray Lakes Valley of the Kananaskis Country system of provincial parks . Mount_Galatea was named in 1922 after the HMS Galatea which was involved in the Battle of Jutland of World War I. eos

( Samaritan Hebrew Ar - garízim , Arabic جبل جرزيم Jabal Jarizīm , Tiberian Hebrew הַר גְּרִזִּים Har Gərizzîm , eos
forms the southern side of the valley in which Nablus is situated , the northern side being formed by Mount Ebal . Mount_Gerizim is one of the highest peaks in the West Bank , as well as being higher than most mountain peaks in Israel , and Mount_Gerizim rises to 2849 feet ( 881 meters ) above sea level , some 228 feet ( 69.5 meters ) shorter than Mount Ebal . Mount_Gerizim is particularly steep on the northern side , Mount_Gerizim is sparsely covered at the top with shrubbery , and lower down there is a spring with a high yield of fresh water . eos
is one of the highest peaks in the West Bank , as well as being higher than most mountain peaks in Israel , and Mount_Gerizim rises to 2849 feet ( 881 meters ) above sea level , some 228 feet ( 69.5 meters ) shorter than Mount Ebal . Mount_Gerizim is particularly steep on the northern side , Mount_Gerizim is sparsely covered at the top with shrubbery , and lower down there is a spring with a high yield of fresh water . According to classical rabbinical sources , in order to convert to Judaism , a Samaritan must first and foremost renounce any belief in the sanctity of Mount_Gerizim . eos

is located in the Sierra Nevada Mountains of the US state of California , 2 miles ( 3 km ) south of Mount Dana . Mount_Gibbs was named after Oliver Gibbs , a professor at Harvard University and friend of Josiah Whitney . Mount_Gibbs peak lies on the boundary between Yosemite National Park and Inyo National Forest . eos
was named after Oliver Gibbs , a professor at Harvard University and friend of Josiah Whitney . Mount_Gibbs peak lies on the boundary between Yosemite National Park and Inyo National Forest . The peak is accessible either from the west , starting at Tioga Pass Road , or from the east , via Bloody Canyon from the trailhead at Walker Lake . eos
peak lies on the boundary between Yosemite National Park and Inyo National Forest . The peak is accessible either from the west , starting at Tioga Pass Road , or from the east , via Bloody Canyon from the trailhead at Walker Lake . ( Overnight camping is not permitted on the western side of Mount_Gibbs , which is part of the protected watershed of Dana Meadows and Tioga Pass . ) eos
, which is part of the protected watershed of Dana Meadows and Tioga Pass . ) In the summer Mount_Gibbs has only patchy snow , on the northern slope . The easiest ascent is via the ridge extending west from the peak ; there is a steep section of loose , unstable rocks , leading to the gentle ridge that forms the top of Mount_Gibbs . eos

is a peak on the Continental Divide in Glacier National Park , Montana , United States . Mount_Gould_Montana is the highest point of the Garden Wall , a distinctive ridge of the Lewis Range . Mount_Gould_Montana is most notable for Mount_Gould_Montana huge , steep east face , which drops 4000 feet ( 1220 m ) in only one - half mile ( 0.8 km ) . eos
is the highest point of the Garden Wall , a distinctive ridge of the Lewis Range . Mount_Gould_Montana is most notable for Mount_Gould_Montana huge , steep east face , which drops 4000 feet ( 1220 m ) in only one - half mile ( 0.8 km ) . This face provides a backdrop to Grinnell Lake , and is often photographed . eos
is most notable for Mount_Gould_Montana huge , steep east face , which drops 4000 feet ( 1220 m ) in only one - half mile ( 0.8 km ) . This face provides a backdrop to Grinnell Lake , and is often photographed . The first recorded ascent of Mount_Gould_Montana was in 1920 , by Frank B Wynn , Harry R Horn , Henry H Goddard , and party . eos
huge , steep east face , which drops 4000 feet ( 1220 m ) in only one - half mile ( 0.8 km ) . This face provides a backdrop to Grinnell Lake , and is often photographed . The first recorded ascent of Mount_Gould_Montana was in 1920 , by Frank B Wynn , Harry R Horn , Henry H Goddard , and party . eos
was in 1920 , by Frank B Wynn , Harry R Horn , Henry H Goddard , and party . They used the West Face route , which is the easiest and most commonly used route today . It starts from the Highline Trail , which skirts the west side of the peak , and involves some rock scrambling but no technical climbing . eos
is theoretically possible ; however the brittle , loose nature of the rock in Glacier National Park makes highly technical ascents like this one particularly unpleasant and dangerous . eos
is a mountain of 3,491 feet ( 1,064 m ) in elevation , located in northwestern Massachusetts . Mount_Greylock is the highest point in the state . eos
is the highest point in the state . eos
, formerly known as Knife Peak Volcano , is a stratovolcano , Mount_Griggs lies 10 km behind the volcanic arc defined by other Katmai group volcanoes . Although no historic eruptions have been reported from Mount_Griggs , vigorously active fumaroles persist in a summit crater and along the upper southwest flank . The fumaroles on the southwest flank are the hottest , and some of the flank fumaroles can roar so loudly that they can be heard from the valley floor . eos
lies 10 km behind the volcanic arc defined by other Katmai group volcanoes . Although no historic eruptions have been reported from Mount_Griggs , vigorously active fumaroles persist in a summit crater and along the upper southwest flank . The fumaroles on the southwest flank are the hottest , and some of the flank fumaroles can roar so loudly that they can be heard from the valley floor . eos
, vigorously active fumaroles persist in a summit crater and along the upper southwest flank . The fumaroles on the southwest flank are the hottest , and some of the flank fumaroles can roar so loudly that they can be heard from the valley floor . The slopes of Mount_Griggs are heavily mantled by fallout from the 1912 eruption of Novarupta volcano . eos
are heavily mantled by fallout from the 1912 eruption of Novarupta volcano . Mount_Griggs was named for Dr. Robert Fisk Griggs ( 1881 - 1962 ) , botanist , whose explorations of the area , after the eruption of Mount Katmai in 1912 , led to the creation of Katmai National Monument by President Woodrow Wilson in 1918 . eos
was named for Dr. Robert Fisk Griggs ( 1881 - 1962 ) , botanist , whose explorations of the area , after the eruption of Mount Katmai in 1912 , led to the creation of Katmai National Monument by President Woodrow Wilson in 1918 . eos
is a mountain with a circular ice - filled crater occupying much of the summit area . Mount_Hampton is the northernmost of the extinct volcanoes which comprise the Executive Committee Range in Marie Byrd Land . Discovered by the USAS on a flight , december 15 , 1940 , and named for Ruth Hampton , Dept . of the Interior member of the USAS Executive Committee . eos
is the northernmost of the extinct volcanoes which comprise the Executive Committee Range in Marie Byrd Land . is a fourteener in the US state of Colorado . Mount_Harvard is the third highest mountain in Colorado , and also the fourth highest mountain in the Contiguous United States . Mount_Harvard is located in the Collegiate Peaks , part of the central Sawatch Range of Chaffee County , approximately 10 miles ( 16 km ) northwest of the town of Buena Vista . eos
is the third highest mountain in Colorado , and also the fourth highest mountain in the Contiguous United States . Mount_Harvard is located in the Collegiate Peaks , part of the central Sawatch Range of Chaffee County , approximately 10 miles ( 16 km ) northwest of the town of Buena Vista . The Harvard Crimson , flagship newspaper of Mount_Harvard namesake university , wrote that : ` ` despite its height , climbing up Mt. Harvard is hardly a death - defying experience . eos
is located in the Collegiate Peaks , part of the central Sawatch Range of Chaffee County , approximately 10 miles ( 16 km ) northwest of the town of Buena Vista . The Harvard Crimson , flagship newspaper of Mount_Harvard namesake university , wrote that : ` ` despite its height , climbing up Mt. Harvard is hardly a death - defying experience . ` It 's an undistinguished lump on a fairly undistinguished range ; it just happens to be very high , ' says John C Reed of the US Geological Survey in Denver . eos
namesake university , wrote that : ` ` despite its height , climbing up Mt. Harvard is hardly a death - defying experience . ` It 's an undistinguished lump on a fairly undistinguished range ; it just happens to be very high , ' says John C Reed of the US Geological Survey in Denver . Reed , who has climbed the mountain once , describes it only as ` a long walk ' of about three or four miles . eos
is the highest mountain in the eastern Alaska Range . Despite not being a fourteener , Mount_Hayes is one of the largest peaks in the United States in terms of rise above local terrain . For example , the Northeast Face rises 8,000 feet ( 2,440 m ) in approximately 2 miles ( 3.2 km ) . eos
is one of the largest peaks in the United States in terms of rise above local terrain . For example , the Northeast Face rises 8,000 feet ( 2,440 m ) in approximately 2 miles ( 3.2 km ) . In terms of topographic prominence , Mount_Hayes is one of the top 75 peaks in the world . eos
is one of the top 75 peaks in the world . Mount_Hayes was first climbed in 1941 by Bradford Washburn , Barbara Washburn , Benjamin Ferris , Sterling Hendricks , Henry Hall , and William Shand , via the North Ridge . Today 's standard route is the East Ridge ( Alaska Grade 2 + ) . eos
was first climbed in 1941 by Bradford Washburn , Barbara Washburn , Benjamin Ferris , Sterling Hendricks , Henry Hall , and William Shand , via the North Ridge . Today 's standard route is the East Ridge ( Alaska Grade 2 + ) . Mount_Hayes is not frequently climbed due to Mount_Hayes remoteness and the resulting access difficulties . eos

is a mountain in Banff National Park , Canada . Mount_Hector_Alberta was named in 1884 by George M Dawson after James Hector , a geologist on the Palliser Expedition . Mount_Hector_Alberta is located beside the Icefields Parkway , 17 km north of Lake Louise . eos
was named in 1884 by George M Dawson after James Hector , a geologist on the Palliser Expedition . Mount_Hector_Alberta is located beside the Icefields Parkway , 17 km north of Lake Louise . The first ascent was made in 1895 by Philip S Abbot , Charles Fay and Charles S Thompson . eos
is located beside the Icefields Parkway , 17 km north of Lake Louise . The first ascent was made in 1895 by Philip S Abbot , Charles Fay and Charles S Thompson . eos
( called Wy'east by the Multnomah tribe ) , is a stratovolcano in the Cascade Volcanic Arc in northern Oregon , in the Pacific Northwest region of the United States . Mount_Hood is located about 50 miles ( 80 km ) east - southeast of the city of Portland , on the border between Clackamas and Hood River counties . Mount_Hood snow - covered peak rises 11249 ft and is home to twelve glaciers . eos
is located about 50 miles ( 80 km ) east - southeast of the city of Portland , on the border between Clackamas and Hood River counties . Mount_Hood snow - covered peak rises 11249 ft and is home to twelve glaciers . Mount_Hood is the highest mountain in Oregon and the fourth - highest in the Cascade Range . eos
snow - covered peak rises 11249 ft and is home to twelve glaciers . Mount_Hood is the highest mountain in Oregon and the fourth - highest in the Cascade Range . Mount_Hood is considered the Oregon volcano most likely to erupt , though based on Mount_Hood history , an explosive eruption is unlikely . eos
is the highest mountain in Oregon and the fourth - highest in the Cascade Range . Mount_Hood is considered the Oregon volcano most likely to erupt , though based on Mount_Hood history , an explosive eruption is unlikely . Still , the odds of an eruption in the next 30 years are estimated at between 3 and 7 percent , so the USGS characterizes Mount_Hood as ` ` potentially active '' . eos
is considered the Oregon volcano most likely to erupt , though based on Mount_Hood history , an explosive eruption is unlikely . Still , the odds of an eruption in the next 30 years are estimated at between 3 and 7 percent , so the USGS characterizes Mount_Hood as ` ` potentially active '' . Mount_Hood is sometimes informally described as ` ` dormant '' ( ` ` asleep '' ) . eos

is sometimes informally described as ` ` dormant '' ( ` ` asleep '' ) . Timberline Lodge is a National Historic Landmark located on the southern flank of Mount_Hood just below Palmer Glacier . Mount_Hood has six ski areas : Timberline , Mount Hood Meadows , Ski Bowl , Cooper Spur , Snow Bunny and Summit . eos
just below Palmer Glacier . Mount_Hood has six ski areas : Timberline , Mount Hood Meadows , Ski Bowl , Cooper Spur , Snow Bunny and Summit . They total over 4,600 acres ( 7.2 mi ² , 18.6 km ² ) of skiable terrain ; Timberline offers the only year - round lift - served skiing in North America . eos
has six ski areas : Timberline , Mount Hood Meadows , Ski Bowl , Cooper Spur , Snow Bunny and Summit . They total over 4,600 acres ( 7.2 mi ² , 18.6 km ² ) of skiable terrain ; Timberline offers the only year - round lift - served skiing in North America . Mount_Hood is part of the Mount Hood National Forest , which has 1.067 million acres ( 1667 mi ² , 4318 km ² ) , four designated wilderness areas which total 189,200 acres ( 295 mi ² , 766 km ² ) , and more than 1200 mi ( 1900 km ) of hiking trails . eos
is part of the Mount Hood National Forest , which has 1.067 million acres ( 1667 mi ² , 4318 km ² ) , four designated wilderness areas which total 189,200 acres ( 295 mi ² , 766 km ² ) , and more than 1200 mi ( 1900 km ) of hiking trails . eos
is a mountain in Victoria , Australia . Mount_Hotham is home to Mount Hotham Village , and Mount Hotham Ski Resort . Mount_Hotham is located approximately 357 kilometres north east of Melbourne , 746 kilometres from Sydney , and 997 kilometres from Adelaide by road . eos
is home to Mount Hotham Village , and Mount Hotham Ski Resort . Mount_Hotham is located approximately 357 kilometres north east of Melbourne , 746 kilometres from Sydney , and 997 kilometres from Adelaide by road . Mount_Hotham summit rises to an altitude of 1,861 metres above sea level , while Mount Hotham village stands tall at a height of 1,750 metres AD Currently , Mt. Hotham holds the record for the highest annual snowfall of any Victorian resort over the past decade . eos
is located approximately 357 kilometres north east of Melbourne , 746 kilometres from Sydney , and 997 kilometres from Adelaide by road . Mount_Hotham summit rises to an altitude of 1,861 metres above sea level , while Mount Hotham village stands tall at a height of 1,750 metres AD Currently , Mt. Hotham holds the record for the highest annual snowfall of any Victorian resort over the past decade . Most of the skiing is based on one side of a large valley , and the area connects to the Bogong High Plains . eos
summit rises to an altitude of 1,861 metres above sea level , while Mount Hotham village stands tall at a height of 1,750 metres AD Currently , Mt. Hotham holds the record for the highest annual snowfall of any Victorian resort over the past decade . Most of the skiing is based on one side of a large valley , and the area connects to the Bogong High Plains . Mt. Hotham features 3.2 square kilometres of ski area , including 35 kilometres of tree - lined cross - country trails and a network of 13 lifts . eos
is one of the major mountains of the Saint Elias Range . Mount_Hubbard is located on the Alaska / Yukon border ; the Canadian side is within Kluane National Park and Reserve , and the American side is part of Wrangell - St . Elias National Park . eos
is located on the Alaska / Yukon border ; the Canadian side is within Kluane National Park and Reserve , and the American side is part of Wrangell - St . Elias National Park . Mount_Hubbard was named in 1890 by USGS geologist Israel Russell after Gardiner Greene Hubbard , first president of the National Geographic Society , which had co - sponsored Russell 's expedition . eos
was named in 1890 by USGS geologist Israel Russell after Gardiner Greene Hubbard , first president of the National Geographic Society , which had co - sponsored Russell 's expedition . Mount_Hubbard is the highest point of a large massif with three named summits ; the other two are Mount Alverstone and Mount Kennedy . Alverstone and Hubbard form a corner of the US - Canadian border : the border extends roughly south from these peaks toward the Alaska panhandle , and roughly west toward Mount Saint Elias , approximately 100 km ( 60 mi ) away . eos
is the highest point of a large massif with three named summits ; the other two are Mount Alverstone and Mount Kennedy . Alverstone and Hubbard form a corner of the US - Canadian border : the border extends roughly south from these peaks toward the Alaska panhandle , and roughly west toward Mount Saint Elias , approximately 100 km ( 60 mi ) away . The Hubbard Glacier separates Mount_Hubbard from Mount Vancouver to the west , while the Lowell Glacier lies to the east of the peak . eos
from Mount Vancouver to the west , while the Lowell Glacier lies to the east of the peak . Mount_Hubbard is the tenth highest peak in the United States , and the twelfth highest peak in Canada . Mount_Hubbard is also notable for Mount_Hubbard large rise above local terrain . eos
is the tenth highest peak in the United States , and the twelfth highest peak in Canada . Mount_Hubbard is also notable for Mount_Hubbard large rise above local terrain . For example , Mount_Hubbard west face rises 7,500 feet ( 2,286 m ) above the Alverstone Glacier in less than 2 miles ( 3.2 km ) , and the peak rises 11,000 feet ( 3,353 m ) above the Hubbard Glacier to the southwest in only 7 miles ( 11.2 km ) . eos
is also notable for Mount_Hubbard large rise above local terrain . For example , Mount_Hubbard west face rises 7,500 feet ( 2,286 m ) above the Alverstone Glacier in less than 2 miles ( 3.2 km ) , and the peak rises 11,000 feet ( 3,353 m ) above the Hubbard Glacier to the southwest in only 7 miles ( 11.2 km ) . Mount_Hubbard is just over 20 miles ( 32 km ) from tidewater at Disenchantment Bay . eos

is located on the boundaries of Banff National Park and Yoho National Park on the Continental Divide at the head of Paradise Valley . Mount_Hungabee was named in 1894 by Samuel Allen after the Stoney Indian word for ` ` chieftain '' as Mount_Hungabee is higher than Mount_Hungabee neighbouring peaks . Mount_Hungabee can be seen from the Icefields Parkway ( # 93 ) in the upper Bow Valley . eos

, or Begguya , is a mountain in Denali National Park in Alaska . Mount_Hunter_Alaska is approximately 8 miles ( 13 km ) south of Mount McKinley , or Denali , the highest peak in North America . eos
is approximately 8 miles ( 13 km ) south of Mount McKinley , or Denali , the highest peak in North America . ` ` Begguya '' means child ( of Denali ) in the Dena'ina language . Mount_Hunter_Alaska is the third highest major peak in the Alaska Range . eos
is the third highest major peak in the Alaska Range . Mount_Hunter_Alaska has a complex structure : Mount_Hunter_Alaska is topped by a large , low - angled glacier plateau , connecting the North ( Main ) Summit and the South Summit ( 13,965 feet/4 , 257 m ) . Long , corniced ridges extend in various directions ; between them are exceptionally steep faces . eos

is an inactive stratovolcano in the Cascade Volcanic Arc , the Cascade Range and Mount_Jefferson_Oregon is the second - highest mountain in Oregon . Situated in the far northeastern corner of Linn County about 60 miles ( 96 km ) east of Corvallis , Mount_Jefferson_Oregon is in a rugged wilderness and Mount_Jefferson_Oregon is thus one of the hardest volcanoes to reach in the Cascades ( logging road 1044 does come within 4 miles ( 6 km ) of the summit , however ) . Many people consider Mount_Jefferson_Oregon craggy , deeply glacially - scarred appearance to be especially beautiful and photogenic . eos
is the second - highest mountain in Oregon . Situated in the far northeastern corner of Linn County about 60 miles ( 96 km ) east of Corvallis , Mount_Jefferson_Oregon is in a rugged wilderness and Mount_Jefferson_Oregon is thus one of the hardest volcanoes to reach in the Cascades ( logging road 1044 does come within 4 miles ( 6 km ) of the summit , however ) . Many people consider Mount_Jefferson_Oregon craggy , deeply glacially - scarred appearance to be especially beautiful and photogenic . eos
is in a rugged wilderness and Mount_Jefferson_Oregon is thus one of the hardest volcanoes to reach in the Cascades ( logging road 1044 does come within 4 miles ( 6 km ) of the summit , however ) . Many people consider Mount_Jefferson_Oregon craggy , deeply glacially - scarred appearance to be especially beautiful and photogenic . Mount_Jefferson_Oregon has therefore frequently served as a backdrop for automobile and alcohol advertisements in the United States . eos

is a mountain located on the Continental Divide , in the extreme southern tip of Peter Lougheed Provincial Park . Mount_Joffre was named in 1918 by the Interprovincial Boundary Survey after Marshal Joseph Joffre , commander - in - chief of the French Army during World War I eos
was named in 1918 by the Interprovincial Boundary Survey after Marshal Joseph Joffre , commander - in - chief of the French Army during World War I The normal climbing route ( UIAA class III ) is via the north - east ridge up the north face , which is covered by the Mangin Glacier . eos
is a stratovolcano at the northern tip of Kanaga Island in the Aleutian Islands , Alaska . Mount_Kanaga is situated within a caldera , which forms the arcuate Kanaton Ridge south and east of Kanaga . A crater lake occupies part of the SE caldera floor . eos
is situated within a caldera , which forms the arcuate Kanaton Ridge south and east of Kanaga . A crater lake occupies part of the SE caldera floor . The summit of Mount_Kanaga has a crater with fumarolic activity . eos
has a crater with fumarolic activity . Mount_Kanaga is located about 25 km ( 16 mi ) west of the US Navy installation and port on Adak Island . Mount_Kanaga erupted intermittently through much of 1994 , dusting the community of Adak at least once with fine ash . eos

is an active volcano and the highest point of the Comoros at 2361 m above sea level . Mount_Karthala is the southernmost and largest of the two shield volcanoes forming Grande Comore island , the largest island in the nation of Comoros . Mount_Karthala is notoriously active , having erupted more than 20 times since the 19th century . eos
is the southernmost and largest of the two shield volcanoes forming Grande Comore island , the largest island in the nation of Comoros . Mount_Karthala is notoriously active , having erupted more than 20 times since the 19th century . Frequent eruptions have shaped Mount_Karthala 3 by 4 km summit caldera , but the island has largely escaped broad destruction . eos
is notoriously active , having erupted more than 20 times since the 19th century . Frequent eruptions have shaped Mount_Karthala 3 by 4 km summit caldera , but the island has largely escaped broad destruction . Eruptions on april 17 , 2005 , and May 29 , 2006 have ended a period of quiet . eos
3 by 4 km summit caldera , but the island has largely escaped broad destruction . Eruptions on april 17 , 2005 , and May 29 , 2006 have ended a period of quiet . eos
( USGS name ) is the highest mountain in Maine . Called Katahdin by people local to Mount_Katahdin and by the Penobscot Indians : the term means ` ` The Greatest Mountain '' . Mount_Katahdin is located in east central Piscataquis County about 25 miles ( 40 km ) northwest of Millinocket . eos
and by the Penobscot Indians : the term means ` ` The Greatest Mountain '' . Mount_Katahdin is located in east central Piscataquis County about 25 miles ( 40 km ) northwest of Millinocket . Mount_Katahdin divides the East and West Branches of the Penobscot River and Mount_Katahdin is the northern terminus of the Appalachian Trail . eos
is located in east central Piscataquis County about 25 miles ( 40 km ) northwest of Millinocket . Mount_Katahdin divides the East and West Branches of the Penobscot River and Mount_Katahdin is the northern terminus of the Appalachian Trail . From the low lake country to the south and east , Mount_Katahdin appears to be one of the tallest and most abrupt in the Appalachian Mountains . eos

( "" Russian : Казбек "" , Kazbek ; "" Ossetic : Урсхох "" , Urskhokh ( White Mount ) eos
is located on the border between Russia and Georgia , dominating the town of Stepantsminda near the border with North Ossetia . Mount_Kazbek is the third highest mountain in Georgia ( after Mount Shkhara and Janga ) and the seventh highest peak in the Caucasus Mountains . Georgians call Mount_Kazbek Mqinvari meaning ` ` glacier '' or ` ` Ice Mountain '' . eos
is the third highest mountain in Georgia ( after Mount Shkhara and Janga ) and the seventh highest peak in the Caucasus Mountains . Georgians call Mount_Kazbek Mqinvari meaning ` ` glacier '' or ` ` Ice Mountain '' . Mount_Kazbek is located on the Khokh Range , a mountain range which runs north of the Greater Caucasus Range , and which is pierced by the gorges of the Ardon and the Terek . eos
Mqinvari meaning ` ` glacier '' or ` ` Ice Mountain '' . Mount_Kazbek is located on the Khokh Range , a mountain range which runs north of the Greater Caucasus Range , and which is pierced by the gorges of the Ardon and the Terek . Mount_Kazbek lies along the edge of the Borjomi - Kazbegi Fault ( which is a northern sub - ending of the Anatolian Fault ) . eos
is located on the Khokh Range , a mountain range which runs north of the Greater Caucasus Range , and which is pierced by the gorges of the Ardon and the Terek . Mount_Kazbek lies along the edge of the Borjomi - Kazbegi Fault ( which is a northern sub - ending of the Anatolian Fault ) . The region is highly active tectonically , with numerous small earthquakes occurring at regular intervals . eos
lies along the edge of the Borjomi - Kazbegi Fault ( which is a northern sub - ending of the Anatolian Fault ) . The region is highly active tectonically , with numerous small earthquakes occurring at regular intervals . An active geothermal / hot spring system also surrounds Mount_Kazbek . eos
. Mount_Kazbek represents a dormant volcano , built up of trachyte and sheathed with lava , and Mount_Kazbek has the shape of a double cone , whose base lies at an altitude of 1,770 m ( 5,800 ft ) . Mount_Kazbek is the highest of the volcanic cones of the Kazbegi volcanic group which also includes Mount Khabarjina ( 3142 metres ) . eos
represents a dormant volcano , built up of trachyte and sheathed with lava , and Mount_Kazbek has the shape of a double cone , whose base lies at an altitude of 1,770 m ( 5,800 ft ) . Mount_Kazbek is the highest of the volcanic cones of the Kazbegi volcanic group which also includes Mount Khabarjina ( 3142 metres ) . Owing to the steepness of Mount_Kazbek slopes , the glaciers of Mount_Kazbek are not very large . eos
has the shape of a double cone , whose base lies at an altitude of 1,770 m ( 5,800 ft ) . Mount_Kazbek is the highest of the volcanic cones of the Kazbegi volcanic group which also includes Mount Khabarjina ( 3142 metres ) . Owing to the steepness of Mount_Kazbek slopes , the glaciers of Mount_Kazbek are not very large . eos
is the highest of the volcanic cones of the Kazbegi volcanic group which also includes Mount Khabarjina ( 3142 metres ) . Owing to the steepness of Mount_Kazbek slopes , the glaciers of Mount_Kazbek are not very large . The total combined area of all of Mount_Kazbek glaciers is 135 km ² . eos
slopes , the glaciers of Mount_Kazbek are not very large . The total combined area of all of Mount_Kazbek glaciers is 135 km ² . The best - known glacier is the Dyevdorak ( Devdaraki ) , which creeps down the north - eastern slope into a gorge of the same name , reaching a level of 2,295 m ( 7,530 ft ) . eos

glaciers is 135 km ² . The best - known glacier is the Dyevdorak ( Devdaraki ) , which creeps down the north - eastern slope into a gorge of the same name , reaching a level of 2,295 m ( 7,530 ft ) . Mount_Kazbek other glaciers include the Mna , Denkara , Gergeti , Abano and Chata . eos
other glaciers include the Mna , Denkara , Gergeti , Abano and Chata . The recent collapse of the Kolka Glacier , located in a valley between Mt. Jimara and Mount_Kazbek in 2002 was attributed to sulphuric volcanic activity along the northern slope of Mount_Kazbek , although there was no eruption . At Mount_Kazbek eastern foot runs the Georgian Military Road through the pass of Darial 2,378 m ( 7805 ft ) . eos
in 2002 was attributed to sulphuric volcanic activity along the northern slope of Mount_Kazbek , although there was no eruption . At Mount_Kazbek eastern foot runs the Georgian Military Road through the pass of Darial 2,378 m ( 7805 ft ) . The summit was first climbed in 1868 by D W. Freshfield , A W. Moore , and C Tucker , with a Swiss guide . eos

( pronounced / ˈkɪərə / ) is a 463.9 metre high mountain lying 4 kilometres northwest of the city of Wollongong , New South Wales , Australia . Mount_Keira distinctive shape and proximity to Wollongong make Mount_Keira a major local landmark . Mount_Keira is noted for the views of the city from the popular summit lookout and Mount_Keira history of coal mining . eos
distinctive shape and proximity to Wollongong make Mount_Keira a major local landmark . Mount_Keira is noted for the views of the city from the popular summit lookout and Mount_Keira history of coal mining . Mount_Keira was formed as part of the Illawarra escarpment fold between 80 and 60 million years ago and the erosion by creeks that ensued . eos
a major local landmark . Mount_Keira is noted for the views of the city from the popular summit lookout and Mount_Keira history of coal mining . Mount_Keira was formed as part of the Illawarra escarpment fold between 80 and 60 million years ago and the erosion by creeks that ensued . eos

Mount_Keira is an indigenous Australian term meaning large lagoon or high mountain . eos

was formed as part of the Illawarra escarpment fold between 80 and 60 million years ago and the erosion by creeks that ensued . Mount_Keira is an indigenous Australian term meaning large lagoon or high mountain . The aborigines called Mount_Keira Djera , meaning wild turkey . eos
is an indigenous Australian term meaning large lagoon or high mountain . The aborigines called Mount_Keira Djera , meaning wild turkey . The first maps of the area called Mount_Keira Keera , later adding the i. Mount_Keira is usually pronounced Kee - rah . eos

. Kembla is an Aboriginal word meaning ` ` plenty of game '' . Mount_Kembla is a former coal mining town and the home of the miners killed in the Mount Kembla Mining Disaster . eos
is a former coal mining town and the home of the miners killed in the Mount Kembla Mining Disaster . The township contains a local primary school , general store / post office , church and graveyard , several hundred houses and the Mount Kembla Hotel , which was built in the 1887 . The only two ways into the village are from Wollongong , up the residential / bushland Cordeaux Road , its name coming from early settlers , and over from Mount Keira down Harry Graham Drive . eos
. It is currently mining at the Dendrobium site , half a kilometre west of the village . Mount_Kembla is joined to the west by the Illawarra escarpment and in particular a mass with two lower summits , Kembla West ( 512 m ) and Mount Burelli ( 531 m ) . Mount_Kembla forms a prominent peak pointing roughly eastwards . eos
is joined to the west by the Illawarra escarpment and in particular a mass with two lower summits , Kembla West ( 512 m ) and Mount Burelli ( 531 m ) . Mount_Kembla forms a prominent peak pointing roughly eastwards . eos
forms a prominent peak pointing roughly eastwards . eos
( also spelled Kerintji , among several other ways , and referred to as Gunung Kerinci , Gadang , Berapi Kurinci , Kerinchi , Korinci , or Peak of Indrapura as well ) is the highest volcano in Indonesia , and the highest peak in Sumatra . Mount_Kerinci is located in Province of Jambi , the west central part of the island , in the Pegunungan / Bukit Barisan , near the west coast , and Mount_Kerinci is about 130 km south of Padang . Mount_Kerinci is the most prominent feature of the terrain of Kerinci Seblat National Park , with pine - forested slopes rising 2,400 - 3,300 metres above the surrounding basin , and a cone 13 km wide and 25 km long at the base , elongated in the north - south direction . eos
is located in Province of Jambi , the west central part of the island , in the Pegunungan / Bukit Barisan , near the west coast , and Mount_Kerinci is about 130 km south of Padang . Mount_Kerinci is the most prominent feature of the terrain of Kerinci Seblat National Park , with pine - forested slopes rising 2,400 - 3,300 metres above the surrounding basin , and a cone 13 km wide and 25 km long at the base , elongated in the north - south direction . At the summit there is a deep 600 m wide crater , often partially filled with green - yellow water . eos
is about 130 km south of Padang . Mount_Kerinci is the most prominent feature of the terrain of Kerinci Seblat National Park , with pine - forested slopes rising 2,400 - 3,300 metres above the surrounding basin , and a cone 13 km wide and 25 km long at the base , elongated in the north - south direction . At the summit there is a deep 600 m wide crater , often partially filled with green - yellow water . eos
is the most prominent feature of the terrain of Kerinci Seblat National Park , with pine - forested slopes rising 2,400 - 3,300 metres above the surrounding basin , and a cone 13 km wide and 25 km long at the base , elongated in the north - south direction . At the summit there is a deep 600 m wide crater , often partially filled with green - yellow water . Mount_Kerinci is more active than most Indonesian volcanoes , with nearly annual phreatic eruptions . eos
is more active than most Indonesian volcanoes , with nearly annual phreatic eruptions . Mount_Kerinci last erupted in 2004 , and Mount_Kerinci continues to spew clouds of sulphurous smoke , with plumes reaching as high as 1000 m above the summit . While there is farmland in the area , and a tea plantation on Mount_Kerinci southern slope , Mount_Kerinci , being located in an Indonesian national park , and perhaps out of respect for Mount_Kerinci frequent growlings as well , sits in an area that is sparsely populated by Indonesian population - density standards . eos

with Mount_Kilimanjaro three volcanic cones , Kibo , Mawensi , and Shira , is an inactive stratovolcano in north - eastern Tanzania . Although Mount_Kilimanjaro does not have the highest elevation , Mount_Kilimanjaro is the tallest free - standing mountain rise rising 4600 m from Mount_Kilimanjaro base , and Mount_Kilimanjaro includes the highest peak in Africa at 5,895 meters ( 19,340 ft ) , providing a dramatic view from the surrounding plains . Mount_Kilimanjaro is a Maasai word meaning Large Rock . eos

( Malay : Gunung Kinabalu ) is a prominent mountain in Southeast Asia . Mount_Kinabalu is located in Kinabalu National Park ( a World Heritage Site ) in the east Malaysian state of Sabah , which is on the island of Borneo in the tropics . eos
is located in Kinabalu National Park ( a World Heritage Site ) in the east Malaysian state of Sabah , which is on the island of Borneo in the tropics . In 1997 , a re - survey using satellite technology established Mount_Kinabalu summit ( known as Low 's Peak ) height at 4095 m above sea level , which is some less than the previously thought and hitherto published figure of 4,101 metres ( 13,455 ft ) . Mount_Kinabalu is the fourth tallest in Southeast Asia behind Hkakabo Razi of Myanmar ( 5881 meter ) , Puncak Jaya ( 4884 meter ) and Puncak Trikora ( 4750 meter ) of Papua , Indonesia , and Mount_Kinabalu is therefore also the tallest in Malaysia and on the island of Borneo , which Malaysia shares with Indonesia and Brunei . eos
summit ( known as Low 's Peak ) height at 4095 m above sea level , which is some less than the previously thought and hitherto published figure of 4,101 metres ( 13,455 ft ) . Mount_Kinabalu is the fourth tallest in Southeast Asia behind Hkakabo Razi of Myanmar ( 5881 meter ) , Puncak Jaya ( 4884 meter ) and Puncak Trikora ( 4750 meter ) of Papua , Indonesia , and Mount_Kinabalu is therefore also the tallest in Malaysia and on the island of Borneo , which Malaysia shares with Indonesia and Brunei . Mount_Kinabalu and Mount_Kinabalu surroundings feature a huge variety of flora , and Mount_Kinabalu is one of the world 's most important biological sites . eos
is the fourth tallest in Southeast Asia behind Hkakabo Razi of Myanmar ( 5881 meter ) , Puncak Jaya ( 4884 meter ) and Puncak Trikora ( 4750 meter ) of Papua , Indonesia , and Mount_Kinabalu is therefore also the tallest in Malaysia and on the island of Borneo , which Malaysia shares with Indonesia and Brunei . Mount_Kinabalu and Mount_Kinabalu surroundings feature a huge variety of flora , and Mount_Kinabalu is one of the world 's most important biological sites . The main peak of Mount_Kinabalu ( Low 's Peak ) can be relatively easily climbed by a person with a good physical condition , and requires no mountaineering equipment . eos

is a lofty , generally ice - free mountain in Antarctica 's Queen Alexandra Range . Located 8 km ( 5 mi ) west of Mount Dickerson , Mount_Kirkpatrick is the highest point in the range . Discovered and named by the British Antarctic Expedition ( 1907 - 09 ) , Mount_Kirkpatrick was named for a Glasgow businessman , who was one of the original supporters of the expedition . eos
is the highest point in the range . Discovered and named by the British Antarctic Expedition ( 1907 - 09 ) , Mount_Kirkpatrick was named for a Glasgow businessman , who was one of the original supporters of the expedition . Mount Kilpatrick is an alternate name for Mount_Kirkpatrick . eos
was named for a Glasgow businessman , who was one of the original supporters of the expedition . Mount Kilpatrick is an alternate name for Mount_Kirkpatrick . eos

is located within the Columbia Icefield of Jasper National Park , which is part of the Canadian Rockies . Mount_Kitchener can be seen from the Icefields Parkway ( # 93 ) near Sunwapta Pass . Mount_Kitchener was originally named Mount Douglas by J Norman Collie after David Douglas . eos
can be seen from the Icefields Parkway ( # 93 ) near Sunwapta Pass . Mount_Kitchener was originally named Mount Douglas by J Norman Collie after David Douglas . In 1916 , Mount_Kitchener was renamed to Mount_Kitchener present day name after Lord Kitchener , who had just been killed in World War I. eos

( Macedonian : Голем Кораб , Golem Korab ; Albanian : Maja e Korabit / Mali i Korabit ) is the highest mountain of the Republic of Macedonia and Albania , Mount_Korab peak forms a frontier between the two countries . Mount_Korab is adjacent to the Aar Mountain . eos
peak forms a frontier between the two countries . Mount_Korab is adjacent to the Aar Mountain . Mount_Korab has a number of peaks that are higher than 2500 metres . eos
is adjacent to the Aar Mountain . Mount_Korab has a number of peaks that are higher than 2500 metres . The most important ones are : * Great Korab ( in Macedonian : Голем Кораб ( Golem Korab ) or Кобилино Поле ( Kobilino Pole ) , Albanian : Maja e Korabit / Mali i Korabit ) ; height from the sea level 2753 m ( older data ) or 2764 m ( newer data confirmed by GPS ) . eos
has a number of peaks that are higher than 2500 metres . The most important ones are : * Great Korab ( in Macedonian : Голем Кораб ( Golem Korab ) or Кобилино Поле ( Kobilino Pole ) , Albanian : Maja e Korabit / Mali i Korabit ) ; height from the sea level 2753 m ( older data ) or 2764 m ( newer data confirmed by GPS ) . * Kepi Bar ( 2,595 m ) eos
, and there is still a mined zone around Mount_Korab . Ascending Mount_Korab is possible from the Macedonian side after complicated bureaucratic procedures , accompanied by a military escort . There are no formal restrictions on climbing Mount_Korab from the Albanian side . eos

The area is now safer and more stable than it has been in recent times , and local inhabitants are generally welcoming and helpful . eos
from the Albanian side . The area is now safer and more stable than it has been in recent times , and local inhabitants are generally welcoming and helpful . It is possible to drive as far as the local village of Radomirё , but the local infrastructure is generally not good . eos

, located in the Snowy Mountains , in Kosciuszko National Park , is the highest mountain in Australia ( not including its external territories ) , at 2,228 m above sea level . Mount_Kosciuszko was named by the Polish explorer Count Paul Strzelecki in 1840 , in honour of the Polish national hero General Tadeusz Kościuszko , because of Mount_Kosciuszko perceived resemblance to the Kościuszko Mound in Krakow . The name of Mount_Kosciuszko was formerly spelled ` ` Mount Kosciusko , '' an Anglicisation ; but the version ` ` Mount Kosciuszko '' was officially adopted in 1997 by the Geographical Names Board of NSW . eos
was named by the Polish explorer Count Paul Strzelecki in 1840 , in honour of the Polish national hero General Tadeusz Kościuszko , because of Mount_Kosciuszko perceived resemblance to the Kościuszko Mound in Krakow . The name of Mount_Kosciuszko was formerly spelled ` ` Mount Kosciusko , '' an Anglicisation ; but the version ` ` Mount Kosciuszko '' was officially adopted in 1997 by the Geographical Names Board of NSW . The common Australian pronunciation of Kosciuszko , ` ` kozzy - osko '' , differs from the pronunciation in Polish , "" IPA : ˈkoɕˈtɕuʃko "" ` ` kosh - CHOOSH - ko '' . eos
perceived resemblance to the Kościuszko Mound in Krakow . The name of Mount_Kosciuszko was formerly spelled ` ` Mount Kosciusko , '' an Anglicisation ; but the version ` ` Mount Kosciuszko '' was officially adopted in 1997 by the Geographical Names Board of NSW . The common Australian pronunciation of Kosciuszko , ` ` kozzy - osko '' , differs from the pronunciation in Polish , "" IPA : ˈkoɕˈtɕuʃko "" ` ` kosh - CHOOSH - ko '' . eos
was formerly spelled ` ` Mount Kosciusko , '' an Anglicisation ; but the version ` ` Mount Kosciuszko '' was officially adopted in 1997 by the Geographical Names Board of NSW . The common Australian pronunciation of Kosciuszko , ` ` kozzy - osko '' , differs from the pronunciation in Polish , "" IPA : ˈkoɕˈtɕuʃko "" ` ` kosh - CHOOSH - ko '' . Various measurements of the peak originally called by that name showed it to be slightly lower than its neighbour , Mount Townsend , and the names were thereupon transposed by the New South Wales Lands Department , so that Mount_Kosciuszko still remains the highest peak of Australia , and Mount Townsend ranks as second . eos
still remains the highest peak of Australia , and Mount Townsend ranks as second . The 1863 picture by Eugene von Guerard hanging in the National Gallery of Australia titled ` ` Northeast view from the northern top of Mount Kosciusko '' is actually from Mt Townsend . eos
is a 5,260 ' mountain at the northern end of the Franconia Range in the White Mountains of New Hampshire . Mount_Lafayette is one of the most popular day - hike destinations in the White Mountain National Forest due to spectacular views at Mount_Lafayette summit and Mount_Lafayette location beside Interstate 93 . The upper portion of Mount_Lafayette is located in the Alpine Zone , an area of little vegetation characterized by rock fields and harsh weather . eos
is one of the most popular day - hike destinations in the White Mountain National Forest due to spectacular views at Mount_Lafayette summit and Mount_Lafayette location beside Interstate 93 . The upper portion of Mount_Lafayette is located in the Alpine Zone , an area of little vegetation characterized by rock fields and harsh weather . A variety of trails lead up over 3,000 vertical feet ( 900 m ) to Mount_Lafayette exposed summit . eos
summit and Mount_Lafayette location beside Interstate 93 . A variety of trails lead up over 3,000 vertical feet ( 900 m ) to Mount_Lafayette exposed summit . eos
location beside Interstate 93 . The upper portion of Mount_Lafayette is located in the Alpine Zone , an area of little vegetation characterized by rock fields and harsh weather . A variety of trails lead up over 3,000 vertical feet ( 900 m ) to Mount_Lafayette exposed summit . eos
is located in the Alpine Zone , an area of little vegetation characterized by rock fields and harsh weather . A variety of trails lead up over 3,000 vertical feet ( 900 m ) to Mount_Lafayette exposed summit . The Greenleaf Trail begins at the parking lot for the Cannon Mountain tramway and ascends to the Appalachian Mountain Club 's Greenleaf Hut , then continues to the summit . eos
exposed summit . The Greenleaf Trail begins at the parking lot for the Cannon Mountain tramway and ascends to the Appalachian Mountain Club 's Greenleaf Hut , then continues to the summit . The Bridle Path trail follows a western spur ridge of Mount_Lafayette from Lafayette Place Campground on Interstate 93 past Greenleaf Hut and joins the Greenleaf Trail , reaching the summit 1.1 miles ( 1.8 km ) after the hut . eos
from Lafayette Place Campground on Interstate 93 past Greenleaf Hut and joins the Greenleaf Trail , reaching the summit 1.1 miles ( 1.8 km ) after the hut . The peak is at the junction of the Garfield Ridge Trail , which follows the ridge northeast to Mt. Garfield , and the Franconia Ridge Trail , which leads south to Mts . Lincoln , Liberty , and Flume . eos
. Turning south along the Franconia Ridge Trail , one passes over Mount Lincoln and Little Haystack , then descends via the Falling Waters Trail , which connects back with the beginning of the Old Bridle Path . This loop is 8.9 miles long , with a cumulative vertical elevation gain of about 3900 feet . eos
is the highest point in the Franconia Range , a line of peaks along the east side of Franconia Notch . Mount_Lafayette is the highest peak in New Hampshire outside of the Presidential Range , ranking sixth in elevation on the list of New Hampshire four - thousand footers and fourth in topographic prominence on the New England Fifty Finest list . On the western side , Mount_Lafayette lower slopes lie inside Franconia Notch State Park . eos
is the highest peak in New Hampshire outside of the Presidential Range , ranking sixth in elevation on the list of New Hampshire four - thousand footers and fourth in topographic prominence on the New England Fifty Finest list . On the western side , Mount_Lafayette lower slopes lie inside Franconia Notch State Park . The remainder of Mount_Lafayette lies within the White Mountain National Forest . eos
lower slopes lie inside Franconia Notch State Park . The remainder of Mount_Lafayette lies within the White Mountain National Forest . The summit marks the western border of the Pemigewasset Wilderness Area within the WMNF . eos
lies within the White Mountain National Forest . The summit marks the western border of the Pemigewasset Wilderness Area within the WMNF . eos
is located on the crest of the Sierra Nevada Mountains , on the border of Inyo and Tulare counties , in eastern California in the southwestern United States . To the east is Owens Valley , and to the west is the Kern River Valley . At 14,026 feet ( 4,275 m ) , Mount_Langley is the ninth highest peak in the state , and the seventh highest in the Sierras . eos
is the ninth highest peak in the state , and the seventh highest in the Sierras . Mount Whitney , the highest peak in the contiguous United States , lies 5 miles ( 8 km ) to the northwest . The Geological survey marker at the summit shows an elevation of 14,042 feet . eos
is named after Samuel Pierpont Langley . In the early 1870s , Mount_Langley was confused with Mount Whitney by early climbers , and called by this name . When the mistake was realized , Mount_Langley was alternately called Mount Corcoran , Cirque Peak , or Sheep Mountain ; the former two names being later attached to other mountains . eos
was confused with Mount Whitney by early climbers , and called by this name . When the mistake was realized , Mount_Langley was alternately called Mount Corcoran , Cirque Peak , or Sheep Mountain ; the former two names being later attached to other mountains . But Mount_Langley current name became established in local usage , and was made official by the USGS . eos
was alternately called Mount Corcoran , Cirque Peak , or Sheep Mountain ; the former two names being later attached to other mountains . But Mount_Langley current name became established in local usage , and was made official by the USGS . Mount_Langley is one of the easiest of California 's fourteeners to climb . eos
current name became established in local usage , and was made official by the USGS . Mount_Langley is one of the easiest of California 's fourteeners to climb . A hiking trail starts at nearby Horseshoe Meadow ( elevation of around 10,000 feet ) , passes scenic Cottonwood Lakes , and climbs through New Army Pass . eos
is one of the easiest of California 's fourteeners to climb . A hiking trail starts at nearby Horseshoe Meadow ( elevation of around 10,000 feet ) , passes scenic Cottonwood Lakes , and climbs through New Army Pass . From there climbers make their way across a mountain meadow and up a long gradual slope of rock and gravel before making a Class 2 scramble to the summit . eos
than Old Army Pass , which is recommended for hikers to Mount_Langley when the trail is not impassable due to snow . eos

, or Gunung Lawu , is a massive compound stratovolcano in Central Java , Indonesia . The north side is deeply eroded and the eastern side contains parasitic crater lakes and parasitic cones . A fumarolic area is located on the south flank at 2,550 m . eos
took place in 1885 , when rumblings and light volcanic ash falls were reported . eos
is a mountain on the Continental Divide , at the border of Alberta and British Columbia in western Canada . Mount_Lefroy resides on the eastern side of Abbot Pass . Mount_Lefroy was named by George M Dawson in 1894 for Sir John Henry Lefroy ( 1817 - 1890 ) , an astronomer who had traveled over 8800 km in Canada 's north between 1842 - 44 making meteorological and magnetic observations . eos
resides on the eastern side of Abbot Pass . Mount_Lefroy was named by George M Dawson in 1894 for Sir John Henry Lefroy ( 1817 - 1890 ) , an astronomer who had traveled over 8800 km in Canada 's north between 1842 - 44 making meteorological and magnetic observations . Mount_Lefroy is the site of the first fatal climbing accident in Canada . eos
was named by George M Dawson in 1894 for Sir John Henry Lefroy ( 1817 - 1890 ) , an astronomer who had traveled over 8800 km in Canada 's north between 1842 - 44 making meteorological and magnetic observations . Mount_Lefroy is the site of the first fatal climbing accident in Canada . In 1896 during a failed summit bid , Phillip S Abbot slipped on rocks after just coming off an icy section and plummeted down the rock face to his death . eos
is the site of the first fatal climbing accident in Canada . In 1896 during a failed summit bid , Phillip S Abbot slipped on rocks after just coming off an icy section and plummeted down the rock face to his death . eos
is in the Santa Catalina Mountains located in the Coronado National Forest north of Tucson , AZ . . Mount_Lemmon is 9,157 feet above sea - level , and Mount_Lemmon receives approximately 180 inches of snow annually . Mount_Lemmon was named in honor of botanist Sarah Lemmon , who trekked to the top of Mount_Lemmon with Native American guides by mule and foot in 1881 . eos
is 9,157 feet above sea - level , and Mount_Lemmon receives approximately 180 inches of snow annually . Mount_Lemmon was named in honor of botanist Sarah Lemmon , who trekked to the top of Mount_Lemmon with Native American guides by mule and foot in 1881 . Her husband , John Gill Lemmon , an invalid , remained at the base of Mount_Lemmon . eos

A small town called Summerhaven is on Mount_Lemmon , which includes many cabins , some occupied only part of the year . eos

for several decades all their facilities have been abandoned . The telescopes on Mount_Lemmon are still used for astronomical research today by organizations such as the Catalina Sky Survey , although the most frequent users are participants in the University of Arizona Astronomy Camp program . The location ` Windy Point ' was built by the Federal Bureau of Prisons , using a large number of prisoners over a period of 18 years , and is a popular place for outdoor weddings . eos
are still used for astronomical research today by organizations such as the Catalina Sky Survey , although the most frequent users are participants in the University of Arizona Astronomy Camp program . The location ` Windy Point ' was built by the Federal Bureau of Prisons , using a large number of prisoners over a period of 18 years , and is a popular place for outdoor weddings . There is also an isolated population of American Red Squirrels on Mount_Lemmon , which have been the focus of a number of environmental concerns , and have restricted development . eos
, which have been the focus of a number of environmental concerns , and have restricted development . The Catalina Highway , also called the Mount Lemmon Highway , as well as the Hitchcock Highway ( after Frank Harris Hitchcock , the local newspaper editor who inspired its construction ) runs up the Santa Catalina Mountains from the east side of Tucson up to Summerhaven , at the top of Mount_Lemmon . eos
. The beautiful , curving road is a favorite drive for tourists , for locals escaping summer 's heat , for motorcyclists , and cyclists . The highway has been improved recently , but the speed limit has also been lowered to 35 MPH ( 56 km / h ) due to concerns about the highway 's safety during peak traffic times . eos
, starts in Oracle , which is on state highway 77 northeast of Tucson . It offers a secondary route to the top . Follow East Mount Lemmon Road southeast off East American Avenue eos
is a fourteener in the US state of Colorado . Mount_Lincoln_Colorado is the eighth highest peak in the state , and the 11th highest in the contiguous United States . Mount_Lincoln_Colorado is located in the Mosquito Range , just west of Hoosier Pass , and Mount_Lincoln_Colorado is the highest peak in that range . eos
is the eighth highest peak in the state , and the 11th highest in the contiguous United States . Mount_Lincoln_Colorado is located in the Mosquito Range , just west of Hoosier Pass , and Mount_Lincoln_Colorado is the highest peak in that range . Mount_Lincoln_Colorado lies just east of the Continental Divide in northwestern Park County , approximately 5 miles ( 8 km ) east of Climax and near the town of Alma . eos

is a mountain on the southern fold of the San Gabriel Mountains . Originally named Oak Mountain , Mount_Lowe_California was renamed for Professor Thaddeus SC Lowe , who is credited for being the first white man to set foot on and plant the American flag at Mount_Lowe_California peak , and who built the Mount Lowe Railway to Mount_Lowe_California foot in 1896 . The record of the naming was made official by Andrew McNally , the famous Chicago map printer and summertime resident of Altadena , who promised to print ` ` Mount Lowe '' on all his maps . eos
was renamed for Professor Thaddeus SC Lowe , who is credited for being the first white man to set foot on and plant the American flag at Mount_Lowe_California peak , and who built the Mount Lowe Railway to Mount_Lowe_California foot in 1896 . The record of the naming was made official by Andrew McNally , the famous Chicago map printer and summertime resident of Altadena , who promised to print ` ` Mount Lowe '' on all his maps . Mount_Lowe_California was established as an alternate route for the Mount Lowe Railway when attempts to procure rights of way to the more prominent Mount Wilson had failed . eos
peak , and who built the Mount Lowe Railway to Mount_Lowe_California foot in 1896 . foot in 1896 . The record of the naming was made official by Andrew McNally , the famous Chicago map printer and summertime resident of Altadena , who promised to print ` ` Mount Lowe '' on all his maps . Mount_Lowe_California was established as an alternate route for the Mount Lowe Railway when attempts to procure rights of way to the more prominent Mount Wilson had failed . eos
was established as an alternate route for the Mount Lowe Railway when attempts to procure rights of way to the more prominent Mount Wilson had failed . A number of trails stem from Mount_Lowe_California due to the Mount Lowe Tavern which was built at Crystal Springs below the summit and operated from 1895 - 1936 . One of the historic trails was the ` ` Mount Lowe Eight '' which was a mule ride attraction of the hotel that made a figure eight shaped route starting at the Tavern , ascending the summit of Mount_Lowe_California , returning to the Tavern , and crisscrossing to a trail that headed down Castle Canyon . eos
due to the Mount Lowe Tavern which was built at Crystal Springs below the summit and operated from 1895 - 1936 . One of the historic trails was the ` ` Mount Lowe Eight '' which was a mule ride attraction of the hotel that made a figure eight shaped route starting at the Tavern , ascending the summit of Mount_Lowe_California , returning to the Tavern , and crisscrossing to a trail that headed down Castle Canyon . From there the trail passed down to the Echo Mountain resort and ascended on the return to the Tavern . eos
, returning to the Tavern , and crisscrossing to a trail that headed down Castle Canyon . From there the trail passed down to the Echo Mountain resort and ascended on the return to the Tavern . Mount_Lowe_California is approachable from Echo Mountain or Chaney trail via a fire road which was graded over the old railway right - of - way . eos
is approachable from Echo Mountain or Chaney trail via a fire road which was graded over the old railway right - of - way . eos
is the third highest mountain in Canada . A long ridge connects Mount_Lucania with Mount Steele ( 5,073 m ) , the fifth highest in Canada . Mount_Lucania is named after a region of southern Italy , known today as Basilicata . eos
with Mount Steele ( 5,073 m ) , the fifth highest in Canada . Mount_Lucania is named after a region of southern Italy , known today as Basilicata . The first ascent of Mount_Lucania was made in 1937 by Bradford Washburn and Robert Hicks Bates . eos
is named after a region of southern Italy , known today as Basilicata . The first ascent of Mount_Lucania was made in 1937 by Bradford Washburn and Robert Hicks Bates . They used an airplane to reach Walsh Glacier , 8,500 ft ( 2,600 m ) above sea level ; the use of air support for mountaineering was novel at the time . eos
was made in 1937 by Bradford Washburn and Robert Hicks Bates . They used an airplane to reach Walsh Glacier , 8,500 ft ( 2,600 m ) above sea level ; the use of air support for mountaineering was novel at the time . Washburn called upon Bob Reeve , a famous Alaskan bush pilot , who later replied by cable to Washburn , ` ` Anywhere you 'll ride , I 'll fly '' . eos
, and after an epic descent and journey to civilization , they hiked over 150 miles through the wilderness to safety in the small town of Burwash Landing in the Yukon . The second ascent of Mount_Lucania was made in 1967 by a team lead by Gerry Roach . eos
was made in 1967 by a team lead by Gerry Roach . eos
is the highest mountain in the US state of Vermont . The peak elevation , in the town of Underhill , is 4,393 ft . ( 1339 m ) above mean sea level . eos
has the appearance of a ( quite elongated ) human face when viewed from the east or west with distinct forehead , nose , lips , chin ( the highest point ) and an Adam 's apple . These features are most distinct when viewed from the east , looking westward . Mount_Mansfield is one of the two spots in Vermont where true alpine tundra survives from the ice ages . eos
is one of the two spots in Vermont where true alpine tundra survives from the ice ages . A few acres exist on Camel 's Hump immediately to the south , but Mount_Mansfield summit still holds about 200 acres . Mount_Mansfield is used for various recreational and commercial purposes . eos
summit still holds about 200 acres . Mount_Mansfield is used for various recreational and commercial purposes . The summit is home to transmitter towers for a number of local TV and radio stations . eos

has many hiking trails , including the Long Trail , which traverses the main ridgeline . Additionally , the east flank of Mount_Mansfield is used by the Stowe Mountain Resort for skiing and tourism , and for a toll road that is open to automobiles . eos

is the highest peak of the Chugach Mountains of Alaska . Mount_Marcus_Baker is located approximately 75 miles ( 121 km ) east of Anchorage . Despite not being a fourteener , Mount_Marcus_Baker is a large peak , because Mount_Marcus_Baker is situated relatively close to tidewater . eos
is located approximately 75 miles ( 121 km ) east of Anchorage . Despite not being a fourteener , Mount_Marcus_Baker is a large peak , because Mount_Marcus_Baker is situated relatively close to tidewater . When ranked by topographic prominence , Mount_Marcus_Baker is one of the top 75 peaks in the world . eos
is a large peak , because Mount_Marcus_Baker is situated relatively close to tidewater . When ranked by topographic prominence , Mount_Marcus_Baker is one of the top 75 peaks in the world . Mount_Marcus_Baker was originally called ` ` Mount Saint Agnes '' ; according to Bradford Washburn , James W Bagley of the USGS named Mount_Marcus_Baker after his wife Agnes , adding the ` ` Saint '' in hopes of making the name stick . eos
is situated relatively close to tidewater . When ranked by topographic prominence , Mount_Marcus_Baker is one of the top 75 peaks in the world . Mount_Marcus_Baker was originally called ` ` Mount Saint Agnes '' ; according to Bradford Washburn , James W Bagley of the USGS named Mount_Marcus_Baker after his wife Agnes , adding the ` ` Saint '' in hopes of making the name stick . eos
is one of the top 75 peaks in the world . Mount_Marcus_Baker was originally called ` ` Mount Saint Agnes '' ; according to Bradford Washburn , James W Bagley of the USGS named Mount_Marcus_Baker after his wife Agnes , adding the ` ` Saint '' in hopes of making the name stick . The name was later changed to honor a cartographer and geologist named Marcus Baker . eos
was originally called ` ` Mount Saint Agnes '' ; according to Bradford Washburn , James W Bagley of the USGS named Mount_Marcus_Baker after his wife Agnes , adding the ` ` Saint '' in hopes of making the name stick . The name was later changed to honor a cartographer and geologist named Marcus Baker . Actually , a number of noted climbers have perished or sustained permanent injury in attempting to summit Mount_Marcus_Baker as climbing conditions can change rapidly as storms arise . eos
after his wife Agnes , adding the ` ` Saint '' in hopes of making the name stick . The name was later changed to honor a cartographer and geologist named Marcus Baker . Actually , a number of noted climbers have perished or sustained permanent injury in attempting to summit Mount_Marcus_Baker as climbing conditions can change rapidly as storms arise . eos
as climbing conditions can change rapidly as storms arise . In early 1988 , State Alaska Fish & amp ; Game biologist , 28-yr old Sylvia Jean Lane succumbed to hypothermia as a two - day storm separated her from the two others in the climbing party attempting to dash to the top in a winter ascent . eos
is a stratovolcano , located on the Alaska Peninsula , United States . Mount_Martin_Alaska is one of the volcanoes in the vicinity of the Valley of Ten Thousand Smokes . Although an eruption in 1953 is now considered questionable and no other confirmed eruptive activity has taken place at Mount_Martin_Alaska , there is intense fumarolic activity within Mount_Martin_Alaska summit crater . eos
is one of the volcanoes in the vicinity of the Valley of Ten Thousand Smokes . Although an eruption in 1953 is now considered questionable and no other confirmed eruptive activity has taken place at Mount_Martin_Alaska , there is intense fumarolic activity within Mount_Martin_Alaska summit crater . The summit crater is also breached to the southeast . eos
, there is intense fumarolic activity within Mount_Martin_Alaska summit crater . The summit crater is also breached to the southeast . The 300 m ( 984 ft ) - wide summit crater is often ice - free due to the geothermal heat and contains an intermittent acidic crater lake . eos
summit crater . The summit crater is also breached to the southeast . The 300 m ( 984 ft ) - wide summit crater is often ice - free due to the geothermal heat and contains an intermittent acidic crater lake . eos
is named for George C Martin , who was the first person to visit the Valley of Ten Thousand Smokes after the 1912 eruption of Novarupta . eos
is the highest peak in the Rimutaka Ranges to the east of Wellington Harbour and the Wellington Region in general . Mount_Matthews reaches a height of 940 metres and although not special on that account , Mount_Matthews has significance in regard to Mount_Matthews distinctive aspect as seen from Wellington the capital city of New Zealand - Mount_Matthews is the highest peak that can be seen on the sky line east of the city . Mount_Matthews reaches just above the bushline and Mount_Matthews can be climbed as a day hike without mountaineering equipment but Mount_Matthews is nevertheless a strenuous and steep climb and a full day should be allowed by the time access to the feet of the ranges is included . eos
reaches a height of 940 metres and although not special on that account , Mount_Matthews has significance in regard to Mount_Matthews distinctive aspect as seen from Wellington the capital city of New Zealand - Mount_Matthews is the highest peak that can be seen on the sky line east of the city . Mount_Matthews reaches just above the bushline and Mount_Matthews can be climbed as a day hike without mountaineering equipment but Mount_Matthews is nevertheless a strenuous and steep climb and a full day should be allowed by the time access to the feet of the ranges is included . Access is gained either from the Wairarapa ( eastern ) side of the Rimutakas or from the Orongorongo River that lies between Wellington and the ranges . eos

, Gunung Merapi in Indonesian language , is a conical volcano located on the border between Central Java and Yogyakarta , Indonesia . Mount_Merapi is the most active volcano in Indonesia and Mount_Merapi has erupted regularly since 1548 . Mount_Merapi name means Mountain of Fire . eos
is the most active volcano in Indonesia and Mount_Merapi has erupted regularly since 1548 . Mount_Merapi name means Mountain of Fire . Mount_Merapi is very close to the city of Yogyakarta , and thousands of people live on the flanks of Mount_Merapi , with villages as high as 1700 m above sea level . eos
has erupted regularly since 1548 . Mount_Merapi name means Mountain of Fire . Mount_Merapi is very close to the city of Yogyakarta , and thousands of people live on the flanks of Mount_Merapi , with villages as high as 1700 m above sea level . eos
name means Mountain of Fire . Mount_Merapi is very close to the city of Yogyakarta , and thousands of people live on the flanks of Mount_Merapi , with villages as high as 1700 m above sea level . Several of Mount_Merapi eruptions have caused fatalities . eos
is very close to the city of Yogyakarta , and thousands of people live on the flanks of Mount_Merapi , with villages as high as 1700 m above sea level . Several of Mount_Merapi eruptions have caused fatalities . Mount_Merapi was erupting from 1992 to 2002 , and a particularly large explosion killed 43 people in 1994 . eos
, with villages as high as 1700 m above sea level . Several of Mount_Merapi eruptions have caused fatalities . Mount_Merapi was erupting from 1992 to 2002 , and a particularly large explosion killed 43 people in 1994 . eos
eruptions have caused fatalities . Mount_Merapi was erupting from 1992 to 2002 , and a particularly large explosion killed 43 people in 1994 . Mount_Merapi began erupting again in 2006 , and scientists believe a large eruption is imminent . eos
was erupting from 1992 to 2002 , and a particularly large explosion killed 43 people in 1994 . Mount_Merapi began erupting again in 2006 , and scientists believe a large eruption is imminent . In light of the hazards Mount_Merapi poses to populated areas , Mount_Merapi has been designated a Decade Volcano . eos
