, officially gazetted as Thor Peak , is a mountain in Auyuittuq National Park , on Baffin Island , Nunavut , Canada . Mount_Thor is located 46 km ( 29 mi ) northeast of Pangnirtung and Mount_Thor features the Earth 's greatest purely vertical drop at 1,250 metres ( 4,100 feet ) , with an average angle of 105 degrees . The location is popular with climbers due to this feature , despite its remoteness . eos
is located 46 km ( 29 mi ) northeast of Pangnirtung and Mount_Thor features the Earth 's greatest purely vertical drop at 1,250 metres ( 4,100 feet ) , with an average angle of 105 degrees . The location is popular with climbers due to this feature , despite its remoteness . Camping is allowed , with the only official site being at the entrance to the Akshayuk Valley near Overlord Peak . eos
features the Earth 's greatest purely vertical drop at 1,250 metres ( 4,100 feet ) , with an average angle of 105 degrees . The location is popular with climbers due to this feature , despite its remoteness . Camping is allowed , with the only official site being at the entrance to the Akshayuk Valley near Overlord Peak . eos
is part of the Baffin Mountains which in turn form part of the Arctic Cordillera mountain range . Mount_Thor is made of granite and Mount_Thor is the most famous of Canada 's mountains named ` ` Thor '' . Mount_Thor was first climbed in 1953 by an Arctic Institute of North America team . eos
is made of granite and Mount_Thor is the most famous of Canada 's mountains named ` ` Thor '' . Mount_Thor was first climbed in 1953 by an Arctic Institute of North America team . The team members were Hans Weber , J Rothlisberger and F Schwarzenbach . eos
is the most famous of Canada 's mountains named ` ` Thor '' . Mount_Thor was first climbed in 1953 by an Arctic Institute of North America team . The team members were Hans Weber , J Rothlisberger and F Schwarzenbach . eos
was first climbed in 1953 by an Arctic Institute of North America team . The team members were Hans Weber , J Rothlisberger and F Schwarzenbach . The same men who climbed the North Tower of Mount Asgard for the first time . eos
, july 23 , 2006 , by an American team consisting of : Chuck Constable , Dirk Siron , Ben Holley , Kenneth Waite , Gordon Rosser , Donny Opperman , Deldon Barfuss , and Tim Hudson . A 26 year old Canadian Park Ranger , Phillip Robinson , also rappelled , but had a problem with his equipment , dropped to the base of the mountain and was killed . There had been a previous attempt in 2004 , but they returned without rappelling due to dangerous weather conditions . eos
is used in the Led Zeppelin concert film The Song Remains the Same in the ` ` No Quarter '' fantasy sequence ; the song mentioning the god Thor . eos
is an eroded volcanic complex consisting of numerous domes ( up to 23 ) , as high as 1864 m in elevation , along a northeast - southwest oriented volcanic front on the Pacific Ocean side of the Alaska Peninsula . A new dome was emplaced beginning in 1953 at an altitude of 1097 m in an amphitheater on the southwest flank of the southwest peak . eos
is the second highest mountain of Antarctica located 13 kilometres northwest of Vinson Massif ( 4,892 m ) , the highest peak on the continent . Mount_Tyree was discovered in january 1958 during reconnaissance flights by the United States Navy VX-6 squadron , and mapped later that month by the Marie Byrd Land Traverse Party . Mount_Tyree was named for Rear Admiral David M Tyree , who was commander of the US Naval Support Force in Antarctica , from april 14 , 1959 to november 26 , 1962 . eos
was discovered in january 1958 during reconnaissance flights by the United States Navy VX-6 squadron , and mapped later that month by the Marie Byrd Land Traverse Party . Mount_Tyree was named for Rear Admiral David M Tyree , who was commander of the US Naval Support Force in Antarctica , from april 14 , 1959 to november 26 , 1962 . The still - unclimbed south face is in height and the highest wall in Antarctic . eos
was named for Rear Admiral David M Tyree , who was commander of the US Naval Support Force in Antarctica , from april 14 , 1959 to november 26 , 1962 . The still - unclimbed south face is in height and the highest wall in Antarctic . The climbing season is november to january . eos
is the eighth highest mountain in Canada and Mount_Vancouver is located in Kluane National Park and Reserve on the Canada - US border . Mount_Vancouver has three summits : north , middle and south with middle being the lowest . The south summit borders Canada and the United States and is known as Good Neighbor Peak . eos
is located in Kluane National Park and Reserve on the Canada - US border . Mount_Vancouver has three summits : north , middle and south with middle being the lowest . The south summit borders Canada and the United States and is known as Good Neighbor Peak . eos
has three summits : north , middle and south with middle being the lowest . The south summit borders Canada and the United States and is known as Good Neighbor Peak . While conventional wisdom indicates that the north summit is the highest , discrepancies in topographic maps of the area muddle the question . eos
was named by W H. Dall in 1874 after George Vancouver , who explored the southeast coast of Alaska from 1792 to 1794 . eos
is an active stratovolcano located on the Alaska Peninsula . The Alaska Volcano Observatory currently rates Mount_Veniaminof as Aviation Color Code Green and Volcano Alert Level Normal . Mount_Veniaminof was named after Ioann ( Ivan Popov ) eos
as Aviation Color Code Green and Volcano Alert Level Normal . Mount_Veniaminof was named after Ioann ( Ivan Popov ) Veniaminov ( 1797 - 1879 ) , a Russian Orthodox missionary priest whose writings on the Aleut language and ethnology are still standard references . eos
was named after Ioann ( Ivan Popov ) Veniaminov ( 1797 - 1879 ) , a Russian Orthodox missionary priest whose writings on the Aleut language and ethnology are still standard references . Mount_Veniaminof was the site of a colossal ( VEI 6 ) eruption around 1750 BC . eos
was the site of a colossal ( VEI 6 ) eruption around 1750 BC . This eruption left a large caldera . In modern times Mount_Veniaminof has had numerous small eruptions ( over ten of them since 1930 ) ; these are located at a cinder cone in the middle of the caldera . eos
has had numerous small eruptions ( over ten of them since 1930 ) ; these are located at a cinder cone in the middle of the caldera . Mount_Veniaminof has one of the highest elevations of Alaskan volcanoes . Partly for this reason , Mount_Veniaminof is covered by a glacier that fills most of the caldera . eos
has one of the highest elevations of Alaskan volcanoes . Partly for this reason , Mount_Veniaminof is covered by a glacier that fills most of the caldera . Because of the glacier and the caldera walls , there is the possibility for a major flood from a glacier run at some point in the future . eos
is covered by a glacier that fills most of the caldera . Because of the glacier and the caldera walls , there is the possibility for a major flood from a glacier run at some point in the future . eos
( Italian : Monte Vesuvio , Latin : Mons Vesuvius ) is a volcano east of Naples , Italy . Mount_Vesuvius is the only volcano on the European mainland to have erupted within the last hundred years , although Mount_Vesuvius is not currently erupting . eos
is the only volcano on the European mainland to have erupted within the last hundred years , although Mount_Vesuvius is not currently erupting . The only other two such volcanoes in Italy ( Etna and Stromboli ) are located on islands . Mount_Vesuvius is on the coast of the Bay of Naples , about nine kilometres ( six miles ) east of Naples and a short distance from the shore . eos
is not currently erupting . The only other two such volcanoes in Italy ( Etna and Stromboli ) are located on islands . Mount_Vesuvius is on the coast of the Bay of Naples , about nine kilometres ( six miles ) east of Naples and a short distance from the shore . eos
is on the coast of the Bay of Naples , about nine kilometres ( six miles ) east of Naples and a short distance from the shore . Mount_Vesuvius is conspicuous in the beautiful landscape presented by the Bay of Naples , when seen from the sea , with Naples in the foreground . Mount_Vesuvius is best known for Mount_Vesuvius eruption in AD 79 that led to the destruction of the Roman cities of Pompeii and Herculaneum . eos
is conspicuous in the beautiful landscape presented by the Bay of Naples , when seen from the sea , with Naples in the foreground . Mount_Vesuvius is best known for Mount_Vesuvius eruption in AD 79 that led to the destruction of the Roman cities of Pompeii and Herculaneum . Mount_Vesuvius has erupted many times since and Mount_Vesuvius is today regarded as one of the most dangerous volcanoes in the world because of the population of 3,000,000 people now living close to Mount_Vesuvius and Mount_Vesuvius tendency towards explosive eruptions . eos
is best known for Mount_Vesuvius eruption in AD 79 that led to the destruction of the Roman cities of Pompeii and Herculaneum . Mount_Vesuvius has erupted many times since and Mount_Vesuvius is today regarded as one of the most dangerous volcanoes in the world because of the population of 3,000,000 people now living close to Mount_Vesuvius and Mount_Vesuvius tendency towards explosive eruptions . It is the most densely populated volcanic region in the world . eos
eruption in AD 79 that led to the destruction of the Roman cities of Pompeii and Herculaneum . It is the most densely populated volcanic region in the world . eos
and Mount_Vesuvius tendency towards explosive eruptions . It is the most densely populated volcanic region in the world . Mount_Vesuvius was regarded by the Greeks and Romans as being sacred to the hero and demigod Heracles / Hercules , and the town of Herculaneum , built at Mount_Vesuvius base , was named after him . eos
tendency towards explosive eruptions . It is the most densely populated volcanic region in the world . Mount_Vesuvius was regarded by the Greeks and Romans as being sacred to the hero and demigod Heracles / Hercules , and the town of Herculaneum , built at Mount_Vesuvius base , was named after him . eos
has erupted many times since and Mount_Vesuvius is today regarded as one of the most dangerous volcanoes in the world because of the population of 3,000,000 people now living close to Mount_Vesuvius and Mount_Vesuvius tendency towards explosive eruptions . It is the most densely populated volcanic region in the world . Mount_Vesuvius was regarded by the Greeks and Romans as being sacred to the hero and demigod Heracles / Hercules , and the town of Herculaneum , built at Mount_Vesuvius base , was named after him . eos
is today regarded as one of the most dangerous volcanoes in the world because of the population of 3,000,000 people now living close to Mount_Vesuvius and Mount_Vesuvius tendency towards explosive eruptions . is the highest point in the Owen Stanley Ranges in Central Province , Papua New Guinea at 4,072 metres . Mount_Victoria_Papua_New_Guinea lies approximately 75 km north - north - west of Port Moresby and Mount_Victoria_Papua_New_Guinea can be seen on a clear day from the city . eos
lies approximately 75 km north - north - west of Port Moresby and Mount_Victoria_Papua_New_Guinea can be seen on a clear day from the city . eos

is the highest peak in the Coast Mountains . Mount_Waddington and the subrange which surround Mount_Waddington , the Waddington Range , stand at the heart of the Pacific Ranges , which is to say Mount_Waddington is in a remote and extremely difficult set of mountains and stupendous river valleys . eos
and the subrange which surround Mount_Waddington , the Waddington Range , stand at the heart of the Pacific Ranges , which is to say Mount_Waddington is in a remote and extremely difficult set of mountains and stupendous river valleys . It is not so far north as its extreme arctic - like conditions might indicate and Mount_Waddington and Mount_Waddington attendant peaks pose some of the most serious expedition mountaineering to be had in North America - and some of the most extreme relief and spectacular mountain scenery . eos
, the Waddington Range , stand at the heart of the Pacific Ranges , which is to say Mount_Waddington is in a remote and extremely difficult set of mountains and stupendous river valleys . It is not so far north as its extreme arctic - like conditions might indicate and Mount_Waddington and Mount_Waddington attendant peaks pose some of the most serious expedition mountaineering to be had in North America - and some of the most extreme relief and spectacular mountain scenery . From Mount_Waddington 13,000 ' - plus fang to sea level at the heads of Bute and Knight Inlets is only a few miles ; across the 10,000 deep gorges of the Homathko and the Klinaklini Rivers stand mountains almost as high , and icefields even vaster and whiter , only a few aerial miles away , with a maw deeper than the Grand Canyon , comparable in relief to the Himalaya ( to which the terrain of British Columbia was compared by colonial - era travellers ) . eos
is in a remote and extremely difficult set of mountains and stupendous river valleys . It is not so far north as its extreme arctic - like conditions might indicate and Mount_Waddington and Mount_Waddington attendant peaks pose some of the most serious expedition mountaineering to be had in North America - and some of the most extreme relief and spectacular mountain scenery . From Mount_Waddington 13,000 ' - plus fang to sea level at the heads of Bute and Knight Inlets is only a few miles ; across the 10,000 deep gorges of the Homathko and the Klinaklini Rivers stand mountains almost as high , and icefields even vaster and whiter , only a few aerial miles away , with a maw deeper than the Grand Canyon , comparable in relief to the Himalaya ( to which the terrain of British Columbia was compared by colonial - era travellers ) . eos

is a mountain in Kluane National Park and Reserve in Yukon , Canada . Mount_Walsh was named after a RCMP superintendent for the Yukon territory , James Morrow Walsh . eos
was named after a RCMP superintendent for the Yukon territory , James Morrow Walsh . eos
is the second highest named summit in the state of New Mexico in the United States . However Mount_Walter_New_Mexico is not usually counted as an independent mountain since Mount_Walter_New_Mexico has only about 80 feet of topographic prominence , and Mount_Walter_New_Mexico is only 0.4 miles ( 0.6 km ) north - northeast of Wheeler Peak , the highest peak in New Mexico . Both peaks lie in the Taos Mountains , a subrange of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains , which is in turn a subrange of the Rocky Mountains . eos
is not usually counted as an independent mountain since Mount_Walter_New_Mexico has only about 80 feet of topographic prominence , and Mount_Walter_New_Mexico is only 0.4 miles ( 0.6 km ) north - northeast of Wheeler Peak , the highest peak in New Mexico . Both peaks lie in the Taos Mountains , a subrange of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains , which is in turn a subrange of the Rocky Mountains . eos

( 13,722 ft / 4,182 m ) is located in the Wind River Range in the US state of Wyoming . Mount_Warren is the third highest peak in the range and the fourth in the state . The summit is located in the Fitzpatrick Wilderness of Shoshone National Forest and rises above several glaciers , the best known being Dinwoody Glacier which is immediately north of the summit tower . eos

is a mountain in Yellowstone National Park , in the US state of Wyoming . Mount_Washburn was named for Mount_Washburn discoverer , former Civil War general and US Congressman Henry D Washburn , who was the surveyor general of Montana after the war . Views from the summit include much of the northern section of Yellowstone National Park and on clear days , the Teton Range is also visible . eos
was named for Mount_Washburn discoverer , former Civil War general and US Congressman Henry D Washburn , who was the surveyor general of Montana after the war . Views from the summit include much of the northern section of Yellowstone National Park and on clear days , the Teton Range is also visible . The mountain trails are some of the most frequented in the park , so summer hikes can be crowded . eos

is the highest peak in the American Northeast at 6288 ft . Mount_Washington_New_Hampshire is famous for Mount_Washington_New_Hampshire dangerously erratic weather , holding the record for the highest wind gust directly measured at the Earth 's surface , at 231 mph ( 372 km / h ) on the afternoon of april 12 , 1934 . Mount_Washington_New_Hampshire was known as Agiocochook , or ` ` home of the Great Spirit '' , before European settlers arrived . eos

is a mountain in the Rocky Mountains in the Park Range in Colorado . Mount_Werner reaches a height of 10,568 ft ( 3,224 m ) above sea level and Mount_Werner has a base elevation of 6,900 ft ( 2103 m ) . Mount_Werner has a vertical rise of 3,668 ft ( 1,121 m ) , Colorado 's second highest . eos
reaches a height of 10,568 ft ( 3,224 m ) above sea level and Mount_Werner has a base elevation of 6,900 ft ( 2103 m ) . Mount_Werner has a vertical rise of 3,668 ft ( 1,121 m ) , Colorado 's second highest . Mount_Werner has five peaks ( from lowest to highest ) , Christie Peak , Thunderhead Peak , Sunshine Peak , Storm Peak , and Mt. Werner . eos

has five peaks ( from lowest to highest ) , Christie Peak , Thunderhead Peak , Sunshine Peak , Storm Peak , and Mt. Werner . The Steamboat Ski Resort operates on 2,939 acres of Mount_Werner . It is serviced by the Silver Bullet Gondola lift and several chairlifts . eos
. It is serviced by the Silver Bullet Gondola lift and several chairlifts . Mount_Werner regularly receives some of the highest levels of snow in Colorado . eos
regularly receives some of the highest levels of snow in Colorado . The most recent ten year snowfall average was 334 in ( 848 cm ) a year . Much of Mount_Werner and the resort are contained within the Routt National Forest . eos

Formerly known as Storm Mountain , Mount_Werner was renamed in honor of Buddy Werner , an Olympian from Steamboat Springs who was killed in an avalanche in Switzerland in april 1964 . Four miles west of Mount_Werner is Steamboat Springs , Colorado , the county seat of Routt County . eos

is the highest point in the contiguous United States at elevation 14,505 feet ( 4,421 meters ) . Mount_Whitney is located at the boundary between California 's Inyo and Tulare counties . The western slope of Mount_Whitney lies within Sequoia National Park . eos
is located at the boundary between California 's Inyo and Tulare counties . The western slope of Mount_Whitney lies within Sequoia National Park . Mount_Whitney is the southern terminus of the John Muir Trail , which runs 211.9 miles ( 340.9 km ) from Yosemite Valley . eos
lies within Sequoia National Park . Mount_Whitney is the southern terminus of the John Muir Trail , which runs 211.9 miles ( 340.9 km ) from Yosemite Valley . Mount_Whitney was named after Josiah Whitney , the State Geologist of California . eos
is the southern terminus of the John Muir Trail , which runs 211.9 miles ( 340.9 km ) from Yosemite Valley . Mount_Whitney was named after Josiah Whitney , the State Geologist of California . Johnson , and John Lucas ( fishermen who lived in Lone Pine , California . ) Mount_Whitney is just 76 miles ( 123 km ) west of the lowest point in North America , in Death Valley ( 282 feet ( 86 m ) below sea level ) . eos

is a high peak of the Fairweather Range , the southernmost part of the Saint Elias Range . Mount_Wilbur_Alaska lies approximately 14 miles ( 22 km ) southeast of Mount Fairweather and 8 miles ( 13 km ) northwest of Mount Crillon . Mount_Wilbur_Alaska is included in Glacier Bay National Park . eos
lies approximately 14 miles ( 22 km ) southeast of Mount Fairweather and 8 miles ( 13 km ) northwest of Mount Crillon . Mount_Wilbur_Alaska is included in Glacier Bay National Park . Mount_Wilbur_Alaska is the higher of a pair of peaks , Mounts Wilbur and Orville , named after the Wright Brothers . eos
is included in Glacier Bay National Park . Mount_Wilbur_Alaska is the higher of a pair of peaks , Mounts Wilbur and Orville , named after the Wright Brothers . Though not a particularly high peak in absolute terms , Mount_Wilbur_Alaska does stand quite high above local terrain , due to Mount_Wilbur_Alaska proximity to the ocean : the summit is only 7.5 miles from tidewater at the head of Lituya Bay to the southwest . eos

is a prominent peak located in the heart of Glacier National Park in the US state of Montana . Plainly visible from the region of Many Glacier , Mount_Wilbur_Montana rises over 4,500 feet above Swiftcurrent Lake and Mount_Wilbur_Montana is a steep pyramid on three sides . The west slopes of Mount_Wilbur_Montana join to ridges along the Continental Divide . eos
rises over 4,500 feet above Swiftcurrent Lake and Mount_Wilbur_Montana is a steep pyramid on three sides . The west slopes of Mount_Wilbur_Montana join to ridges along the Continental Divide . Much of the climbing routes are rated at class 4 to 5 , with some only used once . eos

join to ridges along the Continental Divide . Much of the climbing routes are rated at class 4 to 5 , with some only used once . The sedimentary rock of the mountains makes for often poor anchoring points and enhances the difficulty . eos

, at 14,403 feet ( 4,390 m ) , is the second highest mountain in both the Sierra Nevada range , and the state of California . Mount_Williamson is the sixth highest peak in the contiguous United States . Mount_Williamson lies in the John Muir Wilderness of the Inyo National Forest . eos
is the sixth highest peak in the contiguous United States . Mount_Williamson lies in the John Muir Wilderness of the Inyo National Forest . Mount_Williamson is located approximately 6 miles ( 9 km ) north of Mount Whitney , the highest peak in the contiguous US , and about 2.5 miles ( 4 km ) southeast of Shepherd Pass , the nearest trail access . eos
lies in the John Muir Wilderness of the Inyo National Forest . Mount_Williamson is located approximately 6 miles ( 9 km ) north of Mount Whitney , the highest peak in the contiguous US , and about 2.5 miles ( 4 km ) southeast of Shepherd Pass , the nearest trail access . The closest town is Independence , California , about 11.8 miles ( 19 km ) north - north - east of Mount_Williamson in the Owens Valley . eos
is located approximately 6 miles ( 9 km ) north of Mount Whitney , the highest peak in the contiguous US , and about 2.5 miles ( 4 km ) southeast of Shepherd Pass , the nearest trail access . The closest town is Independence , California , about 11.8 miles ( 19 km ) north - north - east of Mount_Williamson in the Owens Valley . Mount_Williamson lies about 1 mile ( 1.6 km ) east of the High Sierra crest , which forms the western edge of the Owens Valley . eos
in the Owens Valley . Mount_Williamson lies about 1 mile ( 1.6 km ) east of the High Sierra crest , which forms the western edge of the Owens Valley . Mount_Williamson is more remote than Whitney in terms of access ; however Mount_Williamson is actually a bit closer to the Owens Valley floor than Whitney . eos
lies about 1 mile ( 1.6 km ) east of the High Sierra crest , which forms the western edge of the Owens Valley . Mount_Williamson is more remote than Whitney in terms of access ; however Mount_Williamson is actually a bit closer to the Owens Valley floor than Whitney . For example , the drop from the summit to the forest edge is 8,000 feet ( 2,430 m ) in approximately 4 miles ( 6.4 km ) . eos
is more remote than Whitney in terms of access ; however Mount_Williamson is actually a bit closer to the Owens Valley floor than Whitney . This makes Mount_Williamson an imposing mountain , though far less of a popular climb than Mount_Williamson higher neighbor . eos
is actually a bit closer to the Owens Valley floor than Whitney . For example , the drop from the summit to the forest edge is 8,000 feet ( 2,430 m ) in approximately 4 miles ( 6.4 km ) . This makes Mount_Williamson an imposing mountain , though far less of a popular climb than Mount_Williamson higher neighbor . eos
higher neighbor . The standard ascent route is the West Side Route , accessed from Shepherd 's Pass . From the pass , one travels across the Williamson Bowl , which lies between Mount_Williamson and Mount Tyndall , part of the Sierra Crest . eos
an imposing mountain , though far less of a popular climb than Mount_Williamson higher neighbor . The standard ascent route is the West Side Route , accessed from Shepherd 's Pass . From the pass , one travels across the Williamson Bowl , which lies between Mount_Williamson and Mount Tyndall , part of the Sierra Crest . eos
and Mount Tyndall , part of the Sierra Crest . The bowl is home to five high alpine lakes . From the bowl , the route climbs gullies up the west face to the relatively broad summit plateau ; this portion involves scrambling up to Class 3 . eos
, including a significant technical route on the North Rib ( Grade IV , 5.7 ) . Climbing Mount_Williamson is made more difficult by two factors : first is the length and difficulty of the approach . Elevation gain from the trailhead is over 8,000 feet ( 2,430 m ) , and the trail to Shepherd 's Pass alone is 11 miles ( 18 km ) . eos
is made more difficult by two factors : first is the length and difficulty of the approach . Elevation gain from the trailhead is over 8,000 feet ( 2,430 m ) , and the trail to Shepherd 's Pass alone is 11 miles ( 18 km ) . Second , Mount_Williamson is in the Bighorn Sheep Zoological Preserve , which is closed for much of the year . eos
is in the Bighorn Sheep Zoological Preserve , which is closed for much of the year . The first recorded ascent of Mount_Williamson was made in 1884 by W L. Hunter and C Mulholland , via the Southeast Slopes Route . The first ascent of the West Side Route was made in 1896 by Bolton C Brown and Lucy Brown . eos
was made in 1884 by W L. Hunter and C Mulholland , via the Southeast Slopes Route . The first ascent of the West Side Route was made in 1896 by Bolton C Brown and Lucy Brown . New routes continued to be put up on the harder faces at least through the 1970s . eos
is named after Lt . Robert Stockton Williamson ( 1825 - 1882 ) , who conducted one of the Pacific Railroad Surveys in Southern California . eos
is one of the more prominent peaks in the San Gabriel Mountains , part of the Angeles National Forest in Los Angeles County , California , USA . Mount_Wilson_California is the location of the Mount Wilson Observatory and Mount_Wilson_California has become the astronomical center of Southern California with 60 inch ( 1524 mm ) and 100 inch ( 2540 mm ) telescopes , and 60 foot ( 18 m ) and 150 foot ( 46 m ) solar towers . Mount_Wilson_California is located at 5,710 feet although surrounding peaks around Mount_Wilson_California can rise slightly above 6,000 feet . eos
is the location of the Mount Wilson Observatory and Mount_Wilson_California has become the astronomical center of Southern California with 60 inch ( 1524 mm ) and 100 inch ( 2540 mm ) telescopes , and 60 foot ( 18 m ) and 150 foot ( 46 m ) solar towers . Mount_Wilson_California is located at 5,710 feet although surrounding peaks around Mount_Wilson_California can rise slightly above 6,000 feet . Due to this elevation , winter snow can sometimes interrupt astronomical activities on Mount_Wilson_California . eos

, also known as Mount Mulanje , is a large monadnock in southern Malawi near the city of Blantyre , rising sharply from the surrounding plains of Chiradzulu , and the tea - growing Mulanje district . Mulanje_Massif measures approximately 13x16 miles ( 22x26 kilometres ) and Mulanje_Massif has a maximum elevation of 3,002 m at Mulanje_Massif highest point , Sapitwa Peak . eos
measures approximately 13x16 miles ( 22x26 kilometres ) and Mulanje_Massif has a maximum elevation of 3,002 m at Mulanje_Massif highest point , Sapitwa Peak . Much of Mulanje_Massif consists of rolling grassland at elevations of 1800 - 2200 m , intersected by deep forested ravines . eos
has a maximum elevation of 3,002 m at Mulanje_Massif highest point , Sapitwa Peak . Much of Mulanje_Massif consists of rolling grassland at elevations of 1800 - 2200 m , intersected by deep forested ravines . Mulanje_Massif has many individual peaks reaching heights of over 2500 m , including Chambe Peak , the West Face of which is the longest rock climb in Africa . eos
highest point , Sapitwa Peak . Much of Mulanje_Massif consists of rolling grassland at elevations of 1800 - 2200 m , intersected by deep forested ravines . Mulanje_Massif has many individual peaks reaching heights of over 2500 m , including Chambe Peak , the West Face of which is the longest rock climb in Africa . eos
consists of rolling grassland at elevations of 1800 - 2200 m , intersected by deep forested ravines . Mulanje_Massif has many individual peaks reaching heights of over 2500 m , including Chambe Peak , the West Face of which is the longest rock climb in Africa . Mulanje_Massif was formed by the extrusion of magma into the earth 's crust about 130 million years ago . eos
has many individual peaks reaching heights of over 2500 m , including Chambe Peak , the West Face of which is the longest rock climb in Africa . Mulanje_Massif was formed by the extrusion of magma into the earth 's crust about 130 million years ago . The surrounding rock eroded away over time , leaving behind the erosion - resistant igneous rock of Mulanje_Massif . eos
was formed by the extrusion of magma into the earth 's crust about 130 million years ago . The surrounding rock eroded away over time , leaving behind the erosion - resistant igneous rock of Mulanje_Massif . The first European to report seeing Mulanje_Massif was David Livingstone in 1859 , but archeological investigation reveals evidence of human visits to Mulanje_Massif from the Stone Age onwards . eos
. The first European to report seeing Mulanje_Massif was David Livingstone in 1859 , but archeological investigation reveals evidence of human visits to Mulanje_Massif from the Stone Age onwards . The elevation of Mulanje_Massif is high enough for Mulanje_Massif disturb upper level air flow and induce rain clouds to form around Mulanje_Massif , making Mulanje_Massif an important source of rain water at the head of almost every river that runs through this part of Malawi . eos
from the Stone Age onwards . The elevation of Mulanje_Massif is high enough for Mulanje_Massif disturb upper level air flow and induce rain clouds to form around Mulanje_Massif , making Mulanje_Massif an important source of rain water at the head of almost every river that runs through this part of Malawi . The forested slopes of Mulanje_Massif support a sizable timber industry . eos
was David Livingstone in 1859 , but archeological investigation reveals evidence of human visits to Mulanje_Massif from the Stone Age onwards . The elevation of Mulanje_Massif is high enough for Mulanje_Massif disturb upper level air flow and induce rain clouds to form around Mulanje_Massif , making Mulanje_Massif an important source of rain water at the head of almost every river that runs through this part of Malawi . The forested slopes of Mulanje_Massif support a sizable timber industry . eos
is high enough for Mulanje_Massif disturb upper level air flow and induce rain clouds to form around Mulanje_Massif , making Mulanje_Massif an important source of rain water at the head of almost every river that runs through this part of Malawi . The forested slopes of Mulanje_Massif support a sizable timber industry . At one time there was a cableway to transport timber from the edge of the plateau down to the Likhubula Forestry Station , but it fell into disrepair , and currently planks are carried down manually . eos

an important source of rain water at the head of almost every river that runs through this part of Malawi . The forested slopes of Mulanje_Massif support a sizable timber industry . At one time there was a cableway to transport timber from the edge of the plateau down to the Likhubula Forestry Station , but it fell into disrepair , and currently planks are carried down manually . eos
support a sizable timber industry . At one time there was a cableway to transport timber from the edge of the plateau down to the Likhubula Forestry Station , but it fell into disrepair , and currently planks are carried down manually . Mulanje_Massif is part of the protected Mulanje Mountain Forest Reserve . eos
is part of the protected Mulanje Mountain Forest Reserve . The native Mulanje Cypress ( Widdringtonia whytei ) has been so heavily logged that it is considered endangered and the park contains the last remaining stands of this tree , as well as a number of other plant and animal species - many of them endemic to the area . Examples include forest butterfies , birds such as the cholo alethe and White - winged Apalis , Dwarf Chameleon , geckos , skinks , the Squeaker Frog , and a rare limbless burrowing skink species . eos
is popular for hiking and climbing , and Mulanje_Massif has several mountain huts scattered across Mulanje_Massif . Sapitwa peak was first climbed in 1894 , and is now the most popular climb on the plateau . eos
has several mountain huts scattered across Mulanje_Massif . Sapitwa peak was first climbed in 1894 , and is now the most popular climb on the plateau . eos
. Sapitwa peak was first climbed in 1894 , and is now the most popular climb on the plateau . eos
is the highest mountain in continental Spain and in the Iberian Peninsula . Mulhacin is part of the Sierra Nevada range in the Cordillera Penibética . Mulhacin is named after Muley Abul Hassan , the penultimate Muslim King of Granada in the 15th century , who according to legend was buried on the summit of Mulhacin . eos
is part of the Sierra Nevada range in the Cordillera Penibética . Mulhacin is named after Muley Abul Hassan , the penultimate Muslim King of Granada in the 15th century , who according to legend was buried on the summit of Mulhacin . While not of exceptional height by European standards , Mulhacin is the highest peak in Europe outside the Caucasus Mountains and the Alps . eos
is named after Muley Abul Hassan , the penultimate Muslim King of Granada in the 15th century , who according to legend was buried on the summit of Mulhacin . While not of exceptional height by European standards , Mulhacin is the highest peak in Europe outside the Caucasus Mountains and the Alps . Mulhacin is also the third most topographically prominent peak in Western Europe , after Mont Blanc and Mount Etna , and Mulhacin is ranked 64th in the world by prominence . eos
. While not of exceptional height by European standards , Mulhacin is the highest peak in Europe outside the Caucasus Mountains and the Alps . Mulhacin is also the third most topographically prominent peak in Western Europe , after Mont Blanc and Mount Etna , and Mulhacin is ranked 64th in the world by prominence . eos
is the highest peak in Europe outside the Caucasus Mountains and the Alps . Mulhacin is also the third most topographically prominent peak in Western Europe , after Mont Blanc and Mount Etna , and Mulhacin is ranked 64th in the world by prominence . Mulhacin is not exceptionally dramatic in terms of steepness or local relief . eos
is also the third most topographically prominent peak in Western Europe , after Mont Blanc and Mount Etna , and Mulhacin is ranked 64th in the world by prominence . Mulhacin is not exceptionally dramatic in terms of steepness or local relief . The south flank of Mulhacin is gentle , and presents no technical challenge , as is the case for the long west ridge . eos
is ranked 64th in the world by prominence . Mulhacin is not exceptionally dramatic in terms of steepness or local relief . The south flank of Mulhacin is gentle , and presents no technical challenge , as is the case for the long west ridge . eos
is not exceptionally dramatic in terms of steepness or local relief . The south flank of Mulhacin is gentle , and presents no technical challenge , as is the case for the long west ridge . The shorter , somewhat steeper north east ridge is slightly more technical . eos
is gentle , and presents no technical challenge , as is the case for the long west ridge . The shorter , somewhat steeper north east ridge is slightly more technical . The north face of Mulhacin , however , is much steeper , and offers several routes involving moderately steep climbing on snow and ice ( up to French grade AD ) in the winter . eos
, however , is much steeper , and offers several routes involving moderately steep climbing on snow and ice ( up to French grade AD ) in the winter . Mulhacin can be climbed in a single day from the villages of either Capileira or Trevelez , but it is more common to spend a night at the mountain refuge at Poqueira , or in the bare shelter at Caldera to the west . Those making the ascent from Trevelez can also bivouac at the tarns to the northeast of Mulhacin . eos
can be climbed in a single day from the villages of either Capileira or Trevelez , but it is more common to spend a night at the mountain refuge at Poqueira , or in the bare shelter at Caldera to the west . Those making the ascent from Trevelez can also bivouac at the tarns to the northeast of Mulhacin . On march 7 , 2006 three British climbers from Teesside died on Mulhacin from suspected hypothermia . eos
. On march 7 , 2006 three British climbers from Teesside died on Mulhacin from suspected hypothermia . Initial reports quoting the Spanish Civil Guard stated that the three were ill - equipped for the extreme conditions . eos
from suspected hypothermia . Initial reports quoting the Spanish Civil Guard stated that the three were ill - equipped for the extreme conditions . This claim was subsequently disputed both by the family and a colleague of one of the climbers , and by one of the rescuers . eos
, or Muztagata ( Chinese : 慕士塔格峰 ; pinyin : Mùshìtǎgé Fēng ) , is the second highest of the mountains which form the northern edge of the Tibetan Plateau . eos
is sometimes regarded as being part of the Kunlun Shan , although physically Muztagh_Ata is more closely connected to the Pamir . Muztagh_Ata is also reputedly one of the easiest 7,000 m peaks in the world to climb , due to Muztagh_Ata gentle western slope and the comparatively drier weather of Xinjiang . eos

( also : Mustagh Tower ; Muztagh : ice tower ) , is a mountain of the Karakoram range in the Himalaya in Northern Areas of Pakistan . Muztagh_Tower is often said to be one of the most difficult mountains in the world to climb . eos
is often said to be one of the most difficult mountains in the world to climb . Muztagh_Tower stands 7,273 metres high between the basins of the Baltoro and Sarpo Laggo glaciers , and Muztagh_Tower also possesses a second summit , on the northeast ridge , that is 7,180 m high . Long considered unclimbable , Muztagh_Tower was first summited in 1956 by a British expedition , consisting of John Hartog , Joe Brown , Tom Patey and Ian McNaught Davis , that came from the west side . eos
stands 7,273 metres high between the basins of the Baltoro and Sarpo Laggo glaciers , and Muztagh_Tower also possesses a second summit , on the northeast ridge , that is 7,180 m high . Long considered unclimbable , Muztagh_Tower was first summited in 1956 by a British expedition , consisting of John Hartog , Joe Brown , Tom Patey and Ian McNaught Davis , that came from the west side . The group barely managed to beat a French party attempting to climb Muztagh_Tower from the east , reaching the top on july 6 , 1956 , five days before the French . eos
also possesses a second summit , on the northeast ridge , that is 7,180 m high . ( 4,327 m ) is a mountain in the Pennine Alps in Switzerland . Nadelhorn is the highest point on the Nadelgrat , a high - level ridge running roughly north - south above the resort of Saas - Fee to the east , and the Mattertal to the west . Nadelhorn three ridges join to form a sharp - pointed summit , which looks like a needle ( German : Nadel ) when seen from the north . eos
is the highest point on the Nadelgrat , a high - level ridge running roughly north - south above the resort of Saas - Fee to the east , and the Mattertal to the west . Nadelhorn three ridges join to form a sharp - pointed summit , which looks like a needle ( German : Nadel ) when seen from the north . Nadelhorn was first climbed by Franz Andenmatten , Baptiste Epiney , Aloys Supersaxo and J Zimmermann on 16 september 1858 . eos

Namcha_Barwa forms the eastern anchor of the Himalayan chain , and Namcha_Barwa is the easternmost mountain in the world over 7600 m . eos

is the second highest mountain in India , and the highest entirely within the country . ( Kangchenjunga , on the border of India and Nepal , is the highest peak in India . However , as per the Indian Government , K2 is the highest mountain in India ) . eos

is the ninth highest mountain on Earth . Nanga Parbat means ` ` Naked Mountain '' in Urdu , parbat deriving from the Sanskrit word parvata ( पर्वत ) meaning ` ` mountain '' . Nanga_Parbat was one of the deadliest of the eight - thousanders for climbers in the first half of the twentieth century ; since that time Nanga_Parbat has been less so , though still an extremely serious climb . eos

is a mountain peak of volcanic origin located in the Andes mountain range of Peru . Nevado_Mismi is about 160 km west of Lake Titicaca and 700 km southeast of Peru 's capital city , Lima , in the Arequipa Region . Nevado_Mismi is one of the highest points of Colca Canyon . eos
is about 160 km west of Lake Titicaca and 700 km southeast of Peru 's capital city , Lima , in the Arequipa Region . Nevado_Mismi is one of the highest points of Colca Canyon . There are several glaciers on Nevado_Mismi . eos
is one of the highest points of Colca Canyon . There are several glaciers on Nevado_Mismi . In 2001 , it was verified that the main headwater of the Amazon River has its glacial source on Nevado_Mismi . eos
. In 2001 , it was verified that the main headwater of the Amazon River has its glacial source on Nevado_Mismi . An expedition of the National Geographic Society discovered that Carhuasanta stream flowing into Río Apurímac originates on Nevado_Mismi northern slopes and then runs its course through other tributaries and rivers to help form the main Amazon River . eos
. An expedition of the National Geographic Society discovered that Carhuasanta stream flowing into Río Apurímac originates on Nevado_Mismi northern slopes and then runs its course through other tributaries and rivers to help form the main Amazon River . The fact that the headwaters of Río Apurímac are the source of the Amazon River was confirmed by Brazilian scientists in 2007 , who pointed at Quebrada Apacheta as the most probable source of the Amazon . eos
northern slopes and then runs its course through other tributaries and rivers to help form the main Amazon River . The fact that the headwaters of Río Apurímac are the source of the Amazon River was confirmed by Brazilian scientists in 2007 , who pointed at Quebrada Apacheta as the most probable source of the Amazon . eos
is a mountain in Peru , located in the Cordillera Blanca about 60 km north of Huaraz . Nevado_Pisco was first climbed in july 12 , 1951 by C Kojan , G Kojan , R Leininger and M Lenoir . Previously , Nevado_Pisco was popular for Nevado_Pisco easy climb . eos
was first climbed in july 12 , 1951 by C Kojan , G Kojan , R Leininger and M Lenoir . Previously , Nevado_Pisco was popular for Nevado_Pisco easy climb . Due to global warming and the resulting retreat of glaciers worldwide , a large piece of the glacier broke away in 2004 . eos
was popular for Nevado_Pisco easy climb . Due to global warming and the resulting retreat of glaciers worldwide , a large piece of the glacier broke away in 2004 . As a result , Nevado_Pisco is no longer the easy climb Nevado_Pisco once was and depending on the season eos

There are a multitude of companies in Huaraz offering guided climbs of Nevado_Pisco , which usually include all equipment , food , transport , guide , and possibly a porter . The normal route is from the road to the south , up to the col to the west , then to the summit . eos

The altitude makes the climb very difficult for anyone not well acclimatised or fit , and even those who are will be slowed down . Sleeping at the two high camps is also difficult . eos
is an extinct stratovolcano and the highest peak in Bolivia . Nevado_Sajama is located in Sajama National Park in the southwest area of the country some 16 - 24 km ( 10 - 15 mi ) from the border with Chile . Nevado_Sajama is an isolated cone , but Nevado_Sajama is geologically complex , with lava domes of andesitic and rhyodactic composition overlain by an andesitic stratovolcano . eos
is located in Sajama National Park in the southwest area of the country some 16 - 24 km ( 10 - 15 mi ) from the border with Chile . Nevado_Sajama is an isolated cone , but Nevado_Sajama is geologically complex , with lava domes of andesitic and rhyodactic composition overlain by an andesitic stratovolcano . The date of the most recent eruption is uncertain , although Holocene activity is assigned to Nevado_Sajama by many . eos
is an isolated cone , but Nevado_Sajama is geologically complex , with lava domes of andesitic and rhyodactic composition overlain by an andesitic stratovolcano . The date of the most recent eruption is uncertain , although Holocene activity is assigned to Nevado_Sajama by many . Joseph Prem made the first attempt to climb Nevado_Sajama in 1927 by the northwest ridge but was stopped short at 6,200 m . eos
is geologically complex , with lava domes of andesitic and rhyodactic composition overlain by an andesitic stratovolcano . The date of the most recent eruption is uncertain , although Holocene activity is assigned to Nevado_Sajama by many . Joseph Prem made the first attempt to climb Nevado_Sajama in 1927 by the northwest ridge but was stopped short at 6,200 m . eos
by many . Joseph Prem made the first attempt to climb Nevado_Sajama in 1927 by the northwest ridge but was stopped short at 6,200 m . After several more attempts , Prem along with Wilfrid Kuehm reached the top in august 1939 by a more difficult southeast ridge . eos
in 1927 by the northwest ridge but was stopped short at 6,200 m . After several more attempts , Prem along with Wilfrid Kuehm reached the top in august 1939 by a more difficult southeast ridge . eos
is a mountain in the Andes Mountains . Nevado_Tres_Cruces has two main summits , Tres Cruces Sur at 6,749 m and Tres Cruces Central at 6,629 m . The former marks the border between Argentina and Chile . eos
has two main summits , Tres Cruces Sur at 6,749 m and Tres Cruces Central at 6,629 m . The former marks the border between Argentina and Chile . Nevado_Tres_Cruces gives Nevado_Tres_Cruces name to Nevado Tres Cruces National Park in Chile . eos

is a large stratovolcano in central Mexico , located about 80 km west of Mexico City near the city of Toluca . Nevado_de_Toluca is generally cited as the fourth highest of Mexico 's peaks , after Pico de Orizaba , Popocatépetl , and Iztaccíhuatl , although by some measurements , Sierra Negra is slightly higher . Nevado_de_Toluca is often called by the Nahuatl name Xinantécatl , ` ` Senor Desnudo '' in spanish , which is usually translated as ` ` The Naked Man '' although other etymologies have been suggested such as ` ` Lord of the Cornstalks '' ( chinām ( itl ) ` cornstalks ' + tēcatl ` lord of ' ) . eos
is generally cited as the fourth highest of Mexico 's peaks , after Pico de Orizaba , Popocatépetl , and Iztaccíhuatl , although by some measurements , Sierra Negra is slightly higher . Nevado_de_Toluca is often called by the Nahuatl name Xinantécatl , ` ` Senor Desnudo '' in spanish , which is usually translated as ` ` The Naked Man '' although other etymologies have been suggested such as ` ` Lord of the Cornstalks '' ( chinām ( itl ) ` cornstalks ' + tēcatl ` lord of ' ) . Nevado_de_Toluca has a 1.5 km ( 1 mile ) wide summit caldera which is open to the west . eos
is often called by the Nahuatl name Xinantécatl , ` ` Senor Desnudo '' in spanish , which is usually translated as ` ` The Naked Man '' although other etymologies have been suggested such as ` ` Lord of the Cornstalks '' ( chinām ( itl ) ` cornstalks ' + tēcatl ` lord of ' ) . Nevado_de_Toluca has a 1.5 km ( 1 mile ) wide summit caldera which is open to the west . The highest summit , Pico del Fraile ( Friar 's Peak ) , is on the south side of the crater and the second highest , Pico de la Aguila ( Eagle 's Peak ) , is on the north . eos
has a 1.5 km ( 1 mile ) wide summit caldera which is open to the west . The highest summit , Pico del Fraile ( Friar 's Peak ) , is on the south side of the crater and the second highest , Pico de la Aguila ( Eagle 's Peak ) , is on the north . There are two crater lakes on the floor of the basin at about 4200 m , the larger Laguna del Sol ( Sun Lake ) and the smaller , but deeper , Laguna de la Luna ( Moon Lake ) . eos
perhaps the most accessible major Mexican peak . From the southeast , Nevado_de_Toluca looks flat - topped , like shoulders without a head . A legend ( recounted as part of the legend of Popocatépetl and Iztaccíhuatl ) provides a mythical explanation . eos
looks flat - topped , like shoulders without a head . A legend ( recounted as part of the legend of Popocatépetl and Iztaccíhuatl ) provides a mythical explanation . eos
, at 5,365 metres ( 17,602 ft ) , is the highest volcano in Colombia , located in Huila Department . Over the years , the amount of snow on Nevado_del_Huila has been decreasing due to global warming . After being dormant for more than 500 years , Nevado_del_Huila showed heavy signs of activity in 2007 . eos
has been decreasing due to global warming . After being dormant for more than 500 years , Nevado_del_Huila showed heavy signs of activity in 2007 . As of february 20 , 2007 there have been more than 7000 ` ` minor '' seismic events , and a high state of alert is currently in place for the departments of Cauca , Huila , Caldas and Valle del Cauca . eos
showed heavy signs of activity in 2007 . As of february 20 , 2007 there have been more than 7000 ` ` minor '' seismic events , and a high state of alert is currently in place for the departments of Cauca , Huila , Caldas and Valle del Cauca . An eruption could result in a tragedy for the small villages around Nevado_del_Huila , mostly Paez , Cauca where their habitants still have in the memory the eruption of the Nevado del Ruiz volcano and the destruction of Armero . eos
, mostly Paez , Cauca where their habitants still have in the memory the eruption of the Nevado del Ruiz volcano and the destruction of Armero . eos
is an Andean stratovolcano in Caldas Department , Colombia . Nevado_del_Ruiz is the northernmost volcano of the Andean Volcanic Belt and Nevado_del_Ruiz lies about 15 miles southeast of Manizales , with the town of Armero in the valley below . Nevado_del_Ruiz is the northernmost and highest Colombian volcano with historical activity . eos
is the northernmost volcano of the Andean Volcanic Belt and Nevado_del_Ruiz lies about 15 miles southeast of Manizales , with the town of Armero in the valley below . Nevado_del_Ruiz is the northernmost and highest Colombian volcano with historical activity . Nevado_del_Ruiz 1985 eruption produced a lahar which completely buried the city and caused an estimated 23,000 deaths in what came to be known as the Armero tragedy . eos
lies about 15 miles southeast of Manizales , with the town of Armero in the valley below . Nevado_del_Ruiz is the northernmost and highest Colombian volcano with historical activity . Nevado_del_Ruiz 1985 eruption produced a lahar which completely buried the city and caused an estimated 23,000 deaths in what came to be known as the Armero tragedy . eos
is the northernmost and highest Colombian volcano with historical activity . Nevado_del_Ruiz 1985 eruption produced a lahar which completely buried the city and caused an estimated 23,000 deaths in what came to be known as the Armero tragedy . Nevado_del_Ruiz was produced by subduction of the oceanic Nazca Plate beneath the continental South American Plate . eos

Stratovolcanoes in the Andes are for the most part Plinian , as is Nevado_del_Ruiz , and produce pyroclastic flows . eos

is a volcano located in Tolima Department , Colombia , south of Nevado del Ruiz volcano . Nevado_del_Tolima contrasts with the broad profile of Nevado del Ruiz volcano to the north . Nevado_del_Tolima formed during the past 40,000 years , rising above and largely obscuring a 3-km - wide late - Pleistocene caldera . eos
contrasts with the broad profile of Nevado del Ruiz volcano to the north . Nevado_del_Tolima formed during the past 40,000 years , rising above and largely obscuring a 3-km - wide late - Pleistocene caldera . The summit consists of a cluster of late - Pleistocene to Holocene lava domes that were associated with thick block - lava flows on the northern and eastern flanks and extensive pyroclastic - flow deposits . eos
formed during the past 40,000 years , rising above and largely obscuring a 3-km - wide late - Pleistocene caldera . The summit consists of a cluster of late - Pleistocene to Holocene lava domes that were associated with thick block - lava flows on the northern and eastern flanks and extensive pyroclastic - flow deposits . The summit contains a funnel - shaped crater 200 - 300 m deep . eos
in the 19th and 20th centuries . eos
7,985 ft ( 2,434 m ) high is a large shield volcano located 40 miles ( 60 km ) east of the Cascade Volcanic Belt , the Cascade Range and about 20 miles ( 30 km ) southeast of Bend , Oregon . eos
is not a typical shield volcano in that , in addition to erupting basaltic lavas , Newberry_Volcano also has erupted andesitic and even rhyolitic lava . Newberry_Volcano is 20 miles ( 30 km ) in diameter , Newberry_Volcano has an approximate volume of 80 mile ³ ( 330 km ³ ) , and Newberry_Volcano possesses a large oval - shaped caldera four by five miles in diameter , called the Newberry Caldera . Within the caldera there are two lakes ( Paulina Lake and East Lake ) many pyroclastic cones , lava flows , and obsidian domes . eos
also has erupted andesitic and even rhyolitic lava . Newberry_Volcano is 20 miles ( 30 km ) in diameter , Newberry_Volcano has an approximate volume of 80 mile ³ ( 330 km ³ ) , and Newberry_Volcano possesses a large oval - shaped caldera four by five miles in diameter , called the Newberry Caldera . Within the caldera there are two lakes ( Paulina Lake and East Lake ) many pyroclastic cones , lava flows , and obsidian domes . eos
is 20 miles ( 30 km ) in diameter , Newberry_Volcano has an approximate volume of 80 mile ³ ( 330 km ³ ) , and Newberry_Volcano possesses a large oval - shaped caldera four by five miles in diameter , called the Newberry Caldera . Within the caldera there are two lakes ( Paulina Lake and East Lake ) many pyroclastic cones , lava flows , and obsidian domes . A deep gash in the northern caldera wall , dubbed The Fissure , is the end of a 29 mile ( 47 km ) long series of fractures called the Northwest Rift Zone . eos

is located in the Teton Range , Grand Teton National Park , Wyoming , immediately southeast of Grand Teton . Nez_Perce_mountain is in the central portions of the range , immediately east of Cloudveil Dome and Nez_Perce_mountain is sometimes considered to be part of what is collectively known as the Cathedral Group . Nez_Perce_mountain rises to the south of Garnet Canyon and Nez_Perce_mountain is a dramatic peak eos

When viewed from Jackson Hole , Nez_Perce_mountain often obscures the view of Cloudveil Dome as well as South Teton , even though both summits are higher . eos

( also known as Peak 29 , Dakura , Dakum , or Dunapurna ) is a high peak in the Mansiri Himal ( or Manaslu Himal ) , also known as the Gurkha Massif , in Nepal . Ngadi_Chuli is flanked by Manaslu to the north and Himalchuli to the south . Despite Ngadi_Chuli top 20 height , Ngadi_Chuli has only been climbed once or twice . eos
is flanked by Manaslu to the north and Himalchuli to the south . Despite Ngadi_Chuli top 20 height , Ngadi_Chuli has only been climbed once or twice . The probable first ascent occurred in 1970 . eos
top 20 height , Ngadi_Chuli has only been climbed once or twice . The probable first ascent occurred in 1970 . Hiroshi Watanabe and Sherpa Lhaksa Tsering , members of a Japanese expedition , climbed the east ridge and face . eos
has only been climbed once or twice . The probable first ascent occurred in 1970 . Hiroshi Watanabe and Sherpa Lhaksa Tsering , members of a Japanese expedition , climbed the east ridge and face . eos
, the Japanese organized three more expeditions , but these all failed . The first confirmed ascent , and as of 2005 the last attempt on Ngadi_Chuli , was in 1979 by the Polish climbers Ryszard Gajewski and Maciej Pawlikowski via the West buttress . eos
, was in 1979 by the Polish climbers Ryszard Gajewski and Maciej Pawlikowski via the West buttress . eos
( meaning north end in German ) is the northernmost peak of the Monte Rosa massif . Nordend is the fourth highest peak of the massif , after the Dufourspitze ( 4,634 m ) , the Ostspitze ( 4,632 m ) and the Grenzgipfel ( 4,618 m ) . eos
is the fourth highest peak of the massif , after the Dufourspitze ( 4,634 m ) , the Ostspitze ( 4,632 m ) and the Grenzgipfel ( 4,618 m ) . eos
is a peak in the Catskill Mountains of New York , on the border between the towns of Catskill and Hunter , in Greene County . North_Mountain_Catskills is part of the Catskill Escarpment . North_Mountain_Catskills overlooks the North - South Lake State Campground , an area where resort hotels such as the Catskill Mountain House were once located , and thus North_Mountain_Catskills has long been a popular climb with hikers . eos
is part of the Catskill Escarpment . North_Mountain_Catskills overlooks the North - South Lake State Campground , an area where resort hotels such as the Catskill Mountain House were once located , and thus North_Mountain_Catskills has long been a popular climb with hikers . North_Mountain_Catskills can be reached by several trails from the campground area , all of which eventually lead to the Escarpment Trail , which crosses the summit . eos
overlooks the North - South Lake State Campground , an area where resort hotels such as the Catskill Mountain House were once located , and thus North_Mountain_Catskills has long been a popular climb with hikers . North_Mountain_Catskills can be reached by several trails from the campground area , all of which eventually lead to the Escarpment Trail , which crosses the summit . Most hikers stop , at least for a while , at North Point , an area of many open ledges located at 2,900 feet ( 880 m ) , along the trail about a half - mile ( 800 m ) below the summit . eos
has long been a popular climb with hikers . North_Mountain_Catskills can be reached by several trails from the campground area , all of which eventually lead to the Escarpment Trail , which crosses the summit . Most hikers stop , at least for a while , at North Point , an area of many open ledges located at 2,900 feet ( 880 m ) , along the trail about a half - mile ( 800 m ) below the summit . eos
can be reached by several trails from the campground area , all of which eventually lead to the Escarpment Trail , which crosses the summit . Most hikers stop , at least for a while , at North Point , an area of many open ledges located at 2,900 feet ( 880 m ) , along the trail about a half - mile ( 800 m ) below the summit . The views of the lakes , other mountains such as Kaaterskill High Peak and the Hudson River and its valley are expansive . eos
is the third highest mountain in the Sierra Nevada range of California . North_Palisade is the highest peak of the Palisades group of peaks in the central part of the range . North_Palisade sports a small glacier ( the Palisade Glacier ) and several highly prized rock climbing routes on North_Palisade northeast side . eos

is one of the two peaks that comprise The Twins massif located at the northeast corner of the Columbia Icefield in Jasper National Park , Alberta , Canada . The other lower peak is named South Twin ( 3,566 m ) . North_Twin_Peak is the third highest peak in the Canadian Rockies , after Mount Robson and Mount Columbia . eos
is the third highest peak in the Canadian Rockies , after Mount Robson and Mount Columbia . The massif was named The Twins in 1898 by J Norman Collie and Hugh M Stutfield . The decision to name the peaks separately was approved february 28 1980 . eos
and South Twin , the massif contains a northern subpeak of North_Twin_Peak known as Twins Tower , 3,627 m ( 11,900 ft ) . This sits atop the famed north face of the massif ( see below ) , and was named in 1984 . eos
known as Twins Tower , 3,627 m ( 11,900 ft ) . This sits atop the famed north face of the massif ( see below ) , and was named in 1984 . eos
is a mountain in the Khumbu region of the Mahalangur Himal , in the Nepalese Himalaya . Nuptse lies two kilometres WSW of Mount Everest . Nuptse is Tibetan for ` ` west peak '' , as Nuptse is the western segment of the Lhotse - Nuptse massif . eos
lies two kilometres WSW of Mount Everest . Nuptse is Tibetan for ` ` west peak '' , as Nuptse is the western segment of the Lhotse - Nuptse massif . The long east - west trending main ridge of Nuptse is crowned by seven peaks : The main peak , Nuptse I , was first climbed on May 16 , 1961 by Dennis Davis and Sherpa Tashi , members of a British expedition . eos
is the western segment of the Lhotse - Nuptse massif . The long east - west trending main ridge of Nuptse is crowned by seven peaks : The main peak , Nuptse I , was first climbed on May 16 , 1961 by Dennis Davis and Sherpa Tashi , members of a British expedition . After a long hiatus , Nuptse again became the objective of high - standard mountaineers in the 1990s and 2000s , with important routes being put up on Nuptse west , south , and north faces . eos
is crowned by seven peaks : The main peak , Nuptse I , was first climbed on May 16 , 1961 by Dennis Davis and Sherpa Tashi , members of a British expedition . After a long hiatus , Nuptse again became the objective of high - standard mountaineers in the 1990s and 2000s , with important routes being put up on Nuptse west , south , and north faces . While Nuptse is a dramatic peak when viewed from the south or west , and Nuptse towers above the base camp for the standard south col route on Everest , Nuptse is not a particularly independent peak : Nuptse topographic prominence is only 319 m ( 1,047 ft ) . eos
again became the objective of high - standard mountaineers in the 1990s and 2000s , with important routes being put up on Nuptse west , south , and north faces . While Nuptse is a dramatic peak when viewed from the south or west , and Nuptse towers above the base camp for the standard south col route on Everest , Nuptse is not a particularly independent peak : Nuptse topographic prominence is only 319 m ( 1,047 ft ) . Hence Nuptse is not ranked on the list of highest mountains . eos
west , south , and north faces . While Nuptse is a dramatic peak when viewed from the south or west , and Nuptse towers above the base camp for the standard south col route on Everest , Nuptse is not a particularly independent peak : Nuptse topographic prominence is only 319 m ( 1,047 ft ) . Hence Nuptse is not ranked on the list of highest mountains . eos

is a massive stratovolcano in the Andes on the Argentina - Chile border and the highest volcano in the world at 6,891 metres ( 22,608 ft ) . Ojos_del_Salado is also the second highest mountain in the Western Hemisphere and the highest in Chile . Ojos_del_Salado is located about north of Aconcagua , the highest mountain in the Western Hemisphere at 6962 m. eos
is also the second highest mountain in the Western Hemisphere and the highest in Chile . Ojos_del_Salado is located about north of Aconcagua , the highest mountain in the Western Hemisphere at 6962 m. Due to Ojos_del_Salado location near the Atacama desert , Ojos_del_Salado has very dry conditions with snow only remaining on the peak during winter . eos
is located about north of Aconcagua , the highest mountain in the Western Hemisphere at 6962 m. Due to Ojos_del_Salado location near the Atacama desert , Ojos_del_Salado has very dry conditions with snow only remaining on the peak during winter . Despite the generally dry conditions , there is a permanent crater lake about 100 metres ( 300 ft ) in diameter at an elevation of 6390 m on the eastern side of Ojos_del_Salado . eos
location near the Atacama desert , Ojos_del_Salado has very dry conditions with snow only remaining on the peak during winter . Despite the generally dry conditions , there is a permanent crater lake about 100 metres ( 300 ft ) in diameter at an elevation of 6390 m on the eastern side of Ojos_del_Salado . This is most likely the highest lake of any kind in the world . eos
has very dry conditions with snow only remaining on the peak during winter . Despite the generally dry conditions , there is a permanent crater lake about 100 metres ( 300 ft ) in diameter at an elevation of 6390 m on the eastern side of Ojos_del_Salado . This is most likely the highest lake of any kind in the world . eos
. This is most likely the highest lake of any kind in the world . The ascent of Ojos_del_Salado is mostly a hike except for the final section to the summit which is a difficult scramble that may require ropes . eos
is mostly a hike except for the final section to the summit which is a difficult scramble that may require ropes . The first ascent was made in 1937 by Jan Alfred Szczepański and Justyn Wojsznis , members of a Polish andinist expedition . eos
( l'Olan in French ) ( 3,564 m ) is a mountain in the Massif des Écrins in the French Alps . Olan_mountain dominates the valleys of Valgaudemar , Valjouffrey , and Vénéon in the heart of Écrins National Park . eos
dominates the valleys of Valgaudemar , Valjouffrey , and Vénéon in the heart of Écrins National Park . eos
( Italian : Cima Ortles ; German : Ortler ) is , at 3905 m above sea level , the highest mountain in the Eastern Alps outside the Bernina Range . eos
is the main peak of the Ortler Range . Ortler is the highest point of the Southern Limestone Alps , of the Italian region of Trentino - Alto Adige / Südtirol , of Tyrol overall , and , until 1919 , of the Austrian - Hungarian empire . In German Ortler is commonly referred to as ` ` König Ortler '' ( King Ortler ) . eos
is the highest point of the Southern Limestone Alps , of the Italian region of Trentino - Alto Adige / Südtirol , of Tyrol overall , and , until 1919 , of the Austrian - Hungarian empire . In German Ortler is commonly referred to as ` ` König Ortler '' ( King Ortler ) . Ortler is capped by a glacier on the northwest flank and Ortler has a long north ridge that ends at the village of Gomagoi and separates the valleys of Trafoi and Sulden . eos
is commonly referred to as ` ` König Ortler '' ( King Ortler ) . Ortler is capped by a glacier on the northwest flank and Ortler has a long north ridge that ends at the village of Gomagoi and separates the valleys of Trafoi and Sulden . The South ridge leads to the Hochjoch ( 3527 m ) on the main ridge of the Ortler Alps that forms the border of Sondrio and South Tyrol . eos
is capped by a glacier on the northwest flank and Ortler has a long north ridge that ends at the village of Gomagoi and separates the valleys of Trafoi and Sulden . The South ridge leads to the Hochjoch ( 3527 m ) on the main ridge of the Ortler Alps that forms the border of Sondrio and South Tyrol . Going west on this main ridge are the Thurwieser Spitze ( 3652 ) and Trafoier Wall ( 3565 m ) , while to the Southeast are the Monte Zebrù ( 3740 m ) and the majestic Königspitze / Gran Zebrù ( 3859 m ) . eos
has a long north ridge that ends at the village of Gomagoi and separates the valleys of Trafoi and Sulden . The South ridge leads to the Hochjoch ( 3527 m ) on the main ridge of the Ortler Alps that forms the border of Sondrio and South Tyrol . Going west on this main ridge are the Thurwieser Spitze ( 3652 ) and Trafoier Wall ( 3565 m ) , while to the Southeast are the Monte Zebrù ( 3740 m ) and the majestic Königspitze / Gran Zebrù ( 3859 m ) . eos
is known as ` ` das Dreigestirn '' ( the three heavenly bodies ) . eos
( or Volcán de Parícutin , commonly also accented Paricutín or spelled unaccented as Paricutin ) is a volcano in the Mexican state of Michoacán , close to a lava - covered village of the same name . Paricutin appears on many versions of the Seven Natural Wonders of the World . Paricutin began as a fissure in a cornfield owned by Tarascan farmer Dionisio Pulido on february 20 , 1943 . eos
appears on many versions of the Seven Natural Wonders of the World . Paricutin began as a fissure in a cornfield owned by Tarascan farmer Dionisio Pulido on february 20 , 1943 . Pulido , his wife , and son , all witnessed the initial eruption of ash and stones first - hand as they plowed the field . eos
began as a fissure in a cornfield owned by Tarascan farmer Dionisio Pulido on february 20 , 1943 . Pulido , his wife , and son , all witnessed the initial eruption of ash and stones first - hand as they plowed the field . Much of Paricutin growth occurred during Paricutin first year , while Paricutin was still in the explosive pyroclastic phase . eos
growth occurred during Paricutin first year , while Paricutin was still in the explosive pyroclastic phase . Nearby villages Paricutín ( after which Paricutin was named ) and San Juan Parangaricutiro were both buried in lava and ash ; the residents relocated to vacant land nearby . eos
first year , while Paricutin was still in the explosive pyroclastic phase . Nearby villages Paricutín ( after which Paricutin was named ) and San Juan Parangaricutiro were both buried in lava and ash ; the residents relocated to vacant land nearby . eos
was still in the explosive pyroclastic phase . Nearby villages Paricutín ( after which Paricutin was named ) and San Juan Parangaricutiro were both buried in lava and ash ; the residents relocated to vacant land nearby . eos
was named ) and San Juan Parangaricutiro were both buried in lava and ash ; the residents relocated to vacant land nearby . At the end of this phase after roughly one year Paricutin had grown 336 metres tall . eos
had grown 336 metres tall . For the next eight years Paricutin would continue erupting , although this was dominated by relatively quiet eruptions of lava that would scorch the surrounding 25 km ² of land . Paricutin activity would slowly decline during this period until the last six months of the eruption , during which violent and explosive activity was frequent . eos
would continue erupting , although this was dominated by relatively quiet eruptions of lava that would scorch the surrounding 25 km ² of land . Paricutin activity would slowly decline during this period until the last six months of the eruption , during which violent and explosive activity was frequent . In 1952 the eruption ended and Paricutin went quiet , attaining a final height of 424 metres above the cornfield from which Paricutin was born . eos
activity would slowly decline during this period until the last six months of the eruption , during which violent and explosive activity was frequent . In 1952 the eruption ended and Paricutin went quiet , attaining a final height of 424 metres above the cornfield from which Paricutin was born . Paricutin has been quiet since . eos
went quiet , attaining a final height of 424 metres above the cornfield from which Paricutin was born . Paricutin has been quiet since . Like most cinder cones , Paricutin is a monogenetic volcano , which means that Paricutin will never erupt again . eos
was born . Paricutin has been quiet since . Like most cinder cones , Paricutin is a monogenetic volcano , which means that Paricutin will never erupt again . eos
has been quiet since . Like most cinder cones , Paricutin is a monogenetic volcano , which means that Paricutin will never erupt again . Volcanism is a common part of the Mexican landscape . eos
is a monogenetic volcano , which means that Paricutin will never erupt again . Volcanism is a common part of the Mexican landscape . Paricutin is merely the youngest of more than 1,400 volcanic vents that exist in the Trans - Mexican Volcanic Belt and North America . eos
will never erupt again . Volcanism is a common part of the Mexican landscape . Paricutin is merely the youngest of more than 1,400 volcanic vents that exist in the Trans - Mexican Volcanic Belt and North America . eos
is merely the youngest of more than 1,400 volcanic vents that exist in the Trans - Mexican Volcanic Belt and North America . Paricutin is unique in the fact that Paricutin formation was witnessed from Paricutin very conception . Three people died as a result of lightning strikes caused by the eruptions , but no deaths were attributed to the lava or asphyxiation . eos
is unique in the fact that Paricutin formation was witnessed from Paricutin very conception . Three people died as a result of lightning strikes caused by the eruptions , but no deaths were attributed to the lava or asphyxiation . Shots of Paricutin during Paricutin active phase were included in 20th Century Fox 's film Captain from Castile , released in 1947 . eos

is a massive stratovolcano on the border of Chile and Bolivia . Parinacota_Volcano is part of the Nevados de Payachata group of volcanoes . The other major edifice in that group is the Pleistocene peak of Pomerape . eos
is part of the Nevados de Payachata group of volcanoes . The other major edifice in that group is the Pleistocene peak of Pomerape . Parinacota_Volcano last eruptive phase has been dated using the helium surface exposure technique , which ties the eruption to 290AD ± 300 years . eos
last eruptive phase has been dated using the helium surface exposure technique , which ties the eruption to 290AD ± 300 years . One of the most dramatic eruptive events in Parinacota_Volcano past was 8000 years ago , when a major collapse of the edifice produced 6 km ³ debris avalanche . That avalanche blocked drainage patterns in some of the local area , creating Chungará Lake . eos
past was 8000 years ago , when a major collapse of the edifice produced 6 km ³ debris avalanche . That avalanche blocked drainage patterns in some of the local area , creating Chungará Lake . Parinacota_Volcano and Pomerape straddle the border between Sajama National Park ( Bolivia ) and Lauca National Park ( Chile ) . eos
and Pomerape straddle the border between Sajama National Park ( Bolivia ) and Lauca National Park ( Chile ) . eos
is the third highest peak in the Pamir Mountains of Tajikistan . Peak_Korzhenevskaya is one of the five ` ` Snow Leopard Peaks '' in the territory of the former Soviet Union . Peak_Korzhenevskaya is named after Evgenia Korzhenevskaya , the wife of Russian geographer Nikolai L Korzhenevski . eos
is one of the five ` ` Snow Leopard Peaks '' in the territory of the former Soviet Union . Peak_Korzhenevskaya is named after Evgenia Korzhenevskaya , the wife of Russian geographer Nikolai L Korzhenevski . Due to transliteration and declension issues Peak_Korzhenevskaya name is rendered in many different ways , including Korzhenevski , Korzhenevskoi , and Korzenievsky . eos
is named after Evgenia Korzhenevskaya , the wife of Russian geographer Nikolai L Korzhenevski . Due to transliteration and declension issues Peak_Korzhenevskaya name is rendered in many different ways , including Korzhenevski , Korzhenevskoi , and Korzenievsky . eos

( in English : Bernal 's Boulder or Bernal Peak ) is the second - largest monolith in the world , after Mt. Augustus , Western Australia . Pena_de_Bernal is also the third - highest monolith in the world ( 350 meters ( 1148.294 ft ) , after the Rock of Gibraltar and Sugarloaf Mountain in Rio de Janeiro , Brazil . Pena_de_Bernal is located in San Sebastián Bernal , a small town in the Mexican state of Querétaro . eos
is also the third - highest monolith in the world ( 350 meters ( 1148.294 ft ) , after the Rock of Gibraltar and Sugarloaf Mountain in Rio de Janeiro , Brazil . Pena_de_Bernal is located in San Sebastián Bernal , a small town in the Mexican state of Querétaro . According to Leonor Lopez Dominguez of Mexico Desconocido , Pena_de_Bernal was formed some 100 million years ago during the Jurassic period , when Pena_de_Bernal must have been at least three times higher than today . eos
is located in San Sebastián Bernal , a small town in the Mexican state of Querétaro . According to Leonor Lopez Dominguez of Mexico Desconocido , Pena_de_Bernal was formed some 100 million years ago during the Jurassic period , when Pena_de_Bernal must have been at least three times higher than today . Many people make a pilgrimage to the highest point hikeable , visiting a little chapel about halfway up . eos
was formed some 100 million years ago during the Jurassic period , when Pena_de_Bernal must have been at least three times higher than today . Many people make a pilgrimage to the highest point hikeable , visiting a little chapel about halfway up . On the Spring equinox , people gather all dressed in white to form a human belt around Pena_de_Bernal . eos
must have been at least three times higher than today . Many people make a pilgrimage to the highest point hikeable , visiting a little chapel about halfway up . On the Spring equinox , people gather all dressed in white to form a human belt around Pena_de_Bernal . eos
